Reviews.Title: “Great Price Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fitzs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for St Patrick's day. Location is spot on.5th Avenue at end of street, 2 Min walk from Empire State Building, 6 min walk to Times square. Hotel was a little out dated but room was a good size and clean. We had a Queen sized room for 5 nights. looking on the floor lay out it was a good choice, as some of the rooms looked very small. There are no views with the rooms but didn't book it for this. There is a coffee/tea vending machine in lobby between 7.00am and 10.00am then 3.00pm and 7.00pm. Dunkin doughnuts on the corner with good priced and lovely breakfast bagels. we took breakfast back to hotel for the free teas/coffee. the bed was comfortable,only had a little window which looked onto back of building which made room very dark, not a problem. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice budget hotel:encore”
Reviews.Author: daytay
Reviews.Content: two girlfriends and I spent four nights at the hotel mid-march .Our room was renovated,with two double beds, very comfortable,Clean room and bathroom,nice staff,the coffee in the lobby is good (and we are talking coffee latte). The location is great,one block from the subway,close to the Empire State bulding and the korean neighborhood where we found great inexpensive restaurants. We already plan to go back in 2012

Reviews.Title: “Harald Square”
Reviews.Author: Susie25524
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel when I stayed there a few years ago....it was clean, comfy, has a great location and the price was right. I´ve recommended it to all my German friends and they have all been very happy there. If you have ever stayed at any of the "tourist class" hotels in the city, you will appreciate this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: guywiz
Reviews.Content: I was at Herald Square two weeks ago and stayed there four nights (business/academic). Good quality/price trade-off. I had read beds were confortable -- I confirm. Rooms are a bit small, and depending on where you aer located front street) you may experience some noise. CLinky radiators didn't help either, I had to wear ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Sam M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated 2 blocks from the Empire State Building and just a few minutes walk from all the action of Times Square and theatre land. The hotel itself is decent enough from what you'd want from a hotel in this location. Our room was on the third floor, a little stuffy at times and the only draw back is the clanging radiators during the night. This woke us up most mornings and even after we'd made a complaint there was nothing to be done as the 'old' heating system couldn't be turned off. Our only gripe with what was a great stay in the best city in the world! The rooms are clean, newly refurbished and serviced daily, friendly staff and a truly brilliant location! Free tea/coffee/hot chocolate downstairs and wifi throughout the hotel. We'd definitely stay at Herald Square Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shay73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Nov 2011. Lovely clean rooms with really comfy bed, fresh coffee and tea in reception, friendly staff, excellent location. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for hat price!”
Reviews.Author: alexqt
Reviews.Content: of course the rooms are not in the best condition- ours was very small, no daylight and the window in the bedroom wouldn't open. also the heater was so noisy that we asked them to turn it off. but actually we didn't care too much about it cause the staff was friendly and the location of the hotel perfect. we didn't find anything similar for that price and since we didn't spend much time in the room anyway (only for sleeping- and the beds are extremely comfortable) it was a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value, great location”
Reviews.Author: coachvu
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our stay here. It is within easy walking distance to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, the Bolt Bus stop, and multiple subway lines. The lobby is a bit dated, but the staff members are all incredibly friendly. They have large lockers in the lobby to store your stuff for a nominal fee. The rooms must have been recently renovated, as they were much nicer than we expected for this price. Very large room and bathroom with hardwood floors and tile in the bathroom. Large flat screen at the foot of the bed with excellent lighting overall. For this price, we were shocked how nice it was. As for negatives, the hot water in the shower was a little weak, and our radiator randomly made a lot of noise periodically during the night. These weren't big deals for us, and we will definitely be staying again. I don't think you will find a place this clean and safe with such friendly staff in such a convenient location for anywhere near this price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MillyBrighton
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise, I booked one night here at the end of a trip and was very impressed with the value for money. Â£68 for a decent size bedroom with big bathroom, spotlessly clean and a friendly receptionist. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ShazB10
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. It was Â£40 per person per night. We had threee of us sharing one room with two double beds. The bathroom was small but adequate, a short bath but with a shower over it. The room was clean and so was the bathroom. The beds were comfortable with fresh white sheets. Fluffy white towels in the bathroom. The staff are friendly and helpful. They changed the remote control batteries straight away, for the tv. The coffee machine 7am-10am and 3pm-7pm is good and easy to use. The $2 a day lockers, we got a medium suitcase and a small one and a backpack in, so we could enjoy our last day. The location of this hotel is GREAT, it is around the corner from the Empire State building, a few minutes walk. If you travel into New York via train then from Penn Station it is only a nine minute walk along 31st Street. It is not five star, but you are not paying five star. It is a clean comfortable hotel between Broadway and Fifth Avenue. I would happily stay here again as the location was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeB_9
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from New York with my wife having spent 5 nights at the Herald Square Great location; many sights eg Central Station, Times Square, Macys etc etc are within easy walking distance The Hotel is very clean and our bedroom had a brass bed and wooden floors No problems with the neighbourhood Cant really fault it to be honest and would definatly stay again; for the $ I doubt it can be bettered Storage lockers for luggage a great bonus on our last day

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Place”
Reviews.Author: Christina J
Reviews.Content: My first trip to NYC me and my husband stayed at The Herald Square Hotel. And we absolutley loved it! Very comfortable and location was perfect. Not too far from central park and times square. I would highly recommend to anyone! It's home away from home! :)

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: IkariaCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Genteel old building. Former LIfe magazine offices.Quite small. Very conveniently situated; in the heart of things, close to subway, eateries, shopping.Good room, though little cupboard space.Breakfast not available. Free WiFi. Negatives: â€¢ Overheated rooms â€“ windows donâ€™t open, aircon too noisy to be used. â€¢ No means of making coffee/tea in room. No room service. Coffee station on ground floor open only at restricted times. â€¢ No normal front desk; receptionists operate from behind glassed-in cubicle!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location”
Reviews.Author: jrr150
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended for Tripadvisor opinions and I hve to say that the location is excellent. The best bed that I have slept. The only inconvenients are they did not server breakfast and the room was a inner room.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location, amazing rates”
Reviews.Author: SMV7
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three-night stay at Herald Square Hotel. The hotel is fantastic. Don't be swayed by the slightly run-down lobby (the concierge is behind a pane of glass); it really is a great hotel. We (girlfriend and i) stayed in a queen room and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the room. Simple but spacious, with a nice flat panel TV and large bathroom and entrance. To echo what others have said, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and the room had other notable features (large shower head, a well-lit vanity mirror that my girlfriend loved, a secure safe, dimmable lighting) that were a great plus. The hotel also has a coffee/breakfast area, full modern washer/dryers, and cheap lockers (to store bags before checkin/after checkout). The front desk was helpful, and the whole place is family-owned. We didn't have any hot water our first day there, but we didn't put up too much of a fuss and the water was toasty the next day. Also, our fire alarm beeped for low battery the first night, but after telling the concierge we didn't have any problems afterwards. Finally, on our last night, we did notice that we could hear the voices of the people on the room next door - not sure if they were being loud or if the walls were thin (or both), but it was noticeable. But the most valuable feature of this hotel is the location and the price. located just five minutes from Herald Square right in the heart of Manhattan, and a 10-15 min walk to Times Square, the location was perfect. It's not overlooking a busy street, so you don't need to worry about street noise all night long. And it's just 3 minutes from a great subway station that serves major lines that will get you anywhere you need to be. And it's a short easy walk to Penn Station. We will definitely be staying here again. No place would come close at this price, and you don't compromise quality at all.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Room? I think not.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelie1970
Reviews.Content: Don't check into a hotel where you are buzzed in to the lobby and the desk clerk sits behind bulletproof glass; in only gets worse from there.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: camjl
Reviews.Content: I guess we had an older room as I certainly wouldn't describe it as new or renovated. Seemed very dated, very small, but it seemed clean and the beds were very comfortable. There was a strange plastic/chemical smell to it. I think it was coming from the bathroom, so kept the door closed. The heater made a lot of noise. Street was quiet. Great location. Staff was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: jian9898
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel, and were very pleased for location and comfort. The room was quite small, but for sleeping- the bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom had a wonderful shower and even a chandelier hanging from the emensely high ceiling. It was close to Madison Square Garden, a block from wonderful Korean Restaurants - well beyond those at home in quality, and near some fun shopping near the edge of the garment district. It is in amazingly close proximity to the Empire State Building 1.5 short blocks. We never stayed this side of Times Square before and would stay again. Parking is only $22 with arrangement the hotel has with a garage on the next block- but not valet, which was still fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jamesmomanddad
Reviews.Content: We paid a bit extra for the kingsize bedroom and it was well worth the money. The room was big and the bathroom was huge. The bed was the most comfortable thing I have ever slept in and I had to take a running jump to get on it - heaven!! The hotel is ideally located, walk out the door turn left and in 200 yds you're on 5th Avenue staring up at The Empire State building. Only a short walk from loads of shops (not forgetting Macy's) on 34th St. Turn right out of the hotel and it's only a block and a half to Madison Square gardens (there's a taxi rank outside there if you need one back to the airport). The staff were very friendly, the coffee machine was ace and I couldn't fault this hotel - def recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AoI189852
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms, comfortable beds, good service, and a good location at a fair price (for NYC).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good choice, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: Veronica667
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. I had a billing issue after my stay and the staff acted promptly to have it resolved which I was very impressed with. When we first arrived we weren't sure about our choice but once in the room, we were pretty satisfied. I would consider staying here again. Pro's: - Great location for access to Macy's, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, tourist buses and Penn St Station - The renovated rooms, though small (which must be a New York thing) were really nicely decorated, comfortable and warm - The room was always clean Con's - The lifts are quite old and can take a while, but this is a very minor issue - One side of West 31st St felt a little dodgy at night (but that isn't a hotel issue)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EdwardSalmon
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade to a suite on arrival and it was just so nice. Great location for down town New York with the Empire State Building being very close by. I will go back

Reviews.Title: “cheap and nice hotel right in the heart of the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: prochazka
Reviews.Content: just around the corner from Empire State Building, in the very heart of Manhattan, a few steps from two Subway stations, recently refurbished, clean, CHEAP with a friendly staff; just be adviced, rooms fronting the street, just like the one I had, can be VERY noisy at night, nevertheless if I managed to sleep anyway, given my problems at falling asleep, everyone can make it, but better ask for an internal room

Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: maehem
Reviews.Content: Basic, no frills hotel. Not much else I can say about this place. It was situated in a convenient location, close to many of NY's attractions, walking distance to subways and train stations. Service was not great, but I can't exactly say it was bad either. The staff did what they were supposed to do, without a skerrick of a smile or a hint of warmth... yet they were not unfriendly. Just indifferent I suppose. The room was ok sized, but very very very HOT (granted it was Summer). We had to keep the air-conditioner on the entire time we were in that room, which we didn't have to do anywhere else in the US. The bed was comfy. The bathroom was clean and spacious however, it is very dark, and there isn't much ventilation in there. The water pressure was really terrible. The cost to stay was fine by Manhattan standards, however, if you could afford a bit more, you will probably get a better room in a similar location. Our budget was tight, and we were there for just 1 night and 1 night was enough. The room was quite miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Herald Square Hotel very adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jenn077
Reviews.Content: Came to NYC with a friend for a weekday trip. They have a deal with a parking garage around the corner, park for $22/24 hours. Pleasant staff. Close to Madison Square Garden. Adequate hotel with no frills. Room could have been a little cleaner. Room was small, but did not spend a lot of time in it. Staff was helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the price”
Reviews.Author: AnnJ1961
Reviews.Content: Our plan was to get up early and explore and not spend much time in a hotel. So we did not require a huge lobby, restaurant on site, swimming pool etc. This was perfect for us. We had the most recently renovated room with a king sized bed and a king sized bathroom. It was extremely clean and even spacious for NYC. There were two little chairs to sit in to wait while the other one got ready, but usually we just left. The front desk was very helpful, even leaving their little enclosed area to come help get us in/out the door. There is a small lobby area for coffee that was ok. The hotel is located, in mid town, just a few short streets from Macy's and a subway entrance, making it very convenient. Restaurants are all over so we did not need one in the hotel. I felt clean and safe, but didn't have to spend $1000.00 a night. We wanted to get up early to explore, but found ourselves sleeping in later each morning because it was so quiet. The hotel has quite a history as the building for the first "Life" magazine headquarters.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get me wrong...not complaints, just comments”
Reviews.Author: LindseaMac
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed overnight this past weekend. The hotel is in a very convenient location, is clean, the personnel are friendly and helpful, the beds are very comfortable, and the very plush, heavy towels were lovely. We were given one of the pre-renovated rooms with 2 double beds [Room 703], so I can't comment on the renovated ones. It was very small. Since most hotels/motels [even the budget chains]have both complimentary toiletries and hair dryers in the bathrooms, the fact that they didn't was a little surprising especially considering the cost of the room@ $381.00 for the Saturday night [they do have nice, small-size AVEEDA soap bars]. We were able to borrow a hair dryer at the front desk, no charge.The woman at the front desk said they also have the toiletries at the desk - you need to ask for them - not sure if they are free. The heat from the radiator couldn't be controlled, and, as it was warm in NYC for this time of year [December], it was really uncomfortably hot in the room, requiring us to turn on the air-conditioning overnight. One bed was very close to the bathroom door which opens out - a bit inconvenient for the person sleeping in that bed. Only that bed has a small, mounted shelf next to it. The other bed closer to the window has none, is against the wall, and there's not much distance between the beds. With no bathroom exhaust fans, only a vent, it made for very steamy showers.There are two desk chairs, a small closet and a fold-up luggage rack. They do have very cool coffee/hot cocoa/hot water for tea machine in the lobby, but it is not available 24 hours/day. There is a DUNKIN'DONUTS on the corner of Fifth Ave. & 31st St., as well as a couple of cafes, a deli and a CVS close by. I would guess the room rate was high as it was a Saturday and a pre-holiday weekend, and I booked directly with the hotel. As I said, these are not complaints, just comments on my experience. An added bonus is THE HIGHLINE, the elevated walkway near the Hudson River, which is only a few blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Agouradeb
Reviews.Content: We owe this hotel big time! Not only is this architectural landmark clean, lovely and newly renovated, they gave us a room when we were left stranded by a place in NJ. All of the desk staff are lovely and went out of their way to help us. They have ready access to reasonably priced drivers, good restaurants in the area, knowledge about public transportation and the environs. Just 2 blocks from the Empire State Bldg, this hidden gem is the BEST deal in Manhattan. Enjoy the 12 ft. ceilings, the pamphlet about the history of the building (LIFE magazine), huge, comfortable new beds, flat screen tv, and beautiful marbled bathrooms, all for less than $250. per night, including taxes (as of November, 2011). Our room was big. But in a building that is over 100 years old, every room is going to be a different size. The location, price and customer service make this place THE place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mystictraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in 2009 the coldest weekend of the year, we came in for the International Motorcycle show at the Javits center. We paid $100 for our room. It was small but clean and everything worked. Bed was ok, didnt sleep much due to fire trucks, police sirens and horns honking all nite. Room was nice and toasty! Would stay again but not on the streetside of this hotel. I liked the history of the place that chains dont have.

Reviews.Title: “Best value I found in NYC”
Reviews.Author: normalfolks
Reviews.Content: Looked and looked for a decent price on a room for one night. Rates were very high for some reason during our last visit to NYC. Finally found a room for a decent price in Manhattan. Real small room but very clean and quit. Nice comfy bed,slept great. Although the room was small it was recently updated. Nice size flat screen tv. Free wireless was a plus. Good free coffee in the lobby. A short walk from Empire State building. If your going to 9/11 memorial, be sure to sign up online for tickets (free) before going there.

Reviews.Title: “November in New York”
Reviews.Author: mid-age-travellers
Reviews.Content: Great location - most places are within walking distance. Hotel itself was clean and overall comfortable. Bedroom was next to a "service shaft" so very noisy (room 106) and very little daylight penetrated. Neighbourhood was ok if a little grim but seemed safe enough. Watch out for the taxes which add about 30 dollars a day to your room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Our new hotel choice for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lucdigital
Reviews.Content: For the last few years, we've stayed at the New Yorker on 8th Ave., but were less than happy with our room in autumn 2010, so looked around for something else in the midtown area. After reading reviews here and elsewhere, we decided to give the Herald Square Hotel a try - a very good decision, as it turned out! First things first - this is *not* a hotel for you if you expect tremendous views from your bedroom. However, with that caveat in mind, it has much to offer, in terms of location (15-20 minute walk from Times Square, slightly longer to Chelsea/West Village), cleanliness (spotless), comfort (the beds in the 2 rooms we stayed in were great), and service (very friendly and responsive, with one minor exception noted below). We stayed for 6 nights, but this was divided between 2 rooms (904 - 'standard room' with 2 full-size beds; 219 - 'renovated room' with one full-size bed - 1st night only in 904). Both rooms were clean, with the same (very comfortable) mattresses. 904 was carpeted and 219 had laminate flooring - but the real difference is in the bathrooms - the renovated bathroom was a joy - HUGE bathtub/shower (showerhead the size of a dinner plate - not a *power* shower, but more like your own personal waterfall)! Really appreciated after spending ~8-10 hours walking each day! Lots of fluffy towels, very nice Aveda toiletries. Also, very good lighting in the bathrooms and the rooms (lack of sufficient lighting was one of my complaints about the New Yorker). Other points - the wifi worked perfectly throughout our visit, we never felt hassled by staff because we stayed in until 11:30-11:45 most mornings, no charge to store our bags on the last day of our visit (also unlike the New Yorker), free coffee/tea/sweets during mornings and early evening, comfortable old leather armchairs as well as tables in the downstairs lounge area... Finally, the one little niggle - the TV remotes in both rooms didn't work, and our request that it be fixed in the second room didn't change that. This was an issue only because the bed was quite a distance from the TV in the second room, and the controls on the TV itself were difficult to see as the TV was mounted on the wall. (Opening the remote casing showed why the problem existed - the batteries probably hadn't been changed in over 2 years, and had corroded. My husband, who travels a lot for work, says this is the most common problem he encounters in hotels.) I did let the management know about this problem on my comment card as we left. Otherwise, no complaints and much satisfaction. We'll certainly make reservations there for our next visit to the City.

Reviews.Title: “No hestitation recommending this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: discovery204
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Herald Square as a family of 4. We paid for the renovated rooms. Although at first sight the check in desk and lobby looked a bit 'budget' everything else was perfect. The rooms were great, a reasonable size, well equipped and very clean, OK we didn't have a view but that meant that our rooms were totally silent at night and for NY that is rare! The bathrooms were very spacious and newly decked out with big white fluffy towels changed daily. As we were on a long holiday it was great that there was a washing machine and dryer in the basement. The coffee station in the lobby was also a bonus. The staff were friendly and saw from our booking that we were a family so gave us our own 'private' corridor where only our 2 rooms were situated. The location is the best! Everywhere is within walking distance and the subway is very close. We walked with our suitcases to Penn station to go onto to Washington (5 mins). There area seemed very safe, just round the corner to the Empire State Building and plenty of little dinners for breakfast. A great small and well-priced hotel. I read Trip Advisor extensively before we went and the hotel lived up to the reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Roomy”
Reviews.Author: book909
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC on our way to a family wedding in PA., so that we could catch up with old friends and relatives, as well as take in the sights. The Herald Square Hotel was in great shape. There were 2 elevators, one appeared to be the original and was a little small, but the other was big and roomy enough for us, our 4 suitcases and another couple. The room was a good size and the bathroom was very large, with 2 sinks and a soaking tub. There was some street noise on Thursday night, but it disappeared on Friday night so we think Th. night was a fluke. The front desk clerks were very helpful as well, giving us directions as needed. We would definitely stay there again. As for location, this hotel was in a perfect spot for seeing the city. We walked around the corner to take the Empire State Building tour, hopped on a nearby subway to see the Ground Zero Memorial and the Museum of Natural History, walked about 10 blocks in one direction to a Whole Foods store, and about 10 in the opposite direction to reach Times Square,Toys R US etc. Additionally, restaurants/eateries/drugstores are not in short supply around this area, so all needs were easily met.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: portmagpie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Herald Square, over a 100 year old building originally built by Life Magazine owner, no room available until after 3.00pm, so we checked in our baggage and headed off to the Empire State Building which is a 5 minuet walk away. Checked into our renovated room number 116 on the first floor about 5.00pm, first impressions were of a reasonable size room with a lovely large renovated bathroom and a nice queen size bed. As rooms go it was a satisfactory size, however it was very dark due to the only 2 room windows faced into an inner well, even in the middle of the day lights had to be left on. Too long in the room and you would come out with a night club tan!! The real problem for us however was the room air conditioner an in the wall 1970s model (at a guess) which when operating sounded like a Boeing 747. As well as this there were another 4 Air Conditioning units within a 3 metre radius of the rooms 2 windows which meant the windows could not be left open during the night due to the excessive noise they generated and as it was not possible to run our noisy unit this meant a trying to get some sleep in a very hot and stuffy room. We did mention the noise problem to management who said if we had mentioned it earlier they would have changed the room for us. We would suggest that if staying at this hotel do not get room 116. Apart from this problem we found the hotel good value for New York, position was good, between 5th and 6th Ave and about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Around the corner in Fifth Avenue the Big Taxi run a bus service to see the New York sites, try them as the were about half the price ($50 USD total for 2 persons) of other sight seeing buses, ask for a seniors price (if you are seniors) and the ticket we had allowed us to use the service for 2 days Would we stay at the Herald again, yes we would, but not room 116 and look at paying the extra for a deluxe room as they looked great and had large windows and plenty of light. The hotel offers free Wi Fi

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Maaike L
Reviews.Content: At first, the bed was very comfortable! The best hotel bed i've ever experienced. The matress was very high and it was not too hard en not too soft. Perfect! Per person you have two pillows, one soft and one a bit harder, something for everyone. The room was neat and gets cleaned every day. It's real nice to come back to your hotel after a long day and smell the fresh towels and sheets. The bathroom was nice and clean. We had a small bathtub with a good shower. The shower had a good pressure too. Another great thing was the coffee at the lobby. You can choose the coffee you like, they have many choices. The hotel location was in the center of New York. With a 3 minute walk you we're at the Harold Square where you can take several subway lines to all of New York. The Empire State building is literally around the corner. For breakfast, lunch and diner there are many places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: MrKitty
Reviews.Content: Booked a newly refurbished room. We were upgraded upon arrival. Very spacey, comfortable bed, large bathroom. The air con was loud - not a problem for me, but would be for some. Only negative - the shower temperature was not constant. Apart from that, totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! :)”
Reviews.Author: isabel_msoares
Reviews.Content: So ok, there is a bullet proof glass at the check in desk... But besides that, the hotel is actually pretty good. The staff was very friendly, the room was very nice, clean and spacious, and the location is great! Very near to Penn Station, MacyÂ´s or Empire State!! There is no breakfast included but youÂ´ll get free coffee, tea and hot chocolate. I would definitely recomend this hotel and would stay there again and again! Great Value for price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice tourist hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ScottConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Herald Square back in August. Booked on-line directly with hotel. Hotel lobby has glass partition at check in desk. First impression was "here we go" but dont let it fool you. Room was newly renovated with pergo flooring and new bedding. Large and extremely clean bathroom. Very quiet location at night which is good. 3 minute walk to the 34 street subway station which has many lines. Staff very friendly and helpfull. Great value here...will be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend Herald Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P-p-p-penguin
Reviews.Content: Room, including sheets was dirty. Not worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings....”
Reviews.Author: JAEMH
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. Close to Penn station, Macy's is around the corner as well as many restaurants. Even the UN is on a walking distance (30 minutes walk). The hotel is not build as a hotel and either you experience this as something special or you do not like it at all. The entrance is somewhat strange with the bullet proof reception. It's safe (but is the area so dangerous?) and because of the glass contacts with the staff are very distanced. It was hard to make a reservation directly at the hotel. The staff provided strange information and were not very helpful. However, when we arrived this was different. We were properly checked in and sollutions very found for some of the too noisy rooms. The hotel rooms are however very different. They differ in size and quality, so make sure you get a proper one. The renovated rooms are nicely decorated and have an excellent bed. Due to the lack of fresh air (no windows that you can open) it can be very warm inside. Coffee is free available in a small side room next to reception. The hotel also offers washing facilities and lockers for luggage storage (you have to pay). The price is for NY term quite ok, especially in the period that the UN has it mayor gatherings.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Eva461972
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights this September 2011. The hotel is located on a dirty and unrepresentative street with horibble smell from garbage water and facing some ugly buildings. The entrance of the hotel is unfriendly since the doors are always locked and the front desk staff is separated from the guests by bullet proof glass. When we asked the manager what the reason was for that, he answered that he found it unnecessary but his boss likes to have his staff in a safe work environment although nothing ever happened... That gave us a creepy feeling. We stayed in many hotels in the world, but we never have seen hotel staff working behind bullet proof glass. Makes me think... The lobby has a very low ceiling and isn't very nice decorated, neon light. Free coffee and tea during the whole day and night. The corridors in the hotel are very dark, narrow and warm, so are the elevators. Good thing about the hotel: the rooms are clean, the bed was good, clean new towels. The common area's are very clean too. There is a lot of housekeeping staff around during the day. Unfortunately, the rooms were very warm and the airconditioning was extremely loud which made it impossible to sleep with the airco on. The rooms are facing blind walls. My biggest worry in this hotel was the escape route in case of a fire. Luckily we stayed on the second floor, so there would have been a chance to get out of the hotel by the very narrow stairways totally made out of dark green concrete. You will be able to climb out of the window on the 2nd floor, but then you will end up on a little platform squeezed in between 9 level high buildings, you can't escape from. For the first night we stayed in this hotel the rate was $347 plus tax. We stayed in a fantastic 4 star hotel in the Financial District the week before for the same rate. We travelled with a group of 10 people. We were the first couple that arrived. The leader of the group was arriving later that night. She was still on her flight. The manager did not want to let us into our room without the full payment of $347 plus tax for the first night as if we would run away. He repeated himself several times that the amount wasn't refundable. Even though we were 10 and the total payment should have been done that night. Don't believe the pictures on their website. Our room didn't even look close to what the pictures on the website look like. I would never recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean rooms! Super!”
Reviews.Author: BE-Pieter
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the staff gave us a upgrade to the queen-size bedroom. When we entered the room, it was superior! Nice clean room with a large bed! It could fit 4 persons! Free WiFi. The bathroom was recent (less then 1 year old) We paid the average NY bedroom price so we could not complain. Nothing bad to talk about

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient - great value”
Reviews.Author: ShibbyandTank
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 2 nights for our first trip to NYC. Hotel was easily accessible from JFK via LIRR and subway. Easy walk 5 min from Penn station. The room was more than adequate - spacious enough to open out a suitcase, bathroom clean and shower pressure was wonderful. Beds were heavenly to fall in to after a hard day of sightseeing and shopping. We stayed in room 714 - whether it was the floor level or our extreme tiredness but once windows were shut the traffic noise disappeared. The exterior of the hotel and collection of art work from Life magazines over the years add a touch of uniqueness. Late checkout was a blessing and the luggage storage facility ensured we made the most of every last hour in the big apple. Staff were friendly, efficient and informative. Overall a very enjoyable stay and would not hesitate in recommending Herald Square Hotel. Not sure what a lot of extra money at more up-market hotels provide - but when all you need is a good sleep, good shower and great location this hotel ticks the boxes!

Reviews.Title: “The location makes it o.k.”
Reviews.Author: Phanil
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights to explore entire Manhattan. We did not have a "new" room and ours was to the street. What should we say? The hotel itself did have an athmosphere rather like a hostel than a hotel. The floors were kind of smelly. Our room was clean and o.k., however, should be redone soon. It was quite loud since the window to the street was not shut entirely because of the a.c. Still, what is perfect about the hotel is the location. Many sights are in walking distance and you can easily access several subway lines in a couple of minutes walk. Also, there are several dining and breakfast choices around, especially at Herald Square. All in all worth staying if one gets a good deal, does not need more than a clean room and a bed and might wanna choose a "new" room.

Reviews.Title: “better than a lot of 4* hotels”
Reviews.Author: ali24Newcastle
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable and extremely clean. I travel the world and stay on 4 and 5* hotels all of the time.. and I would be very happy to stay here again. The front desk staff were polite and efficient, and the hotel itself is in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location and best deal!”
Reviews.Author: tell1rst5
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay for a little getaway in a quaint hotel that had rooms that were exceptionally clean, shower heads that were great for tall people like my husband, and a very friendly staff. The location was great...a 15 min. walk to Times Square, and just a block or so to the subway. If you have a late flight and need to store your luggage, they provided a free locker for the day. We will definitely be staying here again should our travels take us back to New York City!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlita08
Reviews.Content: great location...nice staff....they took long to have our room ready but everything else made a plus. Laundry room available, free coffee on certain hours of morning and afternoon. Also it good be nice not to pay for lockers when leaving luggage until room ready!! We certainly recommend this hotel and would go back :D

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Juan_Carlos55
Reviews.Content: The old Life Magazine building is spectacular, and gives charm to the hotel. The rooms are great, with comfortable beds. The only downside is lack of certain services, but sincve it is New York it doesn't matter since everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Decivox
Reviews.Content: After looking over countless hotels, me and a few buddies decided to book at this one because it was very well priced and had good reviews; we werent let down! The hotels location is great, it is close to a lot of attractions and close to the subway lines. The rooms were very clean and well kept, and the shower was warm and had plenty of water pressure. The only let down was the bill at the end, due to the NYC hotel taxes. If I were to go again, I would probably stay in Jersey (but this isnt the hotels fault).

Reviews.Title: “Have recommended over and over and never been let down.”
Reviews.Author: 3GenerationsPerth
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Herald Square Hotel three times and always recommend it to friends visiting New York. The fifth couple that we told about it have just returned, as satisfied as we have been. It's in a great location, very reasonably priced and most importantly, has very comfortable beds and spotless bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and well-priced room”
Reviews.Author: jsnwilmnc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel August 2 through August 5. This was not my first stay at the Herald Square, but it's been several years since my last stay. The rooms (or at least mine) have been updated and remodeled. My room was a New Large Queen Room. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was large, clean and modern, and best of all the air conditioning worked well and the room was dark and cozy for a good night's rest. I was at the end of the hallway, away from the stairs and elevators. The room also came with free wireless access and there is a pretty good coffee maker in the lobby. If you know the area, there is excellent cab and subway service, although I prefer going out in different parts of town. The only downside is the front desk. It gives you the impression you are in a rough neighborhood, which of course is not the case. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice room on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Always return here”
Reviews.Author: PrivateEyes
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Rooms have been refurbished and we had a queen room which was very big with a massive bathroom which had aveda products which was a lovely touch. This hotel is great value for such a good hotel considering what new york charges for its hotels. Second time to this hotel and will always use it as it is right around the corner from macys and a lovely deli called speedys.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean & convenient”
Reviews.Author: ymesian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was voted the cheapest budget hotel in Manhattan & it lived up to its reputation. We arrived in NYC after a long haul flight from Sydney, Australia. We were greeted by Monica, she was extremely pleasant and helpful. We were allowed to check in early 9am which was a welcomed relief :) Our room was surprisingly spacious and clean (thanks to Ursula our housekeeper), the bathroom was large and had a huge bath for those long soaks after a big day out sight seeing. The bedding and mattress were very comfie! Complimentary tea/coffee machine downstairs, no kitchen facilites. Laundry & dryer were also available onsite. Yes our room was on the noisey side (street frontage) but hey your in New York its loud, busy and bustling so its to be expected. Would we stay here again...? most definitely! do we recommend this hotel to other travels....? for sure!! if your on a budget and looking for a central location (2 blocks away from Macys and Penn Station) then Herald Hotel is for you :)

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, great place.”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a few block from The Empire State and Macy's, a few block down to Times Square and you have all kinds of stores, restaurants, electronics nearby. You don't have to walk long distances to get anywhere. The Hotel is clean and safe. You don't have to worry about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Dark value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ezis
Reviews.Content: My reasoning to choose this hotel was: it was promised as value for money and it was close to Penn station. It fulfilled both: price $170 per night and 5-10 minutes walk from station. Hotel is quiet basic, but my room was large enough. Bath tube was quite used but generally room was clean, quiet and had all necessary things. Important for me: free wi-fi. One possible problem, as room was "L" shaped with small window on the upper tip of "L" opening into inner shaft of building, it was dark all day thru. As I didn't stay in hotel daytime that didn't bother me much. In case if it is important for you- ask for different room. To leave your baggage after check-out you have to pay $5. I spent 4 very nice days in NY and this hotel helped me a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, decent accommodations but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: pixie5008
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheapest hotels in the area that still got decent reviews. For the most part, I was satisfied with our stay. The location was ideal - so centrally located that we never even needed to use the subway. (There is one right around the corner though, if you do want to use it.) The lobby, elevators and halls seem a bit dated, but it turns out that the building is the historic site of Life magazine, which gave the decor a bit more charm. The staff was pleasant enough, but not very personal - we never interacted with anyone who wasn't behind the glass-enclosed desk. They do give you a good map and a subway map when you check in which is nice. The room was fine, but nothing too special. Nice TV, comfortable bed, nice bathroom. There was a support beam in the middle of the room which was a bit odd, but not a big problem. Our biggest complaint was that the street noise in the mornings was very loud. I think there was construction being down on the building next door which meant loud noises at 6am every day. Not sure if it is always like that. The air conditioning unit was also extremely noisy, but luckily it wasn't hot enough to need it. Overall, the hotel was just fine for a few days for a tourist trip to NY. I would consider staying here again because the rates were so good for the location. I would make sure to ask for a renovated room though, and maybe bring some ear plugs... Beware - all New York hotels will charge you room fees and taxes when you check out. This was a very large additional cost and could be a nasty surprise if you aren't prepared for it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: myzygy
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write a glowing review, because I want to keep this treasure to myself! This hotel is extremely clean, extremely comfortable, and very reasonably priced. The bathroom was large and had a nice soaking tub, perfect after walking NYC each day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: MelRi82
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when I walked into the room. It was very clean and the bed was comfortable! Great hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for exploring NY”
Reviews.Author: angi1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Heral Square hotel for 6 nights in June. It was in a perfect location to explore NY, just 3 minutes walking from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, and in 5 minutes walking you could reach 8 or maybe more subway lines. Room not so big but absolutely comfortable, new, clean with private bathroom which was also nice. Just one complaint about the floor of our room (first floor, in the back of the building), so we lacked view and light from outside, but it was not a problem since we spent at the hotel just the night. There is no breakfast, but there's a coffee (and tea machine) near the reception, with some biscuits and/or candy bars, so you can do a small breakfast. Just a curiosity: the building was once the headquarters of Life magazine, so every floor has magazine covers hung by the wall. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice room”
Reviews.Author: tangogurl
Reviews.Content: Surprised to see that the room was much better than the lobby area. Room has a nice comfy bed, and everything is clean. A/C works well. Name brand toiletries is a plus. Location is within walking distance to Empire State Building, Penn Station and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and small”
Reviews.Author: Juggie305
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean (bug free) big tv and the bed was comfy but it was small it almost felt like a long hall way but none the less we have a nice view of a few other buildings. It was really close to the epire st building and a short walk to all the major attractions in nyc. over all it was a nice little hotel in the middle of everything. front desk was helpful with getting us a taxi back to the airport and also pointing out some place to go/eat.

Reviews.Title: “basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: UkAnnabel
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights in June. overall, had good stay. double room better size than expected, basic but reasonably clean. bathroom okay bar the shower. staff overall were friendly. enterance hall decor rather off putting and dated. rooms could do with coffee maker/kettle - there is a machine to use free in dining room but can only be used a certain times, which was rather annoying. location for the price was the best point for us - close to penn station and main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “So..so..”
Reviews.Author: Karzack
Reviews.Content: I guess the good location made up with anything that 's lacking from the hotel..reasonably clean and good free wi-fi connection..

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the decor put you off”
Reviews.Author: blondey2011
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the corridors are very dated and quite off putting when you enter. But, the rooms are clean and we paid to have a re-furbed room so no problems with decor for us. Lovely bathrooms although hot water was sometimes very scarce. Rooms are quite small, even for a european, but you only have to look at what you are paying for such a great location to know you can't have it all!

Reviews.Title: “Overall O.K. with Areas that need Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Fourseasondreamer
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at the Herald Square Hotel. I was housed in room 500 which faces 31st Street. While my stay overall was satisfactory I would be negligent if I failed to mention some significant observations. My room had not yet been renovated. It was quite small, as expected, but would not accomodate more than one comfortably. The "surface' was quite clean but with no effort observed hair on the toilet paper dispenser, dirt and debris on the bed skirt and laundered stains on the comforter cover. The mattress does have a completely insulated mattress which is positive if one wants to avoid bed bugs. What became annoying was the void of any electrical outlets anywhere near the bed. The alarm clock sits on the desk...5 steps from the bed. The lights above the bed are on a dimmer but you must stretch completely accross the bed or physically get out of bed to adjust it. The t.v. is on top of the hutch making the bed the only place to watch it. The a/c temperature is "regulated" or "not cold enough" as I prefer to say. The a/c was just loud enough to drown out the street noise but not quite loud enough to eliminate the fire truck siren blasting from the fire house a couple hundred feet away. Even with ear plugs it was VERY noisy. The shower was satisfactory but a complete crap shoot as to water temperature which changes with each flush, shower and sink use. The hotel does provide some very nice soap and shampoo. While the staff was very friendly and helpful the setting is not warm or welcoming. You get buzzed in from people who sit behind a plastic cage. The entire lobby area is reminicint of an icky 1970's pay by the day or week hotel, which it may have been back in the day. They are clearly trying to remedy this situation but haven't quite succeeded. The history of the hotel is very cool. Very close to the subway and restaurants. I paid $179.00 plus tax per night. It was closer to a $120.00 a night room. I can't say that in a pinch I wouldn't stay there again but maybe in an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great location in mid-town”
Reviews.Author: GeorgefromSF
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here over the years after my friends in New York moved away. The best part is the location. I do not hang out in mid-town but choose this location is near the red, orange, yellow and blue subway lines, and also centrally located for walking downtown. The rooms have been upgraded over the years and the beds are very comfortable. The staff are helpful and the room is always clean when returning at night. Free brewed coffee in the morning. The only thing I can criticize is they need to discontinue the door buzzer, as there are staff at the front desk 24/7. The only

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Liv84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter holiday, and though I found the entrance and the elevator quite shabby, I was pleasently surprised when we got our room. Everything was very clean, the room was spacious, beautiful, big bathroom, huge bed and tv etc. Also loved that the bathtub was big enough for two people, and that there was a lighted make up mirror in the room. My only complaint is that there was no fridge, but it seems that many of the hotels in this price range lack fridges. It is also in a great location, a short walk from Penn station, and just around the corner from fifth avenue and Empire State building. Would absolutely recommend it to others visiting New York on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: NandPOxford
Reviews.Content: Great value small hotel situated about as conveniently as any other for New York city. Rooms very nice, clean & plenty big enough. Bed was particularly comfortable. Unfortunately there is no food facility other than a basic drinks/snacks lounge. There is however & very good cafe just around the corner. The heating system, being old, is a bit noisy when it kicks in & did cause a bit of disturbance.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at a "Economy hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Trinityfly
Reviews.Content: Herald Square Hotel May 14-24, 2011 New York arguably has the most expensive accommodations in the US. Just check on Trip Advisor or Hotels.com or even Google and you will find eye popping tariff on nightly accommodations. We were on a limited travel budget so we were in the market for a â€œeconomy hotelâ€�. We chose the Herald Square hotel on W 31st Street. First off, its location was just great, one block from two subway entrances, one block from the Empire State Building, one block to Broadway, one block to Korea Town, 3 blocks from Penn Station and less than 1/2 block to 5th Ave. The Herald Square hotel is a 100 room facility housed in the building that once housed Time Magazine. Indeed, hung on the walls of the hallways in the hotel are many interesting images taken from Time Magazine covers from the past. This was an office building prior to its conversion to new use, a hotel. That means that the room size was based on what once was office space. The rooms are small. But the conversion overall was pretty well done. The Hotel has no doorman but a buzz in, buzz out affair that actually worked out very well for us. There is someone at the desk 24/7. There is a minimal lobby with a coffee bar offering coffee, tea and hot chocolate. No breakfast is served and there is no room service available. Meals may be ordered in but it seemed most guests preferred to go out to the scores of restaurants in the surrounding blocks. Our first experience with hotel staff was when we checked in, it was about 11 pm and we were assigned a room on the 7th floor. When we went to that room we couldnâ€™t believe how small, â€œsmallâ€� really was. In that room if two adults were to open just two bags on what available horizontal space there was then the two adults could not move around except into the bathroom. Staying in that room for 1 night much less the 6 nights seemed impossible. We had to do something. We then contacted the hotel employee at the front desk and asked that we be moved to any larger room available. He said there were none, so we went to dinner to think about our options. After dinner we returned to the hotel and checked once again with the front desk to see if we had choices at all for the Herald Square. A different employee was at the desk when we made this inquiry and after he checked the available rooms he said sure and handed us a key to a room on the 8th floor. When we checked this room it was at least a third again larger than the postage stamp sized room we were first given. Still small but not impossible. Overall our stay was very good. The hotel halls were clean as were the two elevators. In general housekeeping was excellent, in fact they changed our sheets and pillow cased every day. Once when we needed an extra towel we call the front desk and the towel was at our door in 5 minutes. Later in our stay we asked the front desk for a wake up call, they said they would and they did. Another occasion I asked for a taxi or car service and they arranged that without problem. Internet wireless connectivity was available throughout the hotel. We paid $179 per night for our room but with 15% taxes and room fees the actual cost was about $206.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room at reasonable rate (for NYC!)”
Reviews.Author: MainSt
Reviews.Content: I had to find a room for the night with about a week's notice. Based on the positive tripadvisor reviews, I decided to go with this hotel as I wanted it to be near Penn Station and didn't want to spend a fortune as I would only be spending one night. Pros: I arrived at 10 a.m. hoping to drop off my bag, and was able to check in immediately. Attractive facade. Very friendly and welcoming staff. My freshly painted room and bathroom, overlooking 31st St, was spacious, perfectly clean and suited my relatively basic needs. Very near public transportation and many dining options to suit all budgets and tastes. I know there were people staying in the rooms next to me, but I could not hear them when in my room. Plenty of towels and complimentary Aveda hand soaps. Cons: So fresh was the coat of paint that I had to keep the windows open at night. The entry area to the hotel and the hallways outside the rooms reminded me of a youth hostel, with its tiled floors and slightly dated decor. Some of the furniture in the room was dated (chairs and closet) with aging fittings, and the room was carpeted (not the shiny hardwood floors shown on the website). No iron available to use in your room, but there was a steaming device in the laundry area that worked well. If you are on a budget, this would be a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “really great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: eedeecee
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Almost right under the Empire State Building, near the Flatiron building, in walking distance of Union Square etc. How central can one be? Room 208 had no view but was very quiet, no sounds of the traffic outside and no noise of other guests nor elevators. It is clear that the rooms have been thoroughly refurbished recently and upgraded. Compared to NYC standards the size of our room/bathroom was huge. Ultra- comfortable Queen size bed. We were impressed by the service of the housekeeping, everything was very clean. Flat-screen TV, a CD player-radio and free wifi-internet and complimentary (good) coffee from a machine in the lobby downstairs. There is even a laundry! And an ironing board inside the room. Very friendly and helpful staff that is working hard to satisfy every need. We were truly well pleased with our choice, perhaps the best experience in a hotel of this class in NYC so far. Really great value for money. We will be back. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, friendly, and the best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: GregHartley
Reviews.Content: One fact is tremendously clear about the Herald Square Hotel, you can tell that they are working very hard to do well. Even as you walk down 31st street towards the building, the hotel front stands out as the only clean building on the block. Pros: Building has been recently remodeled from top to bottom. New mattresses (I can't stress this enough), new paint, even new gold leaf on the exterior. Free coffee and excellent meeting place for tired groups who like to chat. Secure building with buzz-in entry. Two blocks from Empire State Building. Subway right around the corner. Little Korea on the next block up (24 hours restaurants!). Historical building. High ceilings in rooms. Best price we could find in Manhattan, and that's after an EXTENSIVE search. Permits 4 guests per room (most Manhattan hotels only permit triples). Cons: Location is in a slightly dingy part of town (31 St between Broadway & 5th). Rooms a bit small. Laundry facilities, while brand new, are pricey. The web site nails it: Herald Square is a boutique hotel at budget prices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Katynycjc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few NYC hotels and this one was by far the best ever. I stayed in a queen size new room, loved the hardwood floors! I didn't have to worry about whose been on the carpet! Bathroom was beautiful and spotless! Only problem was it took awhile to get warm water but it's an old building. Bed was defiantly comfortable and amazing! Brand new tv with great channels! Close to subway also!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: Alan2906
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on w31st between 5th & 6th avenues. We stayed 10 days March into April to visit our son. It is so well located you can walk uptown to Central Park, Times Square or downtown to Greenwich, the Financial District (twin towers site) Staten Island ferry, (which is free and goes right past the statue!) Little Italy etc with ease. All shopping avenues within easy reach, you'll never need a cab or bus.Maybe the subway if you're planning to go up to Yankee Stadium, 161st street. Short walk to Madison Square Garden if you're into ice hockey. Great lounge in the hotel with coffee machine. No kettle in the room, take your own if you like it when you wake up! Get a "queen" room, spacious, with large shower/bathroom, roomy & clean, with a good wall safe and TV. Good lifts and nice people. Breakfast within walking distance, try Cafe Martinique round the corner on 6th ave. For an Indian takeaway, 3 doors down from the hotel on 31st street is good. Like seafood, guiness and oysters? Rosie O'Donnells on 46th st. Good Irish bar with great shepherd's pie for lunch, "Blaggards" on 35th st. All within walking distance. This hotel is good value for money considering you are right in the middle of Manhattan. 9 out of 10 for Herald Square, we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “A rare thing in NYC! A clean and spacious hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: melissa20855
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 3 girlfriends for a weekend of fun to NYC. We have stayed in other hotels up there, and Herald Square Hotel is quite different than the typical NYC hotel room (which is usually 4 walls around the bed and hardly any floor space). The hotel is secure, the staff are polite. We were surprised at how much floor space we had in our room with two double beds! Having our own bathroom was nice too, and it was spacious as well. Our view was just of the building next door, but who cares? We weren't in there much. Also, I wouldnt really walk on the carpet without shoes on, but then again I guess that goes for any hotel. This hotel was a great price, and I have no complaints! The conveinent location to the bus station from DC and also to Times Square will make this my hotel of choice when shopping in NYC in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny room, uncontrollable shower temp made it not such a great deal”
Reviews.Author: Lolabadger
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, but room was small even by ny standards. It would have been ok if not for the shower situation. No matter how hard we tried to adjust the water temperature, it was either scalding hot or freezing cold! We avoided showering because of it! I just wanted to let people know this because most of the reviews of this place are so positive. For $200 a night (with taxes), I expect a decent shower. Even though that is cheap for ny, I would've paid more had I known what it would be like. I guess you get what you pay for..

Reviews.Title: “GEM OF A HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: pud3401
Reviews.Content: Herald Square on W 31st Street (just off 5th Avenue) and right underneath the Empire State Building, a two minute stroll to Macys department store. The building is beautiful outside with sweet Gold Cherubs adorned on the exterior front. Lobby is clean and always has newspapers available and two lifts (one suitable for two with cases) the other is smaller and just for people (or if you really want to squeeze your case in) I stayed for a week and our room was upgraded and a request prior to arriving was taken care of, Staff are lovely, room was cleaned and sheets changed every day. Its not the Ritz but its perfectly adequate for a stay as your in New York, why the hell would you want to stay in your room anyway ? I like it so much I got back on Sunday and have booked again already, I think that speaks volumes. ... Oh and there is a Chocolate and Wine bar right next door (Ayza) and a fantastic Irish Bar 150 yards up the road (O'Reillys) for great beer and the best steak in New York !!) Both have websites and are great to the hotels location for when your feet give out walking !! I wouldnt hesitate to reccomend this place, its such good value for money... The heating makes some fantastic sounds when coming on, to be honest left us laughing rather than being annoyed, I guess you cannot please some people who leave reviews that are derogatory to the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice but... what happened to the prices?”
Reviews.Author: holidays2059
Reviews.Content: The only reason I don't give 5 stars to this hotel is the amazing jump I have witnessed in their prices in the course of 4 months. They are improving the building, fine, but is it justified to shovel it up the customers' way that much? Anyways, we had appointed a standard double room; when arriving, the bed was unmade, and we realized the room had not been cleaned. The lady at reception immediately upgraded us to a renovated queen bed room, which was perfect, spacious, wooden floors instead of carpet, flat screen TV, superb bathroom. There's a coffee room downstairs where you can get free coffee anytime you want (appreciated), but the real star of it all is location, which is outstanding: near Macy's, Manhattan Mall, Madison Square Garden, Empire State building, etc. Time's square is a 20 minutes walk. Subway exit (34th street) steps away. All in all, if you get a deal on the price of the room, I would strongly recommend this hotel. According to other reviews, heating was noiosy, and we witnessed it as well. Let's hope they invest some the new rates money in fixing it!

Reviews.Title: “They came through again for us”
Reviews.Author: MaineBloggers
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, it took awhile to check in--we were asked to wait in the lounge for a few minutes, but then the (harried) clerk gave us a free upgrade to a nice big renovated room, like the one we'd had last spring. Our son and his girl friend got a tiny, very overheated room, and were moved to a another tiny room, but with reasonable heat. Don't count on having breakfast here, but there are three Starbucks in the neighborhood. The location is GREAT! Close to 5th Ave., subways, Empire State Bldg. and the Bolt Bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need, comfy bed, quiet street, good location”
Reviews.Author: jpsNYCfan
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in New York City, this time with a friend instead of family. I'd not heard of the Herald Square Hotel before, even though I stayed around the corner last year at the Hotel Stanford. The hotel holds alot of history as it was the original home of 'Life' magazine many moons ago. We arrived on Friday afternoon, a very snowy, one at that, but the sun was out and the sky was blue, what more could you want? We got a friendly welcome at reception and where allowed into our room right away (usually most hotels abide by a strict 2/3pm rule). To the right of reception is a small seating area with coffee served at various times throughout the day and a LOVELY seating area at the front of the hotel which made me feel like I was sitting in an old 1920's explorers living room. Fantastic. My first impression of the room was that it was outdated, VERY outdated. Faded carpet, light switches that look like something Thomas Edison himself installed and a really old, chunky TV. Not really what they show on their website. Having said that, we had two double beds with the nicest matress' I've ever tried. The bathroom was very small, not enough room to stretch out your arms, but again, the toilet/sink/shower where all new. Great power shower. I wasn't aiming at luxury as we got the room for Â£320 for 4 nights, I simply wanted somwhere to sleep...this fit the bill. Set in one of the quieter streets, it was nice to put your head down at night and listen to that typical NY police siren in the distance. Hotel is in a prime location, about 2 minutes from Herald Square, easy access to the Subway system and a 10, 15 minutes walk into Times Square. Also, the fact that the Empire State Building is 2 minutes away made it even better. My only real complain about the room is not wanting to get out of the comfy bed in the morning! Overall, I enjoyed my stay here. I loved the rustic feel to this family owned hotel and would reccomend staying here to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the location”
Reviews.Author: laopu
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Close to subway stations, Penn Station, lots of restaurants. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. For less than $130 per night (including tax), it is a perfect place for travelers to crash for night. There is locker for rent to store luggage. The locker is big enough for large backpack. Very basic service, but with the location, you do not need much service from the hotel, except bedding and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for new york”
Reviews.Author: CHrisCooper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived from the UK for an overnight stay before we took the train to Washington. We were very pleased with the hotel. it was close to Penn street station and the Amtrak. It was very clean and good value 150 dollars with tax included. Excellent value for manhattan. The room was large and the bathroom huge with a wonderful shower and deep large bath, again unusual for NY. I would certainly recommend this hotel for an inexpensive option right in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: ozcl
Reviews.Content: I travelled here by myself in Feb 2011 for 2 nights and would have no hesitation in heading straight back there. The value for the price is hard to beat! The location is very central and an easy walk or subway ride to most NY attractions. The highlight for me was arriving at 7am after flying in overnight, I dropped past the hotel to drop my bags so I could explore the city and was told I could check in 7 hours early for no additional charge! I have never experienced that elsewhere! The room was everything I needed, neat and clean, unless you are planning to spend hours per day in there then this is all you need. There was a little bit of noise from the street but not enough to stop me sleeping! Brilliant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Its great for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: DoctrineofGabe
Reviews.Content: After the snow storms in NY, getting to this hotel was a godsend. The massive bed itself is the reason you should stay here. Herald Square is actually the old LIFE Magazine location, so its actually historic. The other reason you should stay is that its between 5th and Broadway, so you can walk up to Times Square or down to Wall St in no time. WIFI is fine, the room itself is quite big for 1 person. Even if its the smallest room, its massive! They give you an AVEDA soap, it smells amazing. LCD TV is also great. Free coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable, so cheap!”
Reviews.Author: rachelsstudio_com
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 902 and had a wonderful experience. This hotel is in the old Life Magazine building, and I found it enriching to stay in a place where I could learn about the history - be sure to check out their website for more info. The beds were as comfy as the more expensive hotels, the room had been recently updated, and everything was very clean. The heat is from radiators and they did make some noise, but I'm a light sleeper and I did just fine. I just thought it added to the charm. The windows are small so even though the view is not bad, I didn't really get to enjoy it. The wine and chocolate bar right next door was fun for a night out, although expensive. There is a nice deli with lots of selections right around the corner. Korea town is also the next street over and we had a nice meal at BCD Tofu House, although there are tons of other asian restaurants there too. They let us check out at 1 too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: Fornish
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel clean, spacy enough in both room and bathroom and the staff friendly and helpful most of the time. We really did not have any expectations, since it was rather cheap, but when we arrived we were surprised by the good standard. The hallways were a bit rough around the edges but our room was immaculate.Our windows were not towards the street, which meant no noise from the city. However, the radiators were either noisy or too hot. But that was really just the only thing bothering about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent bedroom for this price in NY”
Reviews.Author: deca59
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, confortble bed, clean and new bathroom, excelent location. Just 5 minutes walking to times square. Nice staff. Ice and coffe machines and lots of candys on the lobby. Free wireless in room. Goog price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, best staff ever and made my trip even better!”
Reviews.Author: sallyc1985
Reviews.Content: Second visit to NYC, first time stayed in apartment so bit nervous making booking, used Tripadvisor for advice. I had delays getting to NYC due to flight problems and hotel staff could not have been more helpful or reasurring. Room was of the highest standard and amenities ideal; excellent wi-fi, lockers, safes, tea, coffee etc. For a solo traveller I wanted to feel safe and central and its a 2 minute walk from fifth avenue so ideal. Peaceful sleep and cleanliness excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly people”
Reviews.Author: affirmation
Reviews.Content: The people working in this hotel are totally negative. They never smile. They do not give a clear answer to you.

Reviews.Title: “shabby room”
Reviews.Author: weehoggie
Reviews.Content: Room was nothing like on hearld squares web site, roomwas tired looking shabby,and could do with agood clean up.Old steam heating system when heating comes on in room 908 you would thing some one is hitting raditor with hammer no sleep first night.Second night hotel fitter was called at 12 am only way to fix was to turn raditor off as he could not fix as it was an old system.Was offered 2 other rooms one smaller both were tired and grubby.Hotel staff great 100% location brilliant less than 10 mins from maceys empire state building and many shops .REAL PITY ABOUT ROOMS

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, fair rates, great location”
Reviews.Author: nelanddeb
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in this hotel and it was also fine this time. No restaurant here, but they do offer free coffee and cocoa within certain hours. There are restaurants in the neighborhood, and I liked the Europa Cafe in the Empire State Building 2 blocks away for a quick low-priced breakfast. The rooms both times were clean, but different sizes and shapes due to the character of the building. People at the front desk were friendly. About 2 blocks to the subway across from Macy's by the Empire State Bldg at Herald Square. Filtered water on tap.

Reviews.Title: “Has character”
Reviews.Author: Mohikaner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and we were quite taken by the charm after staying in a conference hotel immediately prior to this stay in the Herald. We really appreciated the coffee machine in the common area in the morning and after noons. I can't remember eating facilities in the hotel (I may be wrong) but being in NYC - that's not a problem. The room was quite small, we were on the first floor - can't remember the room number but the view wasn't too impressive (see pic). We kept the shutters closed as it made no difference if it was night or day, it was dark all the time. For the price we found it ok - we liked the location and were out for most of our stay anyway. Had we gone for a stay where we might have spent more time in a hotel room we might have chosen something else, but as a bolt-hole it's great. It's an old building narrow corridors in some areas with some of the original fixtures, which is part of the charm. At night, you have to be buzzed in, the staff were pleasant and helpful. Like someone else mentioned - and especially if you're not from the state or even the US the tax can be a bit of a surprise. It does not reflect on the hotel - I believe it would be the same in all hotels in the city - we were caught out too and had to pay quite a surcharge unexpectedly. Calculate that into your budget when checking out. It really takes away the sense of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, convenient, and a pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: circusliz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Herald Square hotel several times. Only once did we have a bad experience, when we ended up a room right next to the building's steam pipe. The pipe clanked loudly during the night and kept us up. But the hotel staff handled it well and moved us to a different room. Overall the hotel is a good reasonably-priced option for NYC. It's in a great location for shopping and transportation (Macy's and Penn station are nearby). Good subway access, and close to tourist hotspots, especially the Empire State Building. All in all the hotel is nothing to write home about, but seriously?!....who goes to NYC to tell their friends about their hotel!?

Reviews.Title: “Confortable, nice staff. Thanks Monica!”
Reviews.Author: Evandro13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Herald Square Hotel. The room was very confortable altough not too much spacious for 3 people. But who cares when you are in New York? The staff was incredbly nice and friendly especially Monica. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Quaint - Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cboyde
Reviews.Content: Our stay was October 23rd through the 26th and we loved it. Our room was quaint and comfortable. The bathroom was phenomenal. The remodel of the rooms and bathroom are very up to date and tasteful. The shower was amazing. Beds are most comfortable we have slept in at any Hotel ever. The location is great - you are only 2 blocks from the Empire State Building and withing walking distance of Times Square We arrive at about 6:30 am the day of check-in. The staff was very helpful in locking up our bag while we toured the city. The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. We completely enjoyed our stay and will stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellnt hotel all round!”
Reviews.Author: Parsissonhayes
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Herald Square hotel was excellent - its ideally located, only 5 min walk from the Empire State building and 10 minute walk from New York Penn Train Station that we came into.
