We were upgraded to a King Size room which was huge, clean and very comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful and I would definately stay here again when we next visit.

Reviews.Title: “No window! No amenities! No space! No one should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: citydwellerdg
Reviews.Content: What a dump! This hotel did not live up to the photos on the web site. The lobby looked like an old apartment building and the staff was behind glass. There was only one trolley for guests to bring their own luggage to the rooms. Each room was allotted only one key to share. There was no front desk service. The room had no shampoo, no hair dryer, no pitcher for water. The closet was so shallow the door would not close and so small only a suit and shirt filled it. The alarm clock was on a desk about 10 feet from the bed. The room was so small my husband and I (who are both thin people) could not pass each other to and from the bathroom. We had to squeeze sideways next to a wall to get into bed. The first room they sent us to (no bellhop to help you) had no window. They begrudgingly relocated us to a front room with a window. While it did, thankfully, open, there was no screen to stop bugs or birds (or vermin) from entering. There was no temperature control . Instead of having the typical back office to hold luggage, they offered tiny lockers that would hold maybe a small duffle bag at a fee of $2. The "lounge" had an inoperable coffee maker and there were none in the room. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: flippintubaterp
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I came up for a weekend to NY to go see the Metropolitan Opera. The hotel was a few blocks from Penn Station and the Subway--and of course Herald Square (Macy's, lots of other shopping). The hotel has lockers that you can store your luggage in if your room isn't ready yet (ours wasn't because we wanted to spend the day visiting museums and such, so we had an early start)--I believe it was $4 for the day--cheap for NY and LARGE; we fit both of our suitcases in there. The room was clean, the beds were comfy, and they had a nice flat screen tv in the room. We basically only used it to sleep and shower, but it was great for our purposes. We only had 2 real "issues" with the room: the window faced the next building, as most windows in ny do, however with the shutters closed, we didn't realize it was morning when we woke up because it was so dark in the room. Great for sleeping, not great when you want to get up in the morning and go walk around. The other issue was that the water in the shower would run at a great temperature and then go COLD!!! for a few minutes. We fixed it by turning off the water for a few seconds and turning it back on. And it happened a couple of times while showering. Yeah it was annoying, but whatever, not the end-all be-all. Overall, it was clean, comfortable, really convenient, and we would definitely recommend it to others and stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: SWPDXGUY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald Sq Hotel 5 or 6 years ago. I was in town for business, but I extended my stay a few days to take in the city. I stayed in the hotel 4 nights. My room was very small, but clean. It was the smallest hotel room I had ever stayed in.. The bathroom was nice though. I had a small window that looked onto an air shaft. It looks like from the pictures and the reviews that the hotel has been upgraded. I loved the location close to Penn Station and the other New York City attractions. I was able to get by on foot and the subway. I felt safe in the neighborhood, even late at night. I would recommend this hotel for folks traveling alone or people not caring about a fancy hotel. I'm not sure I would bring my family here (if I had one) as the hotel doesn't have many ammenities and the rooms are small. I wouldn't come here for a romantic trip either.

Reviews.Title: “OK - Not Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelScoop
Reviews.Content: The HOTEL/ROOM - is historic and not renovated. Its dark, dated and feels more like an old apartment building. The upgraded Queen room was nice decorated. You can tell the owners care about the experience of their guests when in the room. Room was clean - quality furnishings, linens and toiletries. Will need to run water for awhile to get a hot shower. More spacious than your average hotel room in NY. Linens are not changed daily. My bathroom door did not fully open - wall behind the door so you had to slide in sideways. SERVICE - Most of the front desk clerks are not very friendly. Monica is one who has an attitude. The Latino man behind the desk wants to argue with you. Witnessed his rudeness with immigrants who could not speak English well and needed help. Then he tried it with me. He's dismissive. However, there is one genuinely nice person, I think her name is Augusta. She actually smiled. SERVICES - They have coffee and tea at certain times of the day. It would be nice if they just put a microwave down there - what would it hurt? Free internet - runs OK. Satellite TV will shut down in the rain. OVERALL - Good location, but not a restful night with doors slamming throughout the day. TV reception not great. Stayed 4 nights, I would not want to stay again for a lengthy visit. The building is a little depressing - then you have to deal with rude staff after a long day. Enjoyed my rate which was under $150. Not worth $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret In New York City”
Reviews.Author: KAZLE
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel conveniently located. It is within walking distance to almost anything you would want to see and do. Even though we were not able to get one of their renovated rooms, our room, though small, suited our needs quite well....who stays in their room the entire time you are in New York?? This hotel had all the things I look for when staying at at hotel.....a good bed, good pillows, fluffy bath towels and plenty of hot water. They did not offer breakfast, but there was complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby. The staff was polite and helpful. For the money, this is a very good place to stay while you are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Rude woman at the front desk, but ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: ktkromann
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Herald Square Hotel two times. First time in the summer of 2007, second time in the summer of 2008. First time 12 nights, second time 9 nights. Mixed feelings when we look back at our stay. The first year we choose a renovated room with a King bed. It was on the second floor. The room was very small. It had a little entrance with tiles where you found the iron and ironing table. Then you had the room with desk, two chairs, king bed and bathroom. Everything was clean, but you hardly had any space to put your suitcases and the room was just big enough so you could walk around the bed. Bathroom was clean, but not big either. It has a window which looks out to a blind wall. The really thing that bothered us was the extreme loud air conditioning. Downstairs is a lobby where you can get some free tea, coffee, chocolate milk and candy/cookies. It all looked kind of cheap though. There is a vending machine where you can buy coke, sprite, minute maid and in the same room as the vending machine, you can do your laundry. There is a small room where you can go on the internet, do your phone calls, but you need to pay for all of that. Overall experience in 2007 was ok, so we chose to book a room the next year for our second stay in New York. Boy, were we disappointed! We arrived around 3PM and the woman on the front desk told us our room was not ready yet. We wanted to stay in the lobby, since it was very hot outside, but she was rude and told us to leave and come back in an hour. We got back an hour later, room still not ready. Had to come back in 30 minutes. Room still not ready when we got back. Finally, when we came back for the third time, she performed a magical trick and our room was ready. She gave us the key to a room way back on the ground floor, behind the laundrette and the vending machine. This was not the big room she promised ("I'll be worth the wait. It's a big room with a large LCD, bla bla bla"). We refused the room and finally after a 3 hour wait got the room we booked. The room was a large room, with fake windows, quite dark, but renovated with a desk, chairs, extra table and clean spacious bathroom with two sinks. It was on the second floor. There was also an encounter with a cockroach downstairs in the hallway. We went to the front desk and told the woman what we saw and she just picked up the walkie talkie, said "roach" and went on with her business, like this was just another roach on just another day... Given the rudeness of the woman at the front desk, we decided to go for another hotel the years after that and we have no regrets. It was ok at the time, but we would not stay here again having stayed elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location but book one of the new rooms”
Reviews.Author: drof27
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at this hotel. If you're looking for a hotel with a nice clean room with a comfy bed, nice bathroom, free wifi and satellite tv in a brilliant location in midtown Manhatten stay here. It's all about the location for this hotel, turn left and your on Fifth Avenue, turn right and your on Broadway close to Macy's and a 7 minute walk to Times Square. The Empire State building is literally around the corner too and the closest subway stop is also just around the corner less than 90 seconds walk away. Another plus for this hotel is the price, if you can get a better room in a better location at the price of this hotel then you're a genious! No you're not going to get room service or breakfast as there is no restarant in the hotel and you won't get any sort of view from the bedroom window but for the price what can you expect? Just a word of warning, stay in one of the newly refurbished rooms, they're slightly more expensive but are well worth it. If I stayed in onne of the older rooms my review would be a bit different! The older rooms are a bit run down but the newer ones have new very comfy beds, varnished wooden floors, large flat screen TVs and newly tiled and refurbished bathrooms and enerally look and feel like a room in a 3 or 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: mirellaB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald Square hotel just for one nigth, but I will definitely go back soon! The hotel is close to everything I like to see and do in the city. I noticed how every little thing in the hotelÂ´s decoration is well connected to its building history. I loved the chairs they have in the lobby where we can see the street enjoying a warm cup of coffee, tea or hot chocolate available to all guests at no cost! The bathroom was very clean with soft and thick towels and avedaÂ´s hand and bath soap. However, the best part of staying at the Harold Square hotel was its comfortable beds and pillows. I went to a concert at Madison square garden, which is just a block or two away from the hotel, and when I came back in the middle of the night I crawled into the bed and slept like a baby! Everything in this hotel was two thumbs up.. from the friendly staff, the complementary coffee, to its great location and rate. I could not ask for a better deal! I definitely recommend this hotel to any one looking for a place to stay in the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Would definitley stay again!”
Reviews.Author: deelee4
Reviews.Content: I have utilized Trip Advisor's reviews to book all of our trips during the past few years, and have never been disappointed. I pay close attention to the reviews of travelers. My husband and I were only looking to book a one night stay at a hotel which was said to be clean, affordable, close to attractions, and easily accessible to the subway. We definitely found that in the Herald Square Hotel. I was leery as to keeping the reservation since there was a bad review a few days before our trip. SInce past reviews were mostly positive, we decided to keep the reservation. We were happy to find out that the majority of the reviews were "right on." We had the opportunity to store our luggage before check-in ($2.00 fee). When we checked in, we were upgraded to a larger room. The room was recently refurbished. The bed was extremely comfortable and room was sparkling clean. Although there was one stain in the toilet bowl (things can be missed on occasion), the rest of the bathroom was sparkling clean. The staff was pleasant, and our check-in was seamless. We would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again. We would agree with the traveler who stated that this hotel is a "hidden gem!" Diane and Lee Laubach ( Allentown, Pennsylvania)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: landru98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Herald Square as a quick stopover before our transatlantic cruise. We were looking for something inexpensive but clean and quiet that gave us quick access to the main sights of Manhattan. We found what we were looking for. Herald Square is in lower midtown, literally right behind the Empire State Building. But since it's not right on a major street, it's quiet, safe and very accessible. We walked pretty much everywhere, but could have used the subway, a hop-on-hop-off tour bus, or grabbed a cab with ease. While the lobby is small and purely functional, remember this isn't The Pierre, nor are you paying those kind of prices. It gets the job done. Our room, though, was excellent -- clean, more than big enough, with a nicely appointed bathroom and plenty of storage and move-around space. The bed was definitely a highlight, comfy, clean and big. The staff was also courteous, friendly and informative. Those who describe this as a hidden gem are bang-on. You simply can't beat if for the price or location. We will definitely stay here again if we're looking for a short-term place in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but Rude Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: tridibur
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before, Hotel is good, however, it seems that the staff is getting more impolite as time pass by. I recently call to make a reservation and the Front desk clerk, think her name is Monica, roughly took my reservation with a bad attitude. Herald Square should supervise how their employees to talk to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem of NYC!”
Reviews.Author: travelenthusiast815
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel experience! When we arrived around 2pm we were early for check-in so we put our luggage into lockers which was great so we could sightsee around the city without the hassle of carrying our bags around. We booked a queen room and they upgraded us to a gorgeous king size renovated room, it was spectacular! Definitely the most comfortable room and bed I have ever seen, it was so charming. This hotel is centrally located between all great parts of NYC and is definitely a hidden gem. Our bathroom was immaculate and the whole hotel was very clean. DEFINITELY recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Herald Square Hotel - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Elena1378
Reviews.Content: Loved this quaint affordable hotel within walking distance of everything in Manhattan. Seriously! Stayed in one of the "new" (remodeled) rooms. Loved the queen-size brass bed with wonderful linens (this hotel just won the Citysearch "Best Comfy Bed in New York" award), the high ceilings, the flat screen TV, the spacious bathroom with rainspout shower (I wanted to stay in the shower forever), and the Aveda amenities. Free coffee and free New York Posts available in the lobby. And best of all, free wi-fi in all of the rooms! The comfy leather chairs in the front lobby overlooking the street are perfect to curl up in and read the Village Voice, also available here. A lot of value for your bucks!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: campeale
Reviews.Content: been there for 4 day at the end of July. YOU CANNOT FIND AN HOTEL IN NY BETTER THAN THIS with this fares. The POSITION is awesome (at end of the street you have 6 main undergound lines; the hotel is right back empire state buildind and near time square; 1 stop from Rockfeller.. in other words.. you can go everywhere in Manhattan). STAFF is very gentle helpful and professional. ROOMS are more than confortable and very clean, with tv lcd and in-room air conditionning. SERVICES are defenetly a plus (free beverages machine, whashing/drying machine for few dollars, free wi-fi). PRICE is incredible i payed only $ 109 per night. JUST COME TO THIS PLACE.. no bad surprises!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great value, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: StaceyLeeDee
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with a queen bed for 3 nights just 2 days before arriving in NYC (using booking.com via tripadvisor). We found a great deal online ($159+fees) and the hotel was in easy walking distance from Penn Station (we had a lot of luggage). We arrived hours before check in, hoping to store our luggage (they have a limited number of lockers) until the 3pm check in. However, when the clerk looked us up, she said we would be upgraded to a large, 2-double bed room. It was a lovely room: clean, great beds, huge bathroom (with two sinks), free wi-fi, flat screen tv. The location: 31st between 5th and Broadway, ideal for getting anywhere in the city. The only drawbacks to this admittedly "budget" hotel is that there are few services: the clerks are behind bullet proof glass (which is scary) and since there is no doorman/concierge, you need to be buzzed in to get into the hotel (which I suppose provides safety). There is a lounge, but there is no food (just coffee)--so you need to go elsewhere for food. There are several other hotels in the neighborhood that we checked out, but they would have cost us at least $50-several hundred dollars more a night for the extra services. I highly recommend this hotel for those on a budget--and definitely check out all of the online vendors for the best possible deal.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap yet clean”
Reviews.Author: 2010travelgirl
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel that would not break the bank but was well located. The Herald Square Hotel is this. We arrived later in the night and got a very small room at the back of the hotel with no window. Having said that the room was clean and we had a great nights sleep each night. The shower was a bit hit and miss as the water would run cold on you, not sure if it was the pressure or the time we got up in the morning that caused that. Though the bathroom was small it was very clean. The location was good, near Penn Station and walking distance to Macy's and Times Square. Overall, for the price we paid and even with the size of the room and shower issue we were very satisfied with this room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kilgore75
Reviews.Content: I spent just one night in Herald Square hotel in NYC, but it was all smooth. Rooms are little bit dark but very clean and comfy. I got the one with new bathroom, which was roomy and perfectly fine. There is no restaurant or any other meal service in the hotel, but Subway and others are just across the corner. I would say it is perfect choice for location and money spend.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: geetabix
Reviews.Content: The location was phenomenal - a few steps to Penn Station, every subway line, all sorts of shops and restaurants, and a 5 minute walk to Times Square, Flatiron Building, lots of parks ... amazing for a tourist! The lobby, the hallways, and the elevator could all do with improvement, but the room itself was quite nice. No frills, but it was clean, the bathroom was brand new, our towels and bedding were changed every day, and we felt very safe there. It was quiet, offered HBO on a flat screen TV as well as free wireless, and the air conditioning worked very well (required in July in NY). I think the only downsides were the grubby hallways, and the bad free coffee. I would have liked a fridge in the room, but maybe that's asking too much for $179/night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Nice, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lm_jns32
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Herald Square Hotel several times over the years, and have been very pleased each time. Our recent trip was in July 2010, during which time we received a very nicely remodeled room on the 5th floor. Be aware of what you are getting before you book...these rooms are very small, and there is absolutely no view out the window. That said, if you are like us, we wanted a clean, inexpensive, safe place to sleep, and that is what we got. The room and bathroom was very nicely done, was clean, and well stocked with the normal towels, sheets, pillows, etc. The bed felt just fine to me, the pillow wasn't the greatest, but I'm picky about that and have slept on much worse. There was no "city noise" in our room, and we slept well. Although we really had very little dealings with the staff, they were friendly and helpful when we did. The hotel is in a very good spot, with quick access to Penn Station and the subway. There are several very good, inexpensive eating establishments within a block. I will stay here again on my next trip to NYC, and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky - and an absolutely fab location”
Reviews.Author: 1sttimeinNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights in June. On booking in the receptionist, bless her, realised we were a married couple and upgraded our room to a double. our friend's room was bijou, but ours was a good size. Modern fittings, and immaculately clean with a huge bath. The soap /shampoo rack was odd- it was hung on the shower fitting and was so high it was out of my wife's reach. Similarly the bed was huge and high- she had to take a run up to get onto it! Once in it though it was very comfortable. The air conditioning was a window unit and was a must in June. It was a touch noisy but better that than sweltering. It obscured the window but as there was no view it really didn't matter. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would I stay there again? Yes without a hesitation. Would I recommend it? Yes- it is good value for money in New York, and the location between 5th Avenue and Madison Square Gardens is great.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for one night. Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mel100204
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Great hotel for the price. Booked a queen room and was upgraded to a renovated queen with great bath. Very clean and excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a NYC Adventure!”
Reviews.Author: SpookandtheBasset
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 5 nights here on our 1st trip to NYC and couldnâ€™t have been happier the location is unbelievable right in the middle of all the action: Empire State Building- 1 minute walk/ Times Square- 5-10 minutesâ€™ walk/ Macyâ€™s- 2 minute walk/ Grand Central Station- 5 minute walk/ Madison Square Garden- 2 minute walk! As for the hotel, the price is amazing for the location and what you get. We stayed in one of the new deluxe queen beds and the room was perfect clean, new and fresh and so was the bathroom, which was huge! The service was great to check in was smooth and simple and the staff were really helpful. The lobby of the hotel is not as impressive as the outside or the rooms but how cares when everything else was so good. If/when we return to New York we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST”
Reviews.Author: EaglesTouchdown
Reviews.Content: Please read this. Very important if you are considering staying at this Hotel. I all my years of traveling, this was the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in my entire traveling life. The web site is a fraud. Whoever did the site should be commended. It's not that what they show does not exist, it there. Sort of enhanced a lot. A real lot. Went to a Yankee game and stayed over at this horrible place. No windows in the room. Couldn't sleep on the park bench "new" mattress. How in the world can you sleep in a prison cell size room with no windows? I asked the nasty front desk person for a change of room. Sorry she says, you could have come right down and canceled the room. But you checked in. Now may I ask, who opens the shutters to see if there's a window behind them if your in a hurry and gotta get to the game? Nope, not I. DO NOT stay there. A dump and rip off. Nasty people. Nasty room. Nasty, nasty, nasty

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: voco
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in a renovated queen room. The hotel is ideally located in mid-town just 2 blocks from the Empire State Building. It is priced as good as you can get in Manhattan. It is perfect for someone who is not going to spend a lot of time in their room. Our room was surprisingly large and very clean. It was well maintained by the cleaning staff. The bathroom was thoroughly cleaned and towels changed every day. We landed in Manhattan during a heat wave and the room's a/c was perfect, but it was noisy at night. Our friends stayed in a non-renovated queen room and it was not nearly as nice as our room (dated mid-1980s decor) but it suited them. My only "complaint" is that their hot beverage maker in the lobby was out of order for nearly the entire time we were there. While they have free wireless in the hotel, if you want to use their computer to access the internet, you must pay and it is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and with all you need”
Reviews.Author: GuteReise75
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-night stay at the Herald Square Hotel and were very satisfied. We had booked a renovated queen and were upgraded to a renovated king at no additional charge. We were informed there are only two such rooms in the hotel...lucky us. The condition of the room was fabulous. Everything was brand new - floors, furniture, bedding etc. There was a spacious closet, equipped with an iron and ironing board, as well as a safe, air-conditioning unit, make-up mirror and flat screen TV. We didn't have a view, as the window faced a brick wall, but that was tastefully covered with lovely wooden shutters. And in the end we were thankful not to be facing the street - It was so quiet, dark and peaceful in the room and we slept like babies! The bathroom was also great - huge, with a hair dryer and stocked with AVEDA products. The cleaning service was there daily. The front desk service at the hotel was good, although not what you'd find at a pricier establishment. The lobby is a bit tacky, but who hangs out there anyhow? And it is true that the elevator is a bit slow, but after hours of walking around the city we didn't mind much standing in one place for a little bit :) Also, we did have to wait once for access to the luggage room, but once the man did arrive to let us in, he was so friendly that all was forgiven. The location of the hotel is good, so far as subway access goes, although we didn't find many restaurants or bars that we liked in the area and did end up having to travel for those. In the end, we would definitely stay here again. Unfortunately I cannot compare prices as this was the first hotel I've stayed in in NYC, but we do feel that we got a good deal after a lot of online comparison shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: michelle3371
Reviews.Content: We stayed a long weekend @ Herald Square and had a great experience. The location is perfect, the room is clean & the bed was comfortable. We had a new queen deluxe & it was really nice. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. This was a great value & we'd stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: M0NTIE
Reviews.Content: Great location,good service, very clean rooms, comfortable beds. All for a reasonable price. We were pleased with our stay and will stay again if looking for a hotel at that price range, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: phdhonda
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest. It's not fare to compare this hotel with Best Western and Hampton Inn hotels because they don't have the same budget prices. It's a small hotel with a great location. The room is quiet, although there's no view (not at the first floor), but there's a safe box and free wireless internet (fast). If you like asian food you just turn left on fifth ave. and left again on 32nd st. New York city is great for shopping and you could start at fifth ave., but don't forget the shops at 34th st. and Union square (one Best Buy openned for 24 hours). As I said, it's as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Herald square: $130 bucks a night for a closet?”
Reviews.Author: jimOshay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of different hotels in NYC but I will never go back to the Herald Square. Our tiny room was on the ground floor and it had NO WINDOW! We paid the same going rate as everyone else but we got stuck in the broom closet. It's the second-worse hotel I've stayed at next to the Carter and even that place had a window. With not even a clock in the room, we would wake up with no idea if it was noon or the middle of the night. The place smelled musty and the front desk is behind thick glass. We had to ring a buzzer to get in the front door and sometimes we had to wait outside a while until someone noticed the ringing. No bargains here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but you can find better”
Reviews.Author: 2009leeds
Reviews.Content: The big plus about this hotel is its location - walking distance from Penn station and near the subway.This is really the only pro for this hotel and you can do a lot better for your money. When we first walked into the hotel lobby, the receptionist was behind a glass wall, not a comforting sight when you first walk in. The lifts are dire and when we first entered into our room, it stank of bleach. The rooms are extremely basic, very small and looking very tired. We have stayed in New York several times now and we will certainly not be returning to this hotel as there are far better ones out there at the same price or cheaper. My favourite hotel in NY so far is the Best Western Bowery Hanabee in China town. Rooms are big, clean and modern with friendly staff. There is a subway stop nearby and you are near to some good shops and sites. Another good one is the Hampton Inn near central park. The Best Western is cheaper than the Herald square and the Hampton Inn is about the same price. I would not recommend this place to anyone. You can find much nicer hotels on the same price with just as good location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location at a very Good Price.”
Reviews.Author: Glenofthedowns123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic. No restaurant, or bar. Just accommodation in a really central location of NY. Rooms clean. 2 lifts. Perfect location for a group of ladies shopping. You can drop your shopping bags back to the hotel when they get too heavy. Macys just around the corner. What elso would any woman want!!! Location is the key here. If you want the plushness of the Astoria, go there and pay their prices. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Herald Square Hotel New York City”
Reviews.Author: leoniegijsbers
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms for good price. Location midtown Manhattan is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gwall60
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels on this site for a spring break trip with my 15-year old daughter. We thoroughly enjoyed our 3-night stay at the Herald Sq. Hotel. Thanks to the reviews on this site, I fortunately knew what to expect (no shampoo or blow dryer, no hotel restaurant or bar, no breakfast, a per minute charge to use the computer to print boarding passes for the return trip home, receptionist behind glass, etc.). That being said, the staff was great, the room was nice, quiet and clean, great beds, flat screen tv, and the reviews are correct that it is a great location. The Herald Sq. subway station, which is a major station, is only a short 1 1/2 blocks away (a very short walk). There are also a number of taxis available at Herald Square, which was always alive with activity, even late at night. Also, we felt perfectly safe walking around the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK - Skip this hotel to have a great time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMoma44
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of a group of 13 people for a trip to NYC. Our travel agent booked the Herald Square Hotel because of the pictures on their website. The reservation was confirmed by me one day before arrival and everything was fine. Upon arrival all the reservations were lost. The staff finally found rooms that had not been remodeled and put us in those rooms. The rooms were small and the heating system either worked or didn't. Some rooms were hot and some were cold and all heard incredible noise from the heating system. Sometimes hot water was available and sometimes not. The elevator is the slowest in the country. There was even a room marked that it was a NYC crime scene. I would never, never have my worst enemy stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Baby-Dragonfly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New York for 9 days and it was fantastic. The price we payed for the hotel, which is in a great location, is very-very reasonable for New York. The location is just around the corner from the shoping street and Empire state building. The rooms are average size, very clean. There are coffe/tea facilities in the sitting area next to the reception. The staff is nice and friendly. We would definately stay there againa and again!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: pwrm21
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms...one for my husband and I and one for our three teenagers. They had a plain room with two double beds...nothing great, but we didn't stick around long. Ours was a newer, updated room which was really nice. We felt the location was great...especially for the price... $163/night for both rooms! Near the Empire State Building, but we could walk to Times Square and NBC studios...or you could always take the subway. Felt safe in the area. Front desk was nice, but didn't seem to know a whole lot. Area for morning coffee and newspaper. Not a lot of restaurants in the immedicate area, but again, close enough. Would definately recommend and return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: homeandawayVictoria
Reviews.Content: Good location, but v. small room. Good bed and bathroom. Elevator must be the slowest in New York. Interesting decor with old cartoons and posters. No breakfast is provided but there is a small communal room in the lobby with a automatic coffee machine, which seemed to be under repair more often than it was working. Inadequate space to store luggage - some people had to pay for lockers to put their luggage in. Staff helpful. Wish we had been able to stay at the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: purplesue80
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it, very comfortable and welcoming to come back to after a long day of shopping!!! I was travelling by myself and when the reception found out he gave me a free keyring and said "you're not alone anymore" My only downside, and its really little, is that the room location was not indicated when you came out of the lift, so I had to walk around the floor for a little bit to try and find it, but minor detail they rang my room to make sure I had found it and everything was good. Perfect hotel full of history and very quiet, right around the corner is the Empire State Building, Macy's and Victorias Secret. Perfect, Perfect Perfect!!! When I go back to New York I will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous beds and fantastic location but too hot and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kazarrina
Reviews.Content: The hotel had one of the most comfortable beds that I've slept in for sometime when staying in hotel accommodation. The rooms were large enough and the bathroom was great size and clean. However, it was also uncomfortably hot and I had the noisiest heating system that i have ever encountered. The maintenance man said there was nothing he could do to fix the problem. Opening the one window in the room did not stop the heat and then you had the heating system competing with traffic noise. Turning the heater off in the room only increased the noise. I solved it by putting on the air conditioner when It was about 8 degrees celcius outside! And wearing ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, location, worth it”
Reviews.Author: mmmmtravel
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel from expedia. We also watched the video from the website... CREEPY!But, we didn't watch it until after we had booked it. We arrived before the check in time so we got to keep our luggage in the lockers, which was convenient. Our room was renovated and very clean. The hotel is definitely in a great location and good for its value. The renovated rooms have hardwood floors, aveda ammenities in the bathroom, and flat screen tvs. Overall, we were happy with the Herald Square Hotel. Only downsides: the water doesn't stay hot for a long time, some rooms don't have a good view, and you can't take a bath because it will leak to the room below. But seriously overall, it is good for its price and clean! I would recommend it for travelers who just need a place to crash that is clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Tourist-y Activities”
Reviews.Author: jalu33
Reviews.Content: I'm generally a location person when it comes to booking a hotel. You only need a room to sleep and keep your stuff, right? So, I knew I needed a centrally-located hotel/ close to a subway stop on this trip to show my friend around NYC. Herald Square Hotel obviously fits that criteria, but I didn't expect to also get a great room! Our room was newly renovated and very large for Manhattan--1 queen bed, desk w/ 2 chairs, digital safe, cafe table w/ 2 chairs, closet, huge bathroom w/ 2 sinks, huge shower w/ awesome shower head. It was so clean that I would have even have been fine sleeping on the floor. Notes: Make sure to request a renovated room; wait for it, if necessary Orbitz gave me a great rate ($136/night avg. incl. taxes/fees) Two blocks away from subway; pharmacy, deli... Awesome Aveda bath products (no lotion, though) Coffee/tea/hot chocolate machine in lobby, but no food Free wi fi They have large lockers to store your luggage on your last day for $2 Very good location for tourists Could not control room temperature... heat was on too high Windows open to really ugly view of the other walls of the hotel; very very ugly and dark

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like a Bait-and-Switch”
Reviews.Author: coquiero
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation at the Herald Square Hotel based on reviews here at Tripadvisor and also from the hotel's own website. It seemed like a quaint, historic hotel in mid-town Manhattan, at a very good price. You get what you pay for, my friends. The hotel rooms on the website are charming and well-decorated. The bathrooms look updated and roomy. What we found was the exact room in the picture--same window, same orientation, same beds, same carpet color--minus the nice decorations, nice headboards, and with a totally different, un-updated bathroom than was seen in the photo. Two things came to mind. There are identical rooms in the hotel, some of which have been updated, some not. Maybe the price I paid reflected the fact that I was in a shabbier copy of the room seen on the website. Further reading on Tripadvisor would have revealed that I was not the only one to suffer this fate. In addition to the room which looks like it might have been rented at the YMCA (with the exception of the beds, which were comfy and with decent linens), the lobby is drab and the "receptionist" is behind bullet-proof glass, which should have been a giant tip off that this was not the hotel experience we expected. In summary, I repeat. You get what you pay for. We paid $150 (including taxes) a night for a true economy-type hotel. The free wi-fi in the hotel was a plus, but there wasn't even shampoo or conditioner in the bathrooms. I didn't even mind my stay so much, I just felt conned, which really put a crimp in my enjoyment of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, my wife says so...”
Reviews.Author: mcfrank47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel again, liked it enough the first time to want to come back and we were not disappointed. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms, booked it on line 6 weeks before our trip, and it was terrific! A great bed, beautifully appointed bath, clean, quiet and just plain wonderful. I was told that the few rooms that remain in renovation should be finished within the next month so everyone will get to experience the great beds, free WI FI, and flat panel TV's. I was also told that to get the room I want next time to make sure that I book early again, I will, because I will absolutely be staying that next time and every time I come to NYC. It's a great hotel at a great location at a great price. Who could ask for anything more? Loved it, will tell our friends, family and anyone else who will listen to stay there when they go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The location was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Jody46
Reviews.Content: The room was larger than most NYC hotel room (we had 4 gals) and we managed to deal with the tiny bathroom. The room was clean and the maid service was very good. They had coffee, hotchocalate, etc. in a common area on the first floor. I loved the location - convenient to everything. The only problem I really had with the hotel experience was the fact that we booked a specific room (we saw it online) but when we got there, they tried to give us a different room that was much smaller with a much smaller bathroom. I'm still not sure we got the room that we booked online.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best feature”
Reviews.Author: shess10
Reviews.Content: Stayed this weekend at the Herald Square in a 2 bed unit for 4. Room did NOT look like anything on the web set. Room was very spartan, small with no pictures and stark walls. Old TV and an uncontrollable radiator hissing all night. In the morning, there was no (I mean zero) hot water for showers. Many people complaining at checkout. Maybe that explains why their are no amenities like shampoo? The hot cocoa/coffee machine worked when we checked in but was no longer functioning in the morning. On a positive note the hotel has a great location and NYC is awesome for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: irishgalinabq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Herald Square Hotel for 2 nights. We drove to NY and the hotel has a good deal with a parking lot around the block -parking $21 for 424 hours. Great value for NY. All of our experiences with the staff were good-they were very helpful and polite. The rooms are very clean but ours had only a tiny window, so the room was quite dark during the day. However, as we were out sight seeing in daytime, we didn't mind that so much. The room was made up with fresh towels every day and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom in our room was very small. However, for NY, the room itself was v. large-2 double beds and plenty of room to walk around. There was no hair dryer but we were able to get one from reception with a deposit of $20. There is free coffee tea etc. in the lobby and nice big flat screen TV's in the rooms. We were on the 9th floor so it was nice and quiet-although the pipes banged a bit if people were taking a shower. However, this has happened in almost every hotel I have stayed in in NY in the past-I think it is a problem in the older buildings. By far the top selling point for this hotel is its location. It is minutes from 34th street, Macy's and the many many shops that are around. It is also minutes from the subway station. There are a lot of nice places to eat nearby. Our overall opinion: clean safe and excellent location. However, we felt the price ($199 a night before taxes-$230 after all was added in) was quite high for the basic level of the hotel. However, considering it is NY and close to Christmas, a high price is to be expected. We were pleased with our choice. I would definitely stay here again, especially if I can find a cheaper deal in the less popular travel times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - budget price”
Reviews.Author: Leigh021
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4night stay at this hotel. On arrival, out room was ridiculously small with not even enough room for our suitcases. After speaking to Carl in reception we were given an alternative room which was almost twice the size. The hotel is in a fantastic location only a stones throw from the Empire State building and about a 10min stroll to Times Square. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a centrally based New York hotel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, everything else was so-so”
Reviews.Author: spiderman76
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 7 nights - in 2 different rooms. Both rooms were noisy in the morning and you can hear people talking loudly and slamming doors. The second room we had was just next to the rooms where they were renovating which may explain the noise - not sure about the first room. The staff were mostly ok except for this grumpy lady in her 30s who was awfully unhelpful. They provide lockers at $2 per usage if you need to leave your bags at the hotel after check-out. The first room we had was very small but the second was slightly bigger and newer. The selling point for this hotel is its location at 31st & Broadway which is 2min walk from Macy's and 1min walk from the subway which is just 1 stop from Times Square. Me and my wife were there on Thanksgiving and we could catch the parade literally just around the corner. Yes, if you need a cab, get one off the street for one yourself, as the reception charges a ridiculous price. Room comes with free Wi-Fi internet access and LCD tv with HD channels.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location. Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice. It is absolutely clean. The beds are of high standard. Modern wallmounted LCD tv & nice furniture in rooms. Only thing to be ware of! Dont ask the reception to call a cab for you, if you ei, have an early morning flight! They have an arrangement with some "private" cabdriver, whoom charges overprices. No taximeter or nothing! So. Ask for a YELLOW cab! Have a nice stay :-) Mike :-)

Reviews.Title: “our brillant visit to nyc”
Reviews.Author: nyc51
Reviews.Content: fantastic location at a very good affordable price. It wasnt the ritz but cleaned room every day on suite heated floors in renovated rooms was brill. Coffee machine in reception only had selected times which was a pain as after a long day you want a hot drink in your room. Empire state building was a stones throw away.. Definatley would stay here again fantastic budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: floralbrigades
Reviews.Content: as a young traveler i wasn't too picky when i booked my hotels, i just wanted something cheap with no bed bugs, so i was blown away when i got to the herald square. it was so much more than i expected. the lobby was a bit tacky but my room was lovely, and clean! it was a bit small, but that was no issue for me. the bathroom was clean, and new! the location was incredible, i walked most places during my stay but when i needed to catch a train they were practically at my doorstep! the staff were really nice, too! i would really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel staff very good allways friendly very helpfull”
Reviews.Author: skerries67
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 3 times central location good value staff very friendly will stay there again We have told friends about it no frills very clean

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cosy hotel, with great location”
Reviews.Author: phweet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited NYC in Sept 2009 and we came across this hotel via tripadvisor.com. Our cab driver had a hard time finding the hotel (he's a 3rd generation New yorker) and even joked that it might be a dodgy place. Our initial apprehension was put to rest the minute we stepped into the hotel. The staff was courteous and very friendly, entertaining my husband with chatter when he asked if the water was safe to drink from the tap (they say it is) and we felt very welcomed by them. A lot of emphasis was placed on safety - only 1 keycard was issued (can drop it off at the front desk if we're worried about losing it when we're out and about) and also the front door of the hotel has a security feature where by it locks automatically and would only open when one of the staffs presses a button from the office. The room also has a safe (albeit, kind of old - set the password and try it out first before you use it because it locks without having you set a password first!) The room and toilet was very clean, and had a pleasant smell (NO MOULD!) and the sheets were clean and comfy. The room was small, with just about enough room to move around the queen sized bed but when we chucked our bags on the floor we ran out of walking room. But checking out the website and the fire-escape floor plan, it seems that all the rooms differ in sizes so each room is unique. in short, i didnt get the room as featured in pictures on the website, but we were satisfied with the room nonetheless. Location wise, we were very close to 5th avenue (though 5th avenue is very long so you have to walk a bit along 5th ave to get to the shops) and a street away i think from the empire state building. what my husband and i really loved was that we were so close to the harold square station for the subway, and it was quick and easy for us to get about (less than 5min train ride to the natural history museum!). There were many subway lines going up and down town so it was a real convenience. There's a pharmacy across the street, a restaurant just downstairs and Koreatown just around the corner (The Korean restaurant behind 31st street called Mondoo is a ripoff!). Also, Macy's just about a block away, near the harold square subway entrance. If you intend to ship back your shopping, there's a post office right downstairs too, to the right of the hotel when you exit. It was raining a lot when we were there, so we called in some sandwiches (Speedy's) from brochures placed in the room ($1 per local call out!). Neighborhood wise, it's a street away from the quieter areas so if you're the cautious sort it'll be good for you to pay attention. The street which the hotel is on is safe and busy in the day, and in the evenings you can walk over to the irish pub which is about a 5min walk. The only thing unsatisfactory during the trip was that they were doing carpentry work on a room on my floor - you can hear an electric saw ripping at 6am in the morning. It took me 26hrs to get to New York and I was suffering terrible jetlag so the noise was not appreciated. But overall, aside from that issue, we were very pleased with the hotel and we would most definitely stay there again if for some reason we have to go back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “really good hotel in midtown”
Reviews.Author: joeAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband a week in the Herald square hotel in the beginning of september. At first we were offered a very small room, but when the staff realised we were staying a week they came with a bigger one. All very clean and quiet. positive: near a few metrostations, in a nice and central neighbourhood, quiet street, nice staff. negative: free coffee/ tea is nice, but why on certain times? We were allways to early or too late. To take a shower was really a challenge: it is difficult to get the temperature you like, allways too hot . So like an other reviewer suggested before: I mostly took a bath. But the price in relation to the quality is good, so I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Jess13
Reviews.Content: I was in the city to spend some time with my daughter who was staying with friends. Transportation is all nearby, the rooms are peaceful; no noise in hallway. You get to really rest at the end of your day. There are restaurants very close by where you can acces meals at any time. If you need to get something washed, you can do it yourself quickly in the well appointed laundry room. To use a common expression "you get the most bang for your bucks" at the Herald Square.

Reviews.Title: “The easiest hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: TheBigBrat
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels and this was the easiest to get around. It is close to everywhere. The rooms where great and the service was fantastic. I loved how I could walk to Broadway and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: sushiactress
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The room was lovely, and the bathroom was huge for a NYC hotel room bathroom! Bigger than my bathroom at home. The bed was extremely comfortable and the hotel itself was very quiet, although there was a construction site nearby that started clanking away at 7am. I thought the free coffee and hot chocolate was a nice touch, although I never took advantage of it. There are washers and dryers in the back of the first floor for those on longer stays. They also have storage lockers for your luggage after you check out, which was a little strange, as most hotels will hold your luggage for free until you're ready to actually leave. The only real complaint I had was at check-in. There were two people at reception, the woman was helping someone, so I went to the man's window. Well, he was apparently VERY busy flipping idly through the reservations, because he totally ignored me. When the woman finished up checking in the other people, she chirped "I can help you here!" I'm glad she was there, who knows how long I would've stood there before that guy lowered himself to actually do his job. Other than that bad first impression, the hotel was very nice and a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “New York on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Nanita27
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week and it was a great experience. The hotel is located near everything: Times Square, Penn Station, Broadway, May's. It is easy to go from there to anywhere! The room was small but it had everything I needed and it was clean; the bed was comfortable (I did not miss my bed!). The service was very good and the staff were nice and friendly. Also, since I booked with many months in advance I got a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Way overhyped; really not that great”
Reviews.Author: citysqaure
Reviews.Content: We booked based on all the rave reviews on Trip Advisor and Yelp. Our room was nothing like the photos on the website. It wasn't one of the renovated rooms and was really tired. We didn't have a flat screen TV; we had an old fashioned bulky 14" TV. The bathroom was tiny and the bathtub was like something out of a horror film; it was discoloured and deeply marked in several places and there was a rubber matt glued in the tub covering up god only knows what. The bathtub was long overdue for replacement; it was disgusting. There was an extremely strong bleach smell in the bathroom when we checked in; at least they cleaned it. The worst part was their rule about one pass key card per room. We were three friends (which we stated when we reserved back in August) and we were forced to share one pass card for the entire 6 days. The stafff refused to let us have another pass card for our room so it was extremely inconvenient and a big hassle. By the way, we are responsible adults in our late 30's and 40's not partying teenagers. The manager and manageress were very rude about this matter. We were very disappointed with the dinginess of our tired room based on the images presented on their website. Also the free coffee was only available between 7 am and 10 am and then from 3 pm to 7 pm. So if you wanted to grab a coffee between 10 am and 12 pm, you were out of luck. Also it was out of order a few times during the times it was supposed to be available. In summarizing, a good location but the room was not nice and was noisy even with the wooden shutters. Bed was comfortable. Our room phone didn't work properly either and a friend in a nearby hotel was unable to contact us during our stay as calls could not be transferred to our room. It was like being back in the 1940s. It was just OK; wouldn't stay again, didn't really have any of the charm the website conjures up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travellers looking for great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Diana060
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this very belatedly, because I am amazed this hotel isn't rated more highly. After being completely shocked at the high prices for accommodation in NYC, a friend recommended TripAdvisor to me and I then spent a lot of time researching hotels in NYC. Coming from Australia, we had a lot of travelling to do, and needed to be mindful of what we spent on hotel rooms along the way. What I was looking for was "clean", "comfortable", "safe" and hopefully with rooms not the size of shoe boxes. We arrived into NYC late at night, and as I had booked the hotel on line at a great price (at the time, 3 years ago, US$99 for the room) I kept wondering if the hotel might be too good to be true. It wasn't. We loved our room (2 double beds), a small but adequate bathroom - with heaps of fluffy towels provided - and plenty of room for our luggage. It was great standing at our window at night just watching New Yorkers going about their lives. Each morning, my husband would go to a convenience store around the corner to buy yogurt, then fruit from a vendor on the corner and then bring back coffee from the lobby area for our breakfast. We made use of the free ice, and used the internet and the laundry in the building. We loved the quaint posters on the walls, and enjoyed the building's history. It's position in NYC was very central, but just a little way away from Times Square, which suited us. And Penn Station was just a few, easily walkable, blocks away. For those people who don't wish to stay in 5 or 4 star hotels (or whose budget doesn't allow it) you can't go past this hotel. For all you backpackers and holiday makers, check out this hotel's website, you might get a bargain like we did in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...Good location”
Reviews.Author: Holmlands
Reviews.Content: Hotel is absolutely fine..Room was spacious, clean and quiet, even for the first floor..Staff were helpful and courteous..Fairly easy to walk east and west and used subway for north/south trips..Just one thing to be aware of...Room advertised at $249 per night..After adding the FOUR different taxes, that became $289 per night

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabiohc
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel. Our renewed room was very nice: excellent and beautifull bathroom; very confortable queen beb; free wi-fi; safety box; hairdryer; work desk; cable tv; everything clean and working properly. The coffee machine and chocolates at the lobby were very usefull. The negative points are of minimal importance, if any: there is no room service, but we never use that anyway in any hotel, so no problem for us. No minibar, but an ice machine at lobby. Small reception, but we didn't go to NYC to stay at a hotel reception. No restaurant, but a plenty of restaurants nearby. Of note: we stayed one night at the more expensive Sheraton, and our room at the Herald Square was much better than at that hotel. If you want luxury (and paying for that) look for other hotels, but if you look for a simple and nice hotel just to have a good sleep at night after a day full of activities, this is a really very good one.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, really clean and nice!”
Reviews.Author: holub78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 4 nights in September with my partner. I chose the hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and I have to say that it was a great choice. The hotel is just off 5th Avenue, our room on 8th floor was clean and very cozy and all staff were helpful. We have booked about one month in advance and got excellent rate too. I really recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, basic, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kat307
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald Square Hotel for 8 nights in September 2009. I was travelling alone and had a small room to myself with an en suite bathroom and a double bed. It is a basic hotel, but very comfortable and clean. My bed was very big and the bathroom was spotless. My view was terrible - an airshaft, but I was only there to sleep and shower so a view was not a priority to me. My room had a flatscreen TV with lots of channels including HBO. This was good for nights I was tired and wanted to stay in and also for checking the weather in the morning as my airshaft view gave me no clue! The staff were friendly, I had no problems with them. There was high speed internet available at $1 per 5 minutes which I used a couple of times without any problems. I was told by staff that there were hot drinks available in the lobby, but I never used this facility, but I often saw people sat in the seating area around the drinks machine. The location of the hotel was probably the best thing, right in the heart of midtown, a few blocks from the Empire State Building and Madison Square Gardens. Perfect if you need to pop back to drop off your shopping bags or get changed for dinner without wasting too much time. Also very near to a few subway stops, which I used often. If I had any complaints it would be that there seemed to be some building work going on in some rooms near me and a few mornings I heard loud banging and various other noises. This wasn't a major problem for me as I got up early most days, but some would find it irritating. Maybe check your room is not near any building if you feel this would bother you. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, it was expensive to me, worked out about Â£100 per night including tax, but I think for New York and for what you are getting (eg. comfy, clean, great location) that is a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, simple rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelisfun2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our NYC vacation. The Herald Square was a very practical and affordable option and well worth the money. It was a great location to the subway and Herald Square as well as a walkable distance to Times Square and the Theater District. The front desk staff was very friendly at check in and helpful. We had a queen room that was not one of the remodeled ones and it was clean and tastefully decorated. Our room was one the 4th floor and in the back so it was quiet. The room itself was not large but that was okay as we were not in New York for a leisurely hotel stay, but to explore this great city and simply have a nice place to sleep. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small to say the least but it was clean. The shower also had good pressure which can sometimes be a trouble in older hotels. The only negative I would say is that we slept in one day and didn't want maid service and left a do not disturb card on the door. We came back after a long day of touring to find our room cleaned. It wasn't bad that it was cleaned but we had flown in late the night before and our stuff was everywhere so we just wanted to settle a bit before a cleaning. Plus, we don't like to waste water and energy by having our room cleaned everyday. I was slightly perturbed that the staff disregarded the do no disturb sign and cleaned anyway. Also, we enjoyed the complimentary coffee, tea, and chocolates in the lobby. Free Wi-fi as well which we used and really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Good price. No frills, not even shampoo.”
Reviews.Author: TennisTravel
Reviews.Content: The lobby is scary - I felt like I had stepped into a hotel in Eastern Europe during the Cold War. The hotel staff sits frighteningly behind glass, like at a cheap motel. The front desk staff was efficient, if a bit cold. They did answer any questions I had, but definitely, they work under the "no frills" policy also. The elevator is slow, though it works fine. I was on the fifth floor. Hallways are maybe 4' wide, but didn't mind - that's part of the NY charm. The room, which the woman at the front desk described as an "upgrade" was as bare bones as bare bones come. I have no idea what other reviewers are talking about when they describe wonderful rooms or granite countertops. The main room had 2 full size beds - which were great - VERY comfortable. Otherwise, basic old green carpet, and an old laminate shelf ran along the other wall holding the TV. No alarm clock, no waste bin, no desk, no closet door, no mirror. Bathroom was basic - one sink. Generally clean except for a few odd hairs. Tub/shower was happily very clean. No shampoo, no conditioner, so make sure to bring your own. Since I only slept there and was out and about most of the time, it was just fine for me, but if you're looking for any luxury at all, or trying to impress somebody (family, honeymoon, romance), I would not recommend here. If you're young, on a budget, spending minimal time at hte hotel, then it's just fine. $2 lockers in the lobby let you store your bags on the day you check out if you're not immediately running to the airport. I used them on my last day - very convenient, though I'm accumosted to hotels holding your bags for free. Oh well. Maybe they can use my $2 and buy some shampoo and lessons in customer service for the staff. Oh, and no doorman or concierge, so have fun wandering out to 5th Ave to flag down your own taxi.

Reviews.Title: “great location, staff very rude”
Reviews.Author: jack2005
Reviews.Content: in the heart of Manhattan (area Koreatown) in a walking distance and close to everything. It's good budget choice, but the service at the reception was terrible; staff was rude, unsmiling, not helpful and seemed to give off the impression that they were only there for the paycheck. I worked for years in the tourism and i cannot even imagine behaviouring that way! the room was small, but clean and functional, though it was a non renovated room; comfortable mattress, flat screen TV. it's very very noisy from the street, 24 hrs a day, even in the night )

Reviews.Title: “Pot Luck”
Reviews.Author: SconieJ
Reviews.Content: Booked a New Queen room two months prior to stay. Arrived late evening and were sent to an old musty room with a bathroom in what can only be described as a cupboard at the side which stank. Went straight back down to reception but were told that it was the only room available and they would see what they could do in the morning. The following morning I went back down to reception. I was given the key to the only refurbished room available. A tiny room on the ground floor, at the back of the hotel with the view of a wall and a workers cradle. Reception told us that the room given to us on our first night was an "up grade" and that they DO NOT GUARANTEE THAT YOU WILL GET THE ROOM YOU HAVE BOOKED. The choice therefore was a large smelly room with a tiny smelly bathroom, or a tiny clean refurbished room where we were unable to have the shutters (both outside and inside) open as there were workmen right outside the window. We chose the latter. That said, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small but clean and bright; however, showers were a nightmare as the water temperature was totally random. There was no other way to wash your hair, so you had to grin and bear it. The location was good very near to restaurants and subway station. Previous reviewers thankfully found a different hotel to the one we experienced; however, it would seem to us that it is pot luck whether you get a nice room or not.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for family travel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: xephias
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean, and it is a very good option for budget travelers. This is very good, considering the reviews for other hotels in NYC, where people found rats, cockroaches, etc. You can have breakfast at the hotel, because there is free coffee, hot chocolate, tea, etc. at the lobby in the morning and in the afternoon. The location is good, with subway one block away, and also very close to times square. There are plenty of places to eat for reasonable prices. The rooms are very good, big and clean. The bathroom was OK, but the only problem is that the shower did not work properly. It was impossible to mix the hot and cold water. We solved this by taking baths, which is relaxing, but takes longer time.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: AndreiaAp
Reviews.Content: It was an great experience, excellent locations, staff is nice, I would stay again for sure Andreia- Rio Claro-Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveller87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald Square Hotel with my boyfriend who had never been to New York before. The room was beautiful and romantic. The high ceilings and gorgeous marble bathroom were shocking to us, who, as budget travelers, were not accustomed to anything like that. Also, it was cool that the building had a lot of history to it! Korea Town was GREAT to have next door. We went out for a $30 meal and were given SO much delicious food. Amazing! I would definitely stay again, but make sure to ask for the New Rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - bargain price, great location”
Reviews.Author: cowbag
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a friend, this is a great hotel in a great location. Friendly reception, nice and spacious with free self serve coffee in lobby. room plenty big enough for family of 4 (2 Queen beds). Empire state building literally round the corner, short walk to Penn station for trains to NJ, and Times Square not far either. Slight problem with the loo on first night was sorted immediately. Very clean. Would definitely stay here again. Fantastic breakfast at the nearby Cosmic Cafe. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: StevieG489
Reviews.Content: I can't really add anything more to the reviews already given on Trip Advisor - great location, very clean, polite staff, great value for money. This is a budget hotel so do not go there if you are expecting room service or a huge penthouse suite! A little tip for you - if you are arriving/departing from JFK don't waste your time and money on a taxi or a shuttle bus, particularly if you arrive during the rush hour otherwise you will get stuck in traffic. It is much less hassle to take the Air Train from the airport ($5) followed by the Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) to Penn Station (approx $4). Penn Station is only a couple of blocks walk from the hotel. It's also a good idea to check various websites for the best price before booking. Try the hotel's own website (easy to find via google), Expedia and Booking dot com.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & beautiful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: PinkChampagne2009
Reviews.Content: Herald Square Hotel located in the center of Manhattan has an excellent location, very close to a subway station. The bathroom was very clean and large, nicely decorated. The room was also nice. Good choice for both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: lisaellen68
Reviews.Content: In June and July 2009 my daughter and I stayed at the Herald Squre Hotel. Both times were great, but the July stay, we arrived early and the front desk upgraded our room with no extra charge so we could go ahead and rest awhile. The room was so much nicer than the room we were to get and the service was excellent in a city where that is sometimes questionable. This hotel is n the middle of everything, so it is a great play to stay for such an affordable price. Thank you so much and on our next trip we will definately stay at the Hearld Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: aramDc
Reviews.Content: When I am in Paris, I stay in the 6eme arrondissement and surround myself in a neighborhood rich with Bohemian Parisian artistic culture that provides a quaint feel. When I travel to New York City, I look for the same quaint feel but I want the New York City vibe and culture. We all know how expensive the city that never sleeps can be and how much there is to see and do. So when I stay in this great metropolis, I want to be able to access New York City but on a respectable budget. And I always seem to find myself at the same location, The Herald Square Hotel. What a fantastic little gem! The accommodations are outstanding, the staff is welcoming, the location is superb (only a few blocks from Penn Station and the subway) and if I really get lazy and don't want to head too far but I feel like taking in some New York energy, there is a trendy and very New York type of restaurant-cafe next-door. On my next trip up to New York City, I will stay at the same location. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great option in expensive NY”
Reviews.Author: MarianaAveiro
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of it's rave reviews on tripadvisor and i'm glad i did so. The hotel has a great location, the staff is nice, the rooms are really big, with great matress, and clean bathrooms. There's also complementary drinks and cookies on the looby. All in all, for the price you pay, it's a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Location, classy and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: onsecondhoneymoon
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in NYC as a result of this hotel. Location is excellent. We could walk to Broadway and to the Amtrak station (a few blocks away). It's a real neighborhood with juice bars, and hole-in-the-wall breakfast places, amazing pizza & salad places. It rained hard while we were there, and we were directed to a street vendor who stands at a certain corner selling umbrellas whenever it rains! We got two for $9. I got a different look at NYC this time--a community in action sort of look. Staff is friendly and professional. Downstairs automatic coffee machine is amazingly versatile. Laundry room is v. efficient. There is one computer downstairs, but the place has wireless. There's an Indian place that serves lunch, a Dunken Donuts/Subway fast food place (yes, they are together!) as well as a high end chocolate and wine restaurant next door; there's also a whole neighborhood of fancy Korean restaurants around the corner. We saw lots of German tourists in our hotel this time. Made conversations fun. Did I mention the place is lovely in a tasteful and determinedly non-chain hotel kind of way? We got sick the second day there and just wanted to stay in our rooms and nest, which we did. It was v. comforting to have the drugstore, and an acupuncturist (at the Pacific College of Oriental Medicine on Broadway), and juice stand so close. We would stay there again anytime we're in NYC. No wonder this place won their city's award for best hotel value.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0012
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I've stayed here at least 5 times. It's clean, neat and inexpensive and super well located. Also next door to a fabulous Wine and Chocolate Bar where they serve a 20 layer crepe with fresh whipped cream between each layer until midnight outside under the NY City Stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice experiance”
Reviews.Author: garyjoy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice and the location was great for our first time in New York. The Staff was extremely helpful and wonderful to help with any Questions we had. the rooms were very clean and comfortable. I will stay here on our next trip to New York and would recommend you to stay here. The rates were very reasonable. Gary and Juliet Moore Tiffin, Iowa

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a budget hotel in midtown Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: bungle1973
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed for 5 nights at this great little hotel, which is situated in an area of Manhattan commonly referred to as Koreatown. Staying here you are within walking distance to most of midtown with it's many tourist attractions and shopping meccas, most notably Macy's and Empire State Building - if you're into that sort of thing - and the subway is just around the corner, opening up the rest of NYC for you to explore. There are also plenty of places to eat in the vicinity - ranging from cheap street vendors to fine dining - which is convenient as the hotel does not provide breakfast (or any other food for that matter). The room we stayed in (new large queen bedroom) was a nice size, with a lovely bathroom, a huge, comfortable bed almost requiring a step-ladder to get on top of, an intentionally doorless closet containing a large digital safe, an iron and an ironing board, a large desk with a mirror, and a somewhat noisy air-con device in a corner below the window. There was not much of a view out the window (a few dour looking brown brick buildings with windows displaying ill-kept and half-abandoned offices and storage spaces), but if you are anything like me and my girlfriend you would certainly not be in NYC to sit in your hotel room and look out the window. The room was cleaned well on a daily basis, and we always found a fresh supply of towels provided when we returned from our daily/nightly excursions. During our stay we were always met with a friendly and polite attitude from staff, and they were helpful on the few occasions when we needed their assistance. Checking in and out was a quick and easy process, and the rates are very reasonable considering the location of the hotel and the standard of the rooms (just over $920.00 for five nights). All in all, a great place to stay if you're planning to visit The Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pink921
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here 3 nights and I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel. The front desk was helpful, the room was clean and quiet, the price was great, it was located near the subway stops. Downstairs there were washers/dryers, soft drink machine and an ice machine. Off from the lobby were tables/chairs for the complimentary coffee/tea/hot chocolate. It was everything good you hope your hotel will be. An added bonus was that we were able to check in early, a welcome surprise we had not anticipated. We had fully expected to store our luggage in their lockers, which we did on the morning we checked out and stayed in the city the rest of the day and picked up our luggage late that afternoon. When you check in, pick up a brochure of the history of the hotel, it is very interesting. I hope to go back to NYC one day and the first thing I will do before I go is make my reservation at the Herald Square Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: italyfan98
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably close to Times Square and is a good choice for those on a budget. Staff were helpful and arranged a taxi to the airport. Rooms are small and bathrooms are shared but for the price it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: 193cat
