Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Herald Square with friends for a week in May. The hotel was fantastic - room really bright and spotlessly clean and the beds were so comfortable, just what we needed after a day out in NY! It is in the perfect location, just round the corner from the Empire State, Macys - and a 10 minute walk to Times Square. All the staff we came across were friendly and helpful and really helped to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I love the Herald Square Hotel and would recommend it to anyone - really couldnt fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel close to Empire State Building”
Reviews.Author: C-Bernie
Reviews.Content: Quaint 9 storey hotel one block from Empire State Building. Stayed 5 nights in renovated Queen bed room. Room 918 on top floor has a tiny outdoor courtyard with a view of the Empire State Building - highly recommended. Quiet room, large with bathroom with shower over bathtub with Victorian style amenities. Large on wall plasma tv, free wireless internet - big plus! Super comfortable bed and pillows. Great housekeeping service. Friendly staff. One block from subway located on 32nd street. Pleasant walk to Times Square. 24 hour deli opposite subway, recommend O'Reillys Irish pub for a drink or meal - one block away. Good souvenir shop around the corner. Easy to book on their website. They can organize airport transfers also. Recommend Citylights all loop tour including 4 bus tours (hopon hopoff), Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, Hudson River cruise, choice of ticket to either Empire State Building or Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Centre - all valid for 48 hours but we had prebooked and got a bonus day so extremely good value. Looking for theatre tickets try TKTS centre in Times Square for half price seats. Most plays and musicals available except Wicked and Billy Elliott. Wicked is worth buying full price - amazing musical! If you love cake try Magnolia Bakery for vanilla cupcakes - YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: aBROWNCHICK1
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, Clean, Fairly modern Complementary Hot Drinks in the morning Great friendly helpful staff, easy check in and check out. Connivent lockers for late travel. The room was available so we were able to check in a few hours early. Also allowed to check out a little late which is unheard of in the city. Great clean bed, linens, roomy wash room. We were in a room facing an office building there was a hum but no loud street sounds. We had fun would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem - highly recommended! Superb location!”
Reviews.Author: FiJMac
Reviews.Content: I searched forever to find us a hotel for the Xmas season (just before 17-22 Dec) in NYC and this one nearly passed me by. We almost ended up at the Hotel Pennslyvania but I'm so glad we didn't as last time I stayed it was grubby, but from what I've heard it has gotten grubbier! The Herald Square hotel is cheaper and nicer - it's a no brainer! We were given a refurbished room (score!) which was lovely, and we didn't mind at all that there wasn't much to see from the window because - at the end of the day - we were SO central (right by Macy's too!). We took advantage of the free coffee and treats in the little cafe area in the foyer (a lovely touch) and found the staff to be friendly and very helpful indeed. Broadway and Fifth Avenue are ridiculously close (seconds to walk) and the Empire State is on this hotel's doorstep. It's so great to find a little place like this in the middle of such a big vibrant city (especially at these prices) - it's the sort of gem you want to uncover everywhere you go. They say you get what you pay for, but at this hotel I felt we got a lot more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: finntastic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very convinient location: Macy's, Madison Sq garden and Empire State Building are all within 10-15 minutes walk. The nearest subway is one block away, Penn Station 3-4 blocks away. The hotel itself is no 5-star, but in its own class a very good one. We stayed for 6 nights in a renovated Queen room, which was smallish but adequate if you don't want to spend your entire holiday in your hotel room. The room was spotlessly clean, the cast iron bed was super comfortable and the decor neutral and pleasant. The flat screen tv had a lot of channels to choose from, and there is a free WiFi in the hotel (ask for the code when checking in). There were also a hairdryer, a safe and a make-up mirror in the room. The bathroom was big and airy and very beautifully decoreated in early 20th century style. The bathtub was big and the rain shower nice. The room was cleaned daily and the bedlinens and the towels changed. Outside the hotel looks better than when you get into the lobby: the reception is a bit dull as the staff sits behind a glass like in a post office. Nevertheless the staff was very helpful in all matters. When we got to the hotel, we didn't get any hot water but the maintenance guy fixed that in 2 minutes. There only limited services in the hotel: a free coffee automat in the lobby, guests' laundrette (handy for backpackers), a vending machine and a locker room for luggage if your plane leaves in the evening. The Herald Square is perfect for an independent traveller who doesn't want to pay a fortune for a hotel. There is no restaurant or breakfast room at the hotel, but there are plenty of restaurants around, and the Koreatown with its Korean restaurants is just one block away. There is also a post office almost next to the hotel, and on the othere side of the street, there is a small convenience store which is handy for a late snack or buying drinks for the hotel room. The only negatives would probably be the drab decor of the hallways and the lobby, and the fact that our window was to a courtyard that was quite dark, more like a ventilation shaft. The central heating was also a bit too efficient. We paid around $180 for a night, but made the reservation well in advance using the hotel's own pages.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem - what a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pengu55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem. I would class it as a boutique hotel for sure. Great location, very helpful staff and wonderful amenities. The only disadvantage would be no coffee/tea making facilities in room. Our room was small but really cute. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant staff, lovely room-fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CPatmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days during March and found the overall experience very enjoyable! PRO's; Wonderfully central location, near Herald Sq & subway station. In walking distance of Midtown attractions, even Central Park in 40mins at a push! Staff friendly & helpful with our requests, safe location, wonderful restaurants & shops close by (try 'Speedys' buffet style cafe). Room was beautifully decorated, chandeliers, comfy bed, widescreen TV- unexpected luxury! CON's; No daylight in the room which added to the length of our jetlag! Asked for quiet room but was very near janitors closet- therefore early morning clammering and talking over the radio in the corridor. No heating in the room for first 3 days, once this was fixed the radiator would judder and clang loudly approx 5 times a day (& in middle of night- probably an airlock). All things considered I would definitely go back! I would ask for a room with a view to get some daylight though!!

Reviews.Title: “will be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: mrtruthful
Reviews.Content: it was nice to go to nyc and still not have to spend alot. a short walk to time square and macy's and 1 1/2 blocksto msg . may not be fancy but well worth the money spent. room just remodeled and very clean

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable Bed Anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: happysingers
Reviews.Content: As part of a choir trip package to perform at Carnegie Hall, we stayed at the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station, then moved for a couple extra days to the Herald Square. Herald Square was a better deal, clean room, bigger bathroom (with a vent fan; no fan in GH bath), very comfortable bed with new mattress,friendly staff and a very decent location. Wife says the bed was "heavenly". This is a quaint old building which has been renovated and remodeled. I can only speak to our experience, but we plan on coming back to NY and will definitely stay at the Herald Square. Also, subway nearby on Broadway, Penn Station a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonable inner city accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Vivagold
Reviews.Content: Close to Penn Railway Station as well as the Grayline Double Decker Bus stop near the Empire State Building. Shared a room with another couple - really comfy queen beds but the room was pretty small, but enough room to put the cases on the floor & had a big bathroom. Another friend travelling with us had a single room, which was very small, but okay if you're only sleeping there. There's a sitting room with tables in the foyer where you can relax or have a tea/coffee which is provided free of charge. We thought it was good, clean accommodation in a good location. Nice meal at O'Reillys Irish Pub close by.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, hospitable value for money hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl025
Reviews.Content: We loved the free hot chocolate. Staff were always helpful. The room was small but clean and functional. Location was brilliant and provided excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best price downtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: EmyVonDee
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor my boyfriend and I decided to go to HeraldSquare Hotel anyway. What a great surprise!!! Let's be honest here people....who's going to NYC to stay in there room?...NO BODY!.... The room was small but really confortable (especialy the Queen size bed)...Flat screen TV + a really clean bathroom. The Hotel is actualy the old Life Magazine building wich add charm to the stay. The hotel is at 5 mins of walk of the Empire State Building and 10 mins of walk of the Flatiron building.... A great value...I highly recommended this hotel to alot of other friends! :)

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel !!!!!!!!!!! great value for money”
Reviews.Author: birthdaytreatIreland
Reviews.Content: my husband was 40yrs in nov went for a treat ! will defo stay again hope to book gor my 40yrs birthday in oct !!!!! well done mary c. cork

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BayswaterBabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of November. Unfortunately both of us caught a gastro bug on the way over and spent almost the whole time being very ill in the hotel so we definitely made use of our room! Fortunately we went for a renovated room (our friends both stayed in non renovated rooms and said that they were tiny and very very basic, one of our friends even had the electricity to his room cut while he was having a shower and had to shower in the dark!). We spent ages looking at hotels and this was the cheapest we could find when we were looking (although still quite expensive). The room was on the second floor and gorgeous, chandeliers, huge queen size bed which was very comfortable, wardrobe and safe in the room. Beautiful bathroom with the biggest rain fall shower I have ever seen. There were also mini Aveda bath and hair products which was wonderful for me as I love Aveda! The room was very warm but there was air conditioning which was a little loud but overall fine. We had a big flat screen TV opposite our bed with loads of channels which was great for watching TV in bed. There was also a little table with a couple of chairs which was great since we did have to eat take away in our room on a few occasions because we were ill. The only bad thing about the room was that it was a bit dark. There was one window in the bathroom and the room which both opened up on to an internal part of the hotel so there wasn't much natural light although plenty of bright internal ones which made up for it and there was also some sort of extractor fan thing which we could hear if we opened the window. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom but it was really weak and took me about ten times longer than usual to dry my hair and it kept getting scorchingly hot making it difficult to hold. I did have my own little powerful travel hairdryer but with the adaptor just made it also very weak which was a little annoying. There was also some sort of work going on at the hotel during the day which was a little annoying for us as we ended up being ill and having to sleep during the day while there was constant very loud banging and drilling going on. Usually this wouldn't bother us tho as we would have been out sightseeing. The location is decent, mid town and just a block away from the Empire State and Broadway. The nearest subway stations were a couple of blocks away in various directions. Check in was efficient and the staff were fine. There were coffee facilities in the foyer which we used and there is a bar next door to the hotel which is quite nice. Would stay here again if got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Jodi99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights over New Year's 2008/09 and couldn't have been more impressed. Staff were friendly and helpful, hotel has great amenities (guest laundry was very handy), the room was much bigger than we thought it would be, with a huge bathroom. Location is obviously a drawcard, but the room was a quiet oasis in the heart of the city. Compared with other hotels in NYC in this price range, the Herald Square is exceptional. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel excellent location,”
Reviews.Author: NZCub
Reviews.Content: this was a very centrally located hotel. 5 stars for location, it was a 10 minute walk to times square, 5 minutes to penn station, macys, empire state building etc,etc. it was very close to the herald square subway station which made it very easy to travel all over the city. even though its located right in a busy area it was very quiet inside the hotel, we were on the 5th floor and couldnt hear any street noise.The room itself was small and old looking but functional, it was clean and the housekeeping service was good. the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and was very clean, the linen was also nice and clean. there was a safe and a new tv in the room, there was no tea/coffee facilities in rooms. there was very little space to put suitcases the room was pretty much taken up by the bed. we could hear a bit of noise though the walls. the hotel itself and the location felt very safe which was great. the lifts were very slow. The lobby area was great but unfortunately the coffee machine was out of action and never got fixed while we were there. there are laundry services (self service) and internet access (only one computer though) available for a price. The staff were ok, some were lovely but others were a bit rude and abrupt but we found that with a lot of the service staff all over new york anyhow. it seems pricy for a budget hotel but when you consider the location and compare it to other hotels in the area that offer private ensuites it is really very well priced. beware they dont include taxes in the advertised rates they add them on at the end of your stay. there is a city tax, state tax and occupancy fee. overall we found taxes increased our bill by 15%. all in all this is a great hotel if you want a room just to sleep in with a private ensuite on a budget in an excellant location. I wouldnt recommend it for travellers who want to spend a lot of time in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: TheCulens
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Herald Square. Having tralled the internet for hours trying to find something reasonably priced, clean and central we settled for here. It really is a great location, central to everything. Empire State and Macy's around the corner, Madison Square Garden a short walk away and plently of places to pick up the MTA (New Yorks Underground). We had a refurbished room, which was really spacious, very clean and had an extremely comfortable bed, which is what you need after walking around all day long! The showers were also very warm and the room was cleaned and fresh towels left each morning. There are two lifts at the hotel, which are extremely slow and sometimes take ages to reach your floor, so a couple of times we took the stairs. There is a coffee machine situated in the reception/rest area, which is a nice touch, although it was out of order for two of the days when we were there! As with most of America, the prices quoted on the internet for the rooms DO NOT include tax and when we were presented with our final bill it included almost Â£50 per night various tax charges, which was quite alarming and increased our expenditure by Â£200. All in all a great location and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Cecis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great price for New York City. It has a good location, aproximately 12 blocks from Times Square, and near the subway and Penn Station. It is clean and the staff is extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugz22
Reviews.Content: Very well located in the heart of New York City and just a block from the Empire State Building, the Herald Square Hotel was, for lack of a better word, average. Although some of the rooms have been newly remodelled, ours was outdated but generally tidy. The bathroom was clean but a bit old and the appliances (TV, airconditioning etc) looked like it dated back to the late 70's early 80's. The staff were friendly enough but seemed to give off the impression that they were only there for the paycheck and the hotel did seem a bit over priced even by summer standards. It's somewhere to sleep and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who likes to spend some part of their holiday relaxing in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: montsinperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Herald Square Hotel 13/10/08 - 20/10/08 also 24 and 25/10/08 first visit to New York so was unsure which way to go for a hotel.Very happy with the Herald Square, good location and rooms were very clean.If you want a hotel with a big flashy lobby it is not for you but if you want value for money and very comfortable beds then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “One of New York's gems”
Reviews.Author: TA_from_Down_Under
Reviews.Content: Our family of three (2 adults and 11 yo) spent 5 nights at the Herald Square Hotel (HSH) in September. I would rate the HSH as one of New York's more affordable gems. We arrived in New York early on a Monday morning after a red eye flight from San Francisco. We wanted to drop our luggage off and begin our exploration of New York. We were pleasantly surprised to be told that they had our room available and we could check in then and there. The room itself was comfortable. While the room was not huge, it did have two double beds and there was enough room for our three large suitcases. The room itself was quiet, and there were shutters and block-out blinds on the windows. The comfortable beds and pillows meant that we all slept well. The bathroom was adequate, with plenty of hot water. There was also a free room safe for the storage of valuables. Housekeeping was very good. We always returned to a nice tidy room at the end of the day. Hotel staff were always pleasant and helpful. The HSH also has a good laundry facility and a pay internet kiosk. They also offer free coffee/tea/hot chocolate in the lounge adjoining the foyer. The location of the Herald Square Hotel is excellent. We regularly walked to and from Times Square. Or there was a subway stop two blocks away. Penn Street Station is also only a ten minute walk away - even when wheeling suitcases. We found a number of restauants within about a 15 minute walk (There is also a good restaurant right next door if you dont want to walk). For breakfast, we walked less than 2 blocks to Speedys. In summary, the Herald Square Hotel is a very pleasant hotel and very good value by New York standards. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: phelan24647
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the Herald Square hotel and the hotel was perfect for my needs. Booked a single room with bathroom (room 410) cost $460 for the 4 nights which is great value for New york. The room was, as expected,small but given the amount of time I spent in the room that was'nt a problem Lobby with free tea/coffee etc was an added bonus. I'd also recommend the Airtrain service if coming from JFK airport, terminus is Penn station which is a short walk from the hotel. From Hotel to Airport took about 50 mins, cost was $12.25, much cheaper than a taxi especially when travelling on your own.

Reviews.Title: “New York on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: RedJune
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. It is a small friendly hotel, the rooms are basic, but they are clean and adequate. This time our room was quite big with a good size, bright bathroom. Unfortunately we were on the ground floor. (We must have looked old and infirm when we arrived, when in fact we were just recovering from an awful flight) The room was dark as the window looked out onto a small backyard, so we didnt have a view at all. We should have asked to move to another room on a higher floor, but apart from the darkness it was a good room. There is a lounge area near the main entrance and a small area with tables and chairs where you can have a drink of coffee, tea or hot chocolate from the machine. Also, there are bowls of sweets, and lovely Italian biscuits for guests to help themselves to. The hotel is in a good place, just round the corner from the Empire State Building, a short walk from Times Square and Maceys. We ate at the Heartland Brewery on 5th Ave most nights and would reccommend it for a good meal. I would definitely reccommend the hotel if you are looking for a budget hotel in New York. You dont spend very much time in your room, there are lots of wonderful things to see and do. Just ask for a room on a higher floor. I would also reccommend the show Spamalot. It is brilliantly funny.

Reviews.Title: “Best price & location!”
Reviews.Author: Djet3k
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for a week in september and was really impressed with the location and price. The staf wasn't the most helpfull and the rooms where as tiny as they can get, i was only there for sleepig anyway. But for that price and location (right around the corner from the Empire state building) you just cant find a better deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hag14
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at the Herald Square Hotel last June. Stayed for a week with my girlfriend, and our room was pretty much what we had expected. The Hotel is close to many great shops and we fell in love with the breakfast menu in a restaurant chain nearby, called SpeedyÂ´s. We were satisfied with the service and I would recommend this hotel to anyone whoÂ´s looking for a good bargain while also getting a great location. And also we asked a woman who was working in the lobby to get us a shuttle to the airport, and the driver that we got was very nice and professional.

Reviews.Title: “great warm place in chlly NYC”
Reviews.Author: JaneHolland
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull 5 night stay at the Herald. We got a great bargain: we got a new room for the price of an unrenovated room. The bed was really nice, the room was really clean, good service and excellent location. The room was big enough for us two. Nice and quiet and nice decorations. Everything was well looked after. there is no breakfast service, but they have suggestions for nice places just around the corner. There is a free warm drinks service in the lobby where you also can relax and read a paper. I would really return.

Reviews.Title: “Herald Square is a square deal”
Reviews.Author: Lv2CWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in one of their (supposedly) unrenovated queen rooms, so not their cheapest option, but still a bargain compared to other hotels near Amtrak's Penn Station. (The double bed rooms were all booked so this was the cheapest option for 2 people.) We may have lucked into a nicer room than we paid for as it was quite large and the bathroom looked like it had been redone in the past year or two. (Room #512.) We booked directly with them online 8 weeks in advance of our September arrival. Our 5th floor room overlooked the busy street, but it wasn't too noisy. The black out shades and comfy bed made for a good night's sleep. Few frills (other than the nice selection of tea in the lobby), but definitely a good deal in a VERY convenient location. There was a desk with one chair, but otherwise if you both wanted to read the options were to either sit up in bed (there were overhead lights over each side that made that possible) OR go down to the lobby. I never saw the luggage locker as we had a rolling duffle that the desk clerk said was too large for them. For $1 a bag it was worth it to leave the luggage with them in the larger storage area so we could arrive earlier than the official check-in (our room was not ready when we arrived at noon). It was great to have a reasonable bagel/deli place within 2 blocks for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Herald Square Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: littleengine
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Herald Square Hotel and again I was not disappointed. I arrived in NYC very early (5:30am) on the morning of Sept 8 and knew that my room wouldn't be ready. I was fully prepared to throw my bag into one of their storage lockers and head out to explore the city, so I was not put off at all when the front desk clerk told me nothing was ready. He gladly gave me the key to the guest/public washroom so I could freshen up and change, sold me a token for the lockers, and told me to enjoy the free coffee, etc.. in the lobby/lounge before I headed out. For the price I paid ($99 for a single room with private bathroom), I actually got a double room courtesy of a free upgrade when I checked in later in the day. I'm not sure if it's because they took pity on me, having arrived so early after being on a bus all night, but I didn't care the reason - they did the same thing when I stayed for 4 nights last year - I just knew I appreciated it. The room was not huge, but if you come to NYC expecting all the hotel rooms to be palaces (expecially in period/character buildings like this one), then you can only blame yourself for any disappointment you feel. The room was clean, however, and the bed was amazingly comfortable (must get the name of the brand they use), and the whole place was quite soundproof from what I could tell. I only ever saw people in the elevators and even though the hotel was fully booked, I didn't even know I had neighbours right next to me until the day I checked out and I saw them coming down the hallway as I waited for the elevator. I've recommended this hotel to friends and they've come back saying the same thing. Even though the price of the single room has gone up $20/night (from $79 to $99/night) from when I stayed there last year, I can say that it's still a great bargain for NYC, where the closest thing you'll find in price is a hostel where instead of having a private room, you'd be sharing both a dorm room and a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MadridWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Good city hotel. The room was small but clean and comfortable. Perfect location: near Penn Station and the Empire State Building. Free coffe and biscuits. Negative things: one of the employees at the front desk was quite rude, the rest were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “NOT the best deal in town!”
Reviews.Author: firsttimeinny
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying at the Herald Square Hotel and we wouldn't do it again. It is a good location but it lacks the basic necessities and the front desk staff were not helpful and unwilling to do even the simplest of things. We asked for the toll free number for the airport shuttle and the front desk clerk told us she didn't have it. Since we had paid for our hotel upon arrival, she told us that we could not use the phone in our hotel to call the shuttle. Then I noticed the toll free number for the shuttle on the wall next to the computer and pointed it out to her. She said it was a concierge number and I couldn't call it but it was the exact same number that I had called from Canada! I told her this and she just shrugged her shoulders. I thought this was very rude. Call yourself for your shuttle because they charge extra to book it for you. The hotel says that they have coffee, tea and chocolates available all of the time but this is not true. There are no chocolates and they do not replenish the tea or milk, etc. in a timely manner. The hotel lacks shampoo, conditioner, radio, telephone book, city guides. I was not told this when I booked and luckily, we brought our own. You have to be very careful which room and what floor you get as some rooms are without windows, are musty and not pleasant as we heard from other guests. We were also charged an additional $40 for the room, compared to the price I was given over the phone. In meeting other tourists, we discovered there are hotels with better prices and better accommodations. We will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cherub58
Reviews.Content: We went there for our honeymoon in May after reading the great reviews. The price was reasonable, the bed was comfy and the bathroom quite roomy. The staff was friendly and we had no problem with staying an extra night. The coffee in the morning was great and one day we even walked to the Dunkin Donuts and bought food in to eat at one of the tables in the lobby. The room was clean, we did'nt want to spend a fortune and we we used the extra savings for a show a few nice dinners. We did go to the wine bar next door. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but awful otherwise (this was in 2003)”
Reviews.Author: Lightingout
Reviews.Content: I'm going to preface this review with the fact that I stayed at the Herald Square Hotel almost five years ago, when a room could still be had for under $100 a night, and it could have changed substantially since then. Judging from the number of positive reviews posted here, that's a possibility. But you might want to take a look at some of the negative reviews, as there's also a possibility that there is a range a room types, some a lot better than others. I may have had the worst room in the house. In 2003, there was no link on Expedia with which to review the hotel, and I definitely wanted to review it, as my experience there was terrible. I just took a look; there's still no link on Expedia. That should tell you something. My first contact with reception was a phone call to ask if it was possible to upgrade to another room with two beds, in order to share with another guest. The woman who answered the phone said there were no alternative rooms available. When I asked if there was a possibility of putting in a cot, she dismissed that with a laugh, and then cut me off. When I got into the room, I could see why she had laughed: it was tiny, and one of the dimmest, dreariest spaces I've ever been in. There were no windows to speak of, only one high up toward the ceiling that looked out to what seemed like an alley way - only you really couldn't see out at all. The room was bifurcated at the foot of the bed by a demi wall-column that doubled as a closet. The whole feeling was closed-in, positively clausterphobic. I would have tried to change hotels then and there, only it was a Friday night on a big game weekend, so the prospects were dim. I was pretty much stuck there for Friday and Saturday nights, but was determined to get out for Sunday night, which I did. There's no lobby in the hotel to speak of, only a small room with the reception desk behind plate-glass. Off to the side is a small room that did have a computer that guests can use, one very small amenity in a hotel that had virtually none. The other redeeming feature was the artwork on the walls - reproductions from the old Life Magazine, which used to own the building. I had one other encounter with the woman I first spoke to, and that was when I called to cancel Sunday night. She was once again very rude, and I told her so. Note: it is very rare that I ever say anything like that to anyone. A final insult from that visit was what looked like hugely inflated phone charges on my bill for the few phone calls I made - beyond the usual hotel gouging, I'd say. Needless to say, changing hotels from Herald Square to the Quality Hotel Times Square was a huge relief. I traded one tiny room for another pretty small one, but the latter was simply heavenly by comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - maybe splash out for en-suite next time”
Reviews.Author: limehotcheeto
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Herald Square Hotel and but for the state of the shared bathing room, I was impressed considering the room rate. Taking a shared bath room is always an adventure anyway. I was in one of the $89 single rooms ($89! In NY!), which was tiny and clean with a very comfortable single bed. There was a rockin' cold air conditioner in the window, a small nightstand, a safe, a sink with mirror and bar of soap, a hand towel, washcloth, and bath towel, and a clothes hanging bar. The room smelt a little fusty and close (like a small room smells in the morning when someone has slept in it), but since it has a window a/c and not central ventilation, that makes some sense. To get to the shared bathing room (one per floor if I recall), I went down my hall, through a door, left, left again, and down another hall. This was slightly inconvenient in the middle of the night. The bathroom was stifling hot at all hours - seemed like it had the heat on in the hottest weekend in July - and twice I discovered someone had not flushed. Yuck! This is clearly not the hotel's fault, but in any case it made me wary of using the shower. The folks at reception were unfailingly friendly and kind and allowed me to check in as soon as my room was ready - 10 a.m. in this case! The complimentary coffee, tea, and chocolates were handy, as was the free wireless. The location is clearly fantastic. I'll stay there again if I can get one of the single bed en-suite rooms. They are fantastically reasonable in price as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kipdynamit
Reviews.Content: When booking online I wasn't sure what to expect....4 girls managed to live quite comfortably in a 2 queen rm for 8 days. It was very hot while we were there and the airconditioning was a godsend. Always fresh towels, friendly staff and very clean. They have laundry facilitys which was great, a nice lounge with tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc. The only thing that sucked was there is only 1 key per room, but you can drop it in the box at the front desk for others to pick up later. Beds were soooo comfortable ,linens nice and fresh. The location was.....AWESOME! You are in walking distance to practically everything and if not...the subway is at your doorstep. Post office is a few doors down, great Irish pub a block away, Pax deli around the corner, which was great (and cheap) for breakfast. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: lum79
Reviews.Content: the hotel was not bad. the staff was very kind and the room was quite clean. we could have coffee, tea, chamomile, and also some sweets whenever we wanted. the hotel is really in the centre of the city, and this is another good quality of it, as in new york we found an odissey to move by subway (I wonder why the city still doesn't think of a renew of the subways...they really need it!). for the rest, the room was quite small, but given the price, it was appropriate. the only thing that was not satisfactory was the light: the room faced a wall at a distance of a few meters, and during the day there was almost the same light as during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook a good budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pmariel
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by first impressions. Sure the lifts are slow (there's stairs for the impatient!). This is an excellent budget hotel, centrally located for sightseeing (Empire State Building) & shopping (Macy's) & eating ( Little Korea), just request one the newly renovated rooms. We stayed five days after a long trip through Central Asia and Russia and greatly appreciated the hotel's services such as the guest laundry , the internet room and the 24 hour tea/coffee making facilities in the lobby/tea room, not to mention the extremely comfortable bed and the HOT water (which eventually does appear). 99.99% of the Herald Square staff were professional and exceedingly polite and helpful with the exception of ......yep, the rude, unhelpful, surly check-in person who couldn't 'find' our reservation made nine months previously. Classic case of "Computer says....... Naaaaaaaaaa!." So.... don't be put off by first impressions.........(tho' I think those without people skills should be moved to back of house at best)........ the Herald Square Hotel has much to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great rates in the city”
Reviews.Author: lalunallena
Reviews.Content: Considering the rate of $99/night in the city, I knew I wouldn't be given much. The room was small, but clean. There was just enough room for a twin bed and me to walk around it. Overall, I had a good experience. It could use a coat of paint and more outlets (I only had 3)! If you choose this type of room, I would advise you take a power strip. I had to rotate charging my phone, laptop, video camera, and rechargeable batteries. And I had a hair dryer and flat iron to deal with too. My main complaint about this hotel is the shower, they need to do something with the plumbing. I'd set the temperature, then it would turn cold on me and then really hot. Even with the cold water off completely, it would still be cold. That was really annoying. But I know they were doing some work on my floor so I hope that will be addressed soon. If I were to get a good rate as I did this time, I would stay again. It's in a decent part of Midtown and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom as big as rest of room”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Herald Square several times over the years, in rooms ranging from bathroom-free to unrenovated queen, and it's always been a dependable budget option. Where else can you get a bed and a bath for $99? Actually, the last time I stayed all there all I got was a bed and a bath. Either I've been extremely lucky and upgraded every time I've been there, but this room was literally a cubby hole--bed, a couple of narrow shelving units mostly occupied by phone, TV etc etc and a bathroom that was as big as the room itself. Since it was just me and just a base of operations, it wasn't that huge a deal, but the lack of storage area was a little disconcerting. Lighting was minimal and there was no natural light--the room's window opened to an empty shaft. Turn around with your arms outstretched and you're going to hit something. Even so, the Herald Square is still one of the best deals in the city...extremely clean, efficiently managed and apparently I'm there enough that some of the desk staff recognizes me now. But next time, either I'll keep my fingers crossed for an upgrade or move a step up on the room chain.

Reviews.Title: “Herald Square Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: faulkner2
Reviews.Content: For $250 per night in Manhattan the Herald Square is good value. Be sure to get room with Simmons Health Smart mattress. Good location for Times Square and subways. Our room was clean, there was plenty of hot water, the staff was friendly and helpful and when we had to relocate due to room construction noise close to our room there was no problem whatsoever. Overall, a good experience and worth the money. If you want plush, move up in price.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: k8eq
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, my new husband and I made it a point to ask for a renovated room and it was well worth it. We were in Manhattan for 2 nights while on our honeymoon and were very happy with the accommodations. We stayed on the first floor in a room with a comfortable bed and a flat screen television, and although it had no view out the windows it was quiet and spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful and the coffee machine in the lounge area was a definite plus. The location is great: 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, 1 block from the subway and only a couple more for the train station (we carried a week's worth of luggage with no problem), and right between Broadway and 5th Avenue (we walked to Mamma Mia from the hotel). We are very grateful for the Tripadvisor website! Thanks to all of the honest reviews we had a fantastic honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ILovesTravelling
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent five nights at the Herald Square and were very pleased with our stay. The room was big and very clean with a functional AC unit that kept it cool and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was big and bright. Although we had no view whatsoever, we were pleased with our stay. The downside was the change in temperature in the water while showering, especially in the AM. The hotel staff were not so friendly, but that was not important to us. TIP-If you need a cab to and from the airport, take a yellow cab and not a private cab as recommended by the hotel, the fee is $45 dollars plus toll compared to $65 plus toll with a private cab. All in all we had a great time, the hotel was in a good location with all tourist areas close by. We would return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accom for a solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: Terry007Adelaide
Reviews.Content: I was so glad that I found out about this hotel! I booked a single room with private bathroom. It was perfect for a solo traveller. Less than $900 inc taxes for 7 nights. I was on the 5th floor. Granted the room was small, but this is NYC, and who spends time in the room, except for sleep? The room and bathroom were spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable. There was no view, my room looked out to the fire escape next door and sometimes it was hard to tell if it was day or night. In room WiFi worked well. There was 2 bars of soap left each day in the bathroom as well as fresh towells, and water was hot and had good pressure. The lobby has free tea and coffee (and Hershey kisses) and has a comfortable waiting lounge if you have to wait to check in or for you transport to the airport. Also in the lobby behind the elevators, are public phones and a phone card machine, clean and well equipped guest laundry, ice and coke machine. A internet PC is also back there as are lockers for storing your bags before/after checkin/out and public restrooms. Yes the elevators are slow, although the one to the left is faster than the one straight ahead. "SOME" of the hotel staff were a little surly, but in the main were pleasant. One thing I didnt like was you had to be "buzzed" in the front door by the desk staff, which gives it a bit of a low rent feel, but I suppose it keeps the bums out!! The hotel is in a great location, close to the subway at 34th and Herald Square. Empire State is just a couple of blocks away. If your wife /girlfriend (or boyfriend) likes to shop for handbags and accessories, or perfume, there are shops in the surrounding streets that sell plenty of these. There is a Post Office a few doors up near the corner of 31st and Broadway which is handy. On the other corner of the block (5th av) there is a Dunkin Donuts and Subway to grab a snack or some breakfast on the way out. All in all I can recommend this hotel highly and would not hesitate staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller3
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to NY and I've stayed in some dumps which cost more than the HS hotel, so I was slightly weary about staying here having read some of the other reviews - however I was pleasantly surprised. We booked an unrenovated triple room (2 double beds). The room was small, had a dated decor feel (looked very similar to the pictures on the previous review) and there was not much of a view from the window, but who cares. The most important thing is that the room is clean, secure and the linen is fresh - which it certainly was. The beds were extremely comfortable which is important after a long days shopping. The hotel has a great position (walking distance to Macy's) and the nearby Metro gets you uptown and downtown easily. The people on the door were friendly and the bar next door is great for a glass of wine. There's also a great place called Speedy's on Broadway which is great for breakfast. Overall, considering it's NY and the cost of hotels, this is an excellent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: paula6448
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a birthday weekend for my boyfriend and I. This was the cheapest hotel so I booked and hoped for the best. Overall, I realize its New York, but I definitley don't feel I got my moneys worth. I didn't get a renovated room so I wasn't expecting much. The bed was pretty comfortable but small, we had a double but it was much smaller than any double I had ever seen before. Also the comforter had a stain on that grossed me out, it may have been coffee but eww.Our view was of a fire escape that looked right into our room so the blind was always shut for privacy so our room ended up being pitch black at 10 am. The toilet didn't flush right and it took 15 minutes to get hot water and we had very weak water pressure. The people at the front desk we generally friendly but the biggest problem I had was the guy that held our bags after we checked out. Our bus home did not leave until 5 so the hotel offered to hold our bags. The man came and got our bags and led us to the closet, after stuffing our bags (which had breakables) very carelessly into a cubby, he then demanded us to tip him!!! I reluctantly tipped him because I was scared and didnt want him to mess around with our luggage. After returning to pick up our luggage we went back to the closet and found that our luggage had been moved around the entire closet. The man handed us a few bags and then we realized he forgot about half, which included my laptop. The he handed me a bag upside down and stuff started falling out and the breakables bag had been squished and crunched. Then he had the audacity to ask for another tip!!! I told him no and left. Overall not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value NY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brucel_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a neighbor. I booked a renovated room with a queen size bed and was delighted with the hotel and room. The room was spotless, well furnished and will appointed. the bathroom was clean and will appointed with piping hot water in the shower. There is free wireless internet, a flat screen TV and importantly, a safe in the room to lock up your valuables. I did not have a view, but as I spent most of my time out of the room, this did not bother me. The hotel is superbly positioned, close to the main Broadway Theaters, Madison square gardens, Times square and all the big shops. The empire state building, Rockefeller Center and Times square are all in easy walking distance. There is also a subway station just around the corner. This hotel is excellent value and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Grayson99
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable. Nice rooms with new beds and bedding. Nice plasma tv with cable. Free wi-fi. Great location - within walking distance to many things.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: taonga
Reviews.Content: Great location, The staff were friendly and helpful. 24 hour service which was good. Our room was small but clean. The showers a very small. The hotel is just behind the empire state building, and very close to macys and some major shops. I would recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “better than adequate”
Reviews.Author: historykev
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 319 for four nights, paying $735 inc of all taxes. My overall experience was positive. My room was in the un-refurbished section. When I asked about changing, the lady at the desk told me I would have to pay more. Ah well. The room faced a dingy concrete building but was at the end of a corridor so I heard little of other guests. The room was cool at tfirst and then rather warm - I'm not sure which I prefer. The hotel room was perfectly adequate and clean, however, and, as others have described, the bed was extremely comfortable. The pluses are the location (two blocks from the Empire State building), the bed, the relative quiet. The staf were courteous to me. Negatives: The hotel had a low rent feel, given its insistence on a $20 deposit for an iron and a $25 phone deposit (using a phone card, however, is free - I received my deposit back with nothing deducted after making 3 calls to the UK). It makes you wonder who stays here?

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen5959
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for New York. Great location for shopping. My family stayed five nights in two renovated rooms on the 1st floor. They were spacious and clean with comfortable beds, flat-screen TV and lovely marble-tiled bathrooms. We then travelled elsewhere before spending one night at the hotel before flying home. This time we were in two rooms on the 9th floor, which, although renovated, managed to be GRIM. The bathrooms weren't as well decorated and the bedroom furniture, apart from the beds, wasn't very nice. So AVOID THE 9TH FLOOR!! The staff were generally very friendly and very helpful. There's complementary tea and coffee, and although the hotel doesn't offer breakfast, Speedy's Deli a few minutes walk away is very good. We prefer anyway not to take the generally mediocre complementary NYC hotel breakfasts. The lobby area isn't very impressive and the corridors generally are a bit grim, but I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. It's good value for New York, and the renovated rooms - on the 1st floor anyway - are excellent. P.S. While you're here, check out the wonderful Korean restaurants on nearby 32nd St. (bet. B'way & 5th). Kum Gang San, for example, does great barbecue dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Book a "New Queen Room" and you'll love it!”
Reviews.Author: MelbCityGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Herald Square for three nights in September 2007 and loved it. The hotel building is nothing flash, especially the reception area, but we were expecting this having read the reviews on TripAdvisor. But I was pretty confident that the "New Queen Room" we booked on the hotel website would be adequate and value for money - and it was! The bed was very comfortable, the room huge by NYC standards and the bathroom was immaculate. The room was quiet, the TV was good and everything in the room worked as it should. Other pluses: the laundry facilities, the free tea/coffee/hot chocolate/cookies in the lobby, the fantastic mid-town location and the staff were nice enough too (didn't have that many interations but check-in and check-out were painless). And, on check-out we were presented with a lovely souvenier keyring which was the (unexpected) icing on the cake after a very pleasent and comfortable stay. We paid US$209 before taxes/night which was very reasonable for the standard of accommodation we received. I would definitely stay gain and would recommend to others who want good value for money in an excellent midtown location. I have attached some pictures of the room so you can see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great staying: more than a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Miss77Patti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald Square for 5 nights, last week. They gave me a new large queen room, which was stunning: big, very clean, high ceilings, flat screen and a beautiful shower. The bed was so comfortable, the crew always nice and helpful and the location is absolutely the best. It was very different from my idea of 1 star hotel (more three or four, seeing the room) and the price for nyc is quite reasonable, so I don't understand people complaining about slow elevators and few extra services: everything you'll possibly need you will find at the herald square, all the rest is enjoying the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful beds!”
Reviews.Author: Clare41
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a 4 night stay in the Herald Square Hotel. I was very impressed with everything about this hotel. The location is superb - located on west 31st Street between 5th and Broadway, the Empire State Building is literally around the corner as is Macy's. Walking distance to so many of the main sights. I walked to MOMA, Times Square, St Patrick's Cathedral etc. The staff were very friendly (thanks especially to Augusta and Karl), the room was immaculately kept and the bed was wonderful - I had 4 fantastic night's sleep. The free tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc in the lobby is a great idea. I will definitely stay at this hotel again as would the friends I travelled with. Well done Herald Square Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jenrosenyc
Reviews.Content: I had a single room when I stayed, and the room was very small but had a private bathroom, which is rare in NYC for the price of the Herald Square Hotel. No-frills but very clean - the best part is the bed, I had a FABULOUS night's sleep on the VERY comfortable mattress. FYI, they advertise hairdryer, iron etc. on the website, but be prepared to leave a $20 deposit for each, which you get back when you return it. The lobby had a coffee machine, and in the morning they put out cookies, chocolates, etc, all complimentary. I would absolutely stay at the Herald Square Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KamaLinn
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 2 night stay at the hotel. We did have an older room and I thought the rate was wonderful ($98 a night). I had read many reviews here and thought we were getting a "newer" room until I realized that I had booked just a regular queen. This was okay because we're more for cost than for extra comfort and room that we don't necessarily need right now. Anyway, arrived at the hotel at 2:00. The being buzzed in wasn't a problem as there is a huge window where the receptionist sits right by the front entrance. She said our room wasn't read and would be ready at 3. We went out and came back around 3:15 and it still wasn't ready, so we went out and decided to come back at night when we were ready to go to bed. They rent out lockers for $2 each to leave your luggage in--ours barely fit in 1--2 backpacks, a small duffel bag and a rolling carry-on. Our room was an older room--bed, night stand, small bathroom and a closet. This worked for us though as we only needed the room to sleep in. The bed was comfortable and it was an enjoyable time. I would recommend this hotel. I looked at the rates recently and noticed that they have gone up significantly. I'm assuming they are trying to make up for their renovation rates. About 2 days after we booked our room, I found our same room on their site for $150 more! The staff was friendly, but nothing exceptional. The location is great--very close to so many sight seeing places!!!! We only saw the older room that we stayed in--heard construction noise in the morning, so we're assuming that they are redoing the entire hotel and won't have older/cheaper rooms for much longer. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Reception Staff Have An Attitude”
Reviews.Author: virgo2408
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived my single bedroom was an ok size but there ws drilling work so I asked to be moved. They moved me to a much nicer room which had been newly decorated and was pleasant and spacious. When the weekend came I was moved into a shoe box as they had no other rooms available. I HAVE NEVER SLEPT IN SUCH A TINY ROOM BEFORE IN MY LIFE!!!!!!It was so small it should have been free. It was one of the most horrendous experiences I have ever had. I was paying exactly the same amount but was moved into a room quarter of the size of the previous one because of lack of space. The room was so small I had to keep the door open when I was sitting inside it. When paying in advance for my room I was billed for using my free access number calling card from the hotel phone. I asked why I had been charged for this and was told "We are done dealing with that". Never in my life have I experienced such rudeness from hotel staff. Needless to say, I checked out the next day because of the tiny room and the general moodiness of the front desk staff. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd Like To Keep This One a Secret!!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin80
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a belated Valentine's Day weekend with my wife in Manhattan. We selected the Herald Square Hotel a few weeks ago based on a recommendation and made reservations. When we showed up, I must admit, I was a bit apprehensive due to the fact that you have to be "buzzed in" to get into the hotel lobby and the receptionists are behind thick glass. I felt I was in a bank in a bad neighborhood. However, this is a no-frills hotel. There is no concierge, no porters, so I can understand why they would take certain security measures. From what I understand, the hotel is undergoing renovations, and parts of the lobby prove that fact. There is a decent sitting area and another area where you can grab a cup of free coffee along with complimentary chocolates. We discovered that this hotel used to be the original LIFE magazine building, and they have done their best to preserve that heritage with many, many LIFE photographs positioned throughout the lobby & the building. We arrived early on Saturday and were told that our room was indeed ready. The receptionist was very friendly and told us that we have a beautiful room on the 8th floor. Great! Keeping in mind that this building was built in the late 1800's, the elevator ride was an experience. In this day and age of super fast elevators, the elevator here is as slow as molasses. If you're in a hurry, take the stairs. Our room was a surprise. Everything in it looked brand new. From previous poster's pictures, it seems as though our room was just recently renovated. Also, since we were on the top floor, we had 15ft high ceilings, which was a treat. The walls were freshly painted, we had a window view to nowhere, which is fine, as there's nothing to see out any 8th floor window in the city, unless you're on the shoreline. There was a queen sized bed in the room. As for the size of the room, it was fairly small, but with the high ceilings, it didn't matter. The bathroom also appeared freshly renovated, completely tiled, with a brand new tub, and a rain-style shower head. The bathroom was about 1/4 the size of the room, very large! One minor complaint was that the hot water took a little bit of time to get warm, but once it got there, no issue. Room amenities included a 27 inch flat screen TV, a large room safe, a small table, a small desk, and a telephone. At night, there were no strange noises and it was very quiet. The location is very good, right on 31st & Broadway. You're withing walking distance to the Village, Penn Station, Grand Central, the Empire State building, Times Square, & Rockefeller Center. My wife did not want me to write this review as she would prefer to keep this hotel a secret, but fortunately, I believe in sharing. Since it is my understanding that the hotel is currently being renovated and since we were lucky enough to be put on the 8th floor with the higher ceilings and renovated rooms, this is definitely a favorable review. Judging from some of the other rooms shown in previous poster's pictures, I would recommend that if you're coming to this hotel, that you ask for a renovated room. Total cost for a Saturday night stay with all taxes, for a room with a queen sized bed: $196.

Reviews.Title: “a dump”
Reviews.Author: smartie
Reviews.Content: what a dump, ok so the location is good, but it's no better than a glorified boarding house unless you have one of the upgraded rooms. Lobby is revolting, elevators travel at snail's pace, seating area in the lobby is at youth hostel standard, there is no bar - just a vending machine for coffee. rooms are tiny, bathrooms the size of a closet, Hotel was cold, numerous requests to put the heating on were met with disdain (it;s not cold enough outside yet!!) well it was cold enough inside. Corridors are noisy and unattractive.

Reviews.Title: “A good find”
Reviews.Author: vickyn_y2k
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel if on a budget. we had a newly renovated queen room which was nice, but on the small side. are window didn't look out to much, a courtyard for all the buildings. The bed was very comfy which was needed after a good day of shopping! The flat screen tv is a nice touch aswel as the aveda soap in the bathroom. the room was very clean and the staff were alright, not the best! the hot chocolate is god down stairs and for location, it was perfect. just off the the main roads so you avoid noise at night and right beside macy's and someother god shops, just a few blocks from madison square etc... i would recommend it o anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: trollgutten
Reviews.Content: Good location, low rates, ugly lobby, slow elevator, great beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Hereald Square”
Reviews.Author: Clark_W_Griswold
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 remodeled queen room directly on the hotelâ€™s website at $139/ night for 4 nights in February. Location is fine as other reviews state so I wonâ€™t elaborate â€“ although it is in a business district and there are not many â€˜goodâ€™ places to eat nearby, but it is easy to use this as a base and go from there. The hotel is undergoing renovations and bins full of building debris were being wheeled through the lobby when we checked in. The lobby is very dull with the exception of the little coffee room off to the right as you walk in. The coffee machine makes horrible coffee, but there is also tea and hot chocolate. A bowl of Hershey kisses and peppermint patties was a nice touch. The coffee room was very clean, as was the first floor rest room. The locker area was in need of some TLC but it provided ample room to securely store our luggage as we checked in very early and our room was not ready. The elevators need help, but I canâ€™t see anything being done about them until the hotel is done using them to haul construction materials in/out of the hotel. Our room on the 9th floor was spotless. The bright white fluffy duvets, white sheets, pillowcases and blankets were fantastic and you could tell at a glance they were clean â€“ you donâ€™t have to shove a dirty comforter into the closet at this hotel! Room had wonderfully high ceilings, a flat screen tv, desk, table with 2 chairs, 2 queen beds, a large closet with plenty of hangers and luggage racks. Our working windows opened to 31st street. Heat would not shut off so our windows were open for the entire stay but the room was more than comfortable. There is an exposed radiator pipe in the bathroom that is dangerous, if touched it could cause a serious burn; if we had had children with us we would have had to have done something about this. The hotel provided soap; hairdryers can be borrowed at the desk (we brought ours) bring your own shampoo and lotions. My photos are a little dark â€“ our room was bright, clean and cheerful. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The hotel has many security cameras which are monitored from the front desk area. At night you are buzzed/in out by the attendant on duty â€“ there was always somewhere there anytime we came in day or night. This was a good value in a city with outrageous hotel rates, and it was safe; we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent position - what a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: McFleurry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Herald Square and can honestly say its a fantastic hotel! We had one of their refurbished rooms and it was wonderfully done. Huge 15' ceilings, flat screen TV and a really comfy bed! The bathroom has also been lovingly done with a bath so big you could swim in it. I couldn't belive how much space there was for a midtown hotel. The room was thoroughly cleaned every day and the bathroom came supplied with Aveda tolietries (which I love!). The desk staff are a little brisk, but I don't think this was a problem, it seems to be quite usual in NYC. The position the hotel is in is great, easily walkable to Macy's, Empire State Building and there are plenty of subway stations really close by. I would recommend this hotel, not only to those travellers on a budget, but for any traveller who wants some comfort after long days sightseeing and shopping in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyLibrarian
Reviews.Content: Room 208 is quite large and one of the newly renovated rooms. Our room was very clean and quiet. Great location. The hotel validates parking around the corner at a rate $21 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Queenslander_8
Reviews.Content: We chose this accommodation after reading reviews in TripAdviser. The location was excellent for our purposes and proved to be very good value for money. The staff weren't particularly friendly but they provided help when requested. The room was very small but that was certainly not a problem - we were there to enjoy the city not the room. It was clean so that was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from late December 07 til early January 2008. Unlike all the other hotels nearby, Herald Square did not put up their prices for the days surrounding New years. Which is great, considering it is a 15 minute walk to times square. It is very close to empire state, madison square garden, macys and 5th Avenue. The staff are very helpful and the cleaning staff are amazing. Our room was cleaned daily and we got fresh sheets and towels, which is hard to come by in New York for under $300 a night. There is free tea/ coffee/ hot chocolate machine downstairs, as well as a laundry and computer room. There is always staff at the front door making it very safe. The rooms are smallish, and the bathroom is even smaller, but you dont spend much time in your room in a city like New York. I would thoroughly reccomend this hotel. The only advice I would give would be to ask for a newly renovated room, which is much larger and nicer than the old ones, and comes with a plasma television.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New York Find”
Reviews.Author: gazzajen
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this hotel directly through their own website after reading the great reviews on here, and it certainly lived up to our expectations. The hotel was perfectly situated for both sight seeing and shopping. Based in Midtown is definitely the place to be, only 3 blocks from Macys, 1 block from Empire State Building & just a 20-25min walk to Time Square. We booked one of the Queen Bedrooms & as we were travelling with another couple requested our rooms be close, which the hotel was able to arrange for us. The Queen rooms were perfect for a stay in New York as all you need to do is shower & sleep! The rooms were surprisingly spacious, recently decorated, very clean & modern, complete with a flat screen TV & the most comfortable mattress we've ever slept on (which after a hard days shopping is very much appreciated!) All this & it was the cheapest hotel we found in mid-town NYC. All in all we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone & we would definitely be booking there again.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest bargain in NY!”
Reviews.Author: WandererLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 day stay in the Herald Square Hotel and found it excellent all around. Paying $99 per night we weren't expecting a lot. However we have paid a lot more for a lot less in NY on a number of occasions! Yes the room was small but was fine (who spends a long time in their room in NYC anyway?!) Bed was extremely comfortable, room was spotlessly clean and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. The free tea and coffee in the lobby was a great extra too. Location is excellent - 2 blocks from Macy's in the middle of town. We will definitely stay again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising - Think Twice Before Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: LindaDFW
Reviews.Content: I found the listing for the Herald Square after searching under Boutiqe Hotels for NYC. The Herald Square website looked great. However, once we got there, we realized that website is in no way representative of the place. The lobby was the best part of the hotel and even then, I found that the fact the staff remained encased behind what I assume was bullet proof plexi glass disturbing. There were some problems checking us in under the last name Carlson. The staff kept mixing us up with Karlsen(stay with me... there is more to the name problem later). We were "upgraded" to a better room and then took the incredibly filthy and noisy elevator to our floor. We entered the room and it was small, which is to be expected in NYC. However, the carpet was dirty and worn out - I have no idea how old it was, but can tell you that neither my sister nor I dared to walk on it in bare feet. The furniture is basically formica cabinetry which IS NOT shown on the webpage. The lights in the room sparked when turning them off and on- very scary. The A/C unit in the room did not work, and despite several calls to the front desk to have it fixed and one vist from a maintenance person, it was never fixed. There are no hair dryers in the room and to get one, you had to leave a $20 deposit. We called the front desk for cups and were told they would bring some, but they never arrived. Not having cups is not a huge deal, but the disregard of our request is indicative of the type of service at the place. On our last night there, we requested a wake up call so we would be sure to catch our flight. The call never came and luckily we woke up on or own in the nick of time. We checked out and again experienced the confusion regarding the last name "Carlson" vs. "Karlsen". We were assured everything was correct and we happily left this horrible hotel and experience behind us. Weeks later, the Visa bill arrives and we find that were charged not only for our stay (Carlson), but also for the other "Karlsens". We contacted the hotel to have the error corrected and were treated very rudely by unconcerned staff. We were told it would be fixed, but of course, it wasn't. Many calls later with many rude employees, the issue was corrected. This hotel did not have ONE redeeming quality. There are other boutique hotels in the city that do a much better job. Don't waste your time/money at this place. It is truly awful.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Gem for a budget class hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoryMc
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in the Herald Square Hotel for 2 nites in december as part of a shopping trip to New York/Boston. We were a little apprehenisive based on some previous reviews, and yes the hotel doesn't look much from the outside, and the foyer is tiny, and the lift looks dodgy! But its the lovely room that makes all the difference..The newly renovated rooms are surprisingly spacious for NY, the bed was huge and very comfortable, there was a plasma TV, lovely bathroom, and all very clean..It had a lovely feel to it overall. The location (31st) was also perfect for Macys, within walking distance.. and also within walking distance to Penn station/Madison Square Gardens, which was handy for our train up to Boston. We also found the staff to be very helpful and efficient. My advice would be; don't be put off by first impressions, this is an excellent budget hotel, ideal for shopping, but make sure to go for the newly renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Womble1973
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Herald with my husband and 2 teenage children. This hotel provides fantastic value for money. It is ideally situated in Midtown , round the corner from the Empire State building and Macys. Checking in was very efficient and we were upgraded to a new refurbished room. The room was relatively spacious, with 2 large double beds, which were very comfortable indeed with quality bedlinen. There was a flat screen tv and dvd player, and the bathroom was very clean. Hair dryers can be borrowed from reception for a $20 deposit. Additionally, the hotel provided free beverages (tea, coffee, hot choc etc) in the lobby are which is handy in the morning. There is also a utility area with washers and dryers should you need them. We had a great trip and will use this hotel again next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in midtown”
Reviews.Author: jcipp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HSH from Dec. 12 - 14, 2007. Location is very good. Room was excellent and the bed was the best. Front desk staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful. Would not hesitate to stay here again. Will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A real find (but don't tell everyone!)”
Reviews.Author: EllanVannin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. As previous reviewers have said, fantastic, comfortable, beds, with sheets changed daily. Also, plenty of fresh, clean, towels every day in the bathroom. Location of the hotel is great, very near to Macy's. I think a hotel nearer Times Square would have been a bit too much for us. Would highly recommend Le Bon Gout deli just around the corner from the hotel for very good and reasonable food also. I can't recommend this place high enough (for the money). Go there, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay even better than the first!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wrathie
Reviews.Content: We've traveled with another couple to NY several times and stayed at Herald Square twice. We booked the remodeled rooms and would highly recommend! Their reception staff was good the first time but has improved since our last visit - more professional. Monica was extremely helpful, polite and accommodating! A gentleman working on the morning we left was also just as nice and helpful! He recommended a great Italian place around the corner, Bella Napoli - we loved it, great NY charm and very reasonable. Our rooms were very clean and the beds are AMAZINGLY comfortable! I've never slept in a more comfortable bed, other than my own. This hotel is going to great lengths to be a great hotel and they are succeeding. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends and co-workers. It's hard to beat the price or the location, unless you want to be right in Times Square. It's a short walk to wherever you want to go and walking is much faster than a cab. :)

Reviews.Title: “A Basic Hotel, Centrally Located.”
Reviews.Author: Blaithin
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed here from Friday, 2nd November for 3 nights. It was our first time to New York so I had booked it upon a recommendation by some colleagues. They had told me that this hotel was very basic but that the location was excellent because a lot of places were within walking distance and more importantly that it's not as expensive as other hotels. I did compare the prices to some other options I looked at on the web and it certainly seemed to be the case, unless of course you managed to get a "special" or one didnâ€™t mind some of the tacky places that were on offer. Therefore, on these grounds we decided to try out the Herald Square Hotel. I would now entirely agree with what we had been told in advance; the Hotel is rather old fashioned, nothing glamorous about it. Our room was very basic, very small but clean and it looked out onto a wall and fire escape (no room with a view here!! ). There was some sort of fan or air con system at our window blowing in cold air on the first night, although there was an adequte amount of bed clothes on the bed so we were still warm but standing or walking about in the room it felt cold. We told the receptionist the next day and I think the heating was turned on as it seemed better. During our 3 nights stay, there wasn't really any noise, apart from the air con in the room, so we were grateful for this. In conclusion, we would recommend this hotel if you are just looking to be centrally located in a basic (with TV), clean, very small room without any fancy trimmings at a reasonally priced rate. When I say "reasonably pricedt", well this is New York we're talking about, so the prices are above and beyond what we'd normally expect to pay. I think it's suitable for visiting tourists who will be on the move throughout most of the day and just want to use their room as a base; somewhere to sleep after a day's shopping and doing all the tourist sites. Just be prepared it's not the Hilton by no stretch of the imagination, that's for sure. :)

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daytimes
Reviews.Content: With all of the commotion in NYC at holiday time, it's wonderful to know there are still hotels to be found with this level of charm and comfort AND reaonable rates! I'd stay again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Scarred for life on dodgey beds!”
Reviews.Author: jakeena
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location but is expensive for what it is. I had the pleasure of meeting the grumpiest receptionist in the world and we both cut our legs on the pointless bits of metal sticking out of the bottom of the bed. Small room with no natural light which is wierd and somewhat disorientating. There's better for cheaper around.

Reviews.Title: “family from Croatia”
Reviews.Author: mrvica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Herald Square Hotel last September (8 nights). That was our second time in New York City. First time we stayed at Herald Square Hotel, too. What to say - excellent! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kiwigirl-7
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from visiting New York New York, and we found this hotel to be in a fantastic position as it is right near the Empire State Building, which is approx about half way mark of Manhatten Island, the hotel was very clean, the beds were very comfortable and great pillows, our room was big enough as was the bathroom, if your in New York, your not in the room much anyway as there is to much to do and see. We didn't explore the Hotel to much as we were hardly there anyway, and buy the time we got back to the Hotel, we were really in need of that fantastic comfy bed.
