I would recommended this hotel if you are doing the site seeing bit in the big apple, all the important aspects of the hotel were ther eeg: good bed and hot water for the much needed shower.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SwedenJiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Herald Square Hotel during our 10 day honeymoon in April. We found the hotel here at Trip Advisor and decided to try it based on the good reviews. DonÂ´t let the impressive entrance fool you. This is a quite simple and average hotel. Look at all the candid camera pictures before you decide to stay here. Got a small and dark room on the first floor with a tiny window towards the tiniest and darkest court yard ever. The room was normal sized, clean and had a newly renovated interior with a large flat screen TV. The bathroom felt new and clean. Our strongest impression about this hotel was how clean they kept the rooms, and not to forget, the location was excellent. Just a block from empire State Building. For honeymooners this might not be the most romantic getaway. But we had a great time in the City anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Herald”
Reviews.Author: clt1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while on our honeymoon in the USA we stayed from the 24th September 2007 to the 27th September 2007 3 nights total. We had a great time at the Herald. We had one of the new refurbished Queen bed rooms. The room was nice although it was really small but aparently all New York rooms are small, just so you know what i mean by small, it is smaller than my bedroom at home, it had the queen bed in the middle with two side tables and where the side tables ended thats where the walls were, there was a desk at the end of the bed and only enough room to walk in between, dont get me wrong it was a great hotel, i was just expecting it to be a little bigger by the photos i seen on this site. The bathroom was big, room was clean and had a great bed. If it had a fridge it would have been even better, they invested money into a magnifed makeup mirror I think a fridge would have been a better investment. The facilities were good, free coffee and laundry facilities. Great location. 1 block from the Empire State building and a few blocks to times sqaure. Overall we had a great time at the Herald Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I recomend”
Reviews.Author: cesareduardopinto
Reviews.Content: Excellent location.The hotel have everything that we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: themop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald for 6 nights in a single room ... and have to say I was pleased overall. Clean, quiet, Comfy bed, free HBO, free coffee in the basement, excellent central location, fairly priced; you can't go really wrong! However there clearly was a problem with my smoke alarm, which went off several times during my first time... and i was told to "just leave my window open", "you don't want to wake up with your room full of smoke", and yes that sounds kinda scary. Plus I had to get dressed to go to reception to fet someone to fix that up... This wasn't very professional. 4/5

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RoyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised here, expected a fairly basic hotel given the price (we paid $200 for "new" double). The location was brilliant, we had no view but this meant it was quiet. New bed, linens and flat screen tv. Free coffee everyday and biscotti on Sunday. Staff extremely helfpul, our toliet overflowed a bit and someone fixed it within minutes. Some rooms in the hotel are apparantly a bit tired but ours was great and again for NY a great price and location. Would definately recommend paying the extra for a new room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & location”
Reviews.Author: redbird71
Reviews.Content: I was pretty bummed out after researching rates on hotels in NYC (Manhattan) for 2 double beds for 4 adults. I was anticipating we would have to spend around $300 per night for a decent place when we were going to be out on the town most of the time. Then, my father-in-law brought this hotel to my attention. Upon reading their website, finding a rate of approximately $220/night, and the location we decided this was what we were looking for. We booked about 3 months in advance to make sure we got a room here. Our room was on the ninth floor and it was toward the back of the building. There was a window in the bathroom and along the same wall in the room and both looked out at another brick building. Even though the view was nothing, it was quiet at night! Considering what I had read about the size of rooms in Manhattan, I thought we had quite a bit of room to move around. The bathroom was small but nothing less than what I expected. I think we were in one of the newly renovated rooms as it was nice and had a flat-screen television. My only complaint would have been the 1 elevator that serviced the ninth floor was slow. We had one time where we waited about 10 minutes for the elevator after pressing the button before it made its way to the top. The location on 31st street between Broadway and 5th Av. was very nice. It is 2-3 blocks South of the Empire State Building and 2-3 blocks East of Madison Square Garden and Penn Station. We were within 2-3 blocks of several subway stations. There is a major subway station at Herald Square (31st and Broadway) where several trains stop to get you to where you are going. Several things are nearby including the Manhattan Mall and Macyâ€™s. At night, the store fronts on 31st Street all have the metal fencing over the windows which kind of make the area dark and unattractive, but during the day it looks much better. Donâ€™t let this scare you if you get there past dark. Overall, it reminded me of hotels in Europe that Iâ€™ve stayed at (local ones, not chains). It provided us with a nice, clean, comfortable room. There really are no extra amenities, like a continental breakfast, shampoo or hairdryers, but we werenâ€™t looking for that or were willing to forego that for the more favorable rate. I would say that it met my expectations. I would recommend staying here if you are comfortable without many of the amenities of a chain hotel but looking for a nice place to stay with as good of a location as any at a decent rate in Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: shouldntdrive
Reviews.Content: First, I was a little unsure about this place because it was in a great location but was only $99 a night. That's unheard of for NYC. Also, the website was kinda sketchy and well, interesting. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Empire State building, and so close to everything like shops and subway stops. The room itself was kind of small but the bathrooms were rather large and the bed was SO comfy! My room had a little tv in it but my sisters had a very nice flat screen. The desk staff was very nice and gave us lockers to store our stuff early. Parking was only $21 for overnight (also unheard of), just make sure you get your ticket stamped by the hotel. Otherwise it would be $50- $60. Will definitely stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Ads1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed 21 - 25th Aug 07. We had a renovated room on the 9th floor which was great 2 x big and really comfy beds, nice bathroom with powerful shower , flatscreen TV, could not fault the room for the price we paid. There was some work going on at the hotel, with much of the exterior of the building covered in scaffold and work being done to the entrance area, howeever this did not interupt our stay at all. Great location, walking distance to Times Square, Empire State, Manhattan Mall, Penn Station etc.. plus bars, deli's close by also. I'd Definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is WOW!”
Reviews.Author: MCFRANK
Reviews.Content: Man, what a place. I had read some of the other reviews and can only say that the nay-sayers got it wrong. The hotel is in this fabulous location, the room I was in was newly re-furbished with a flat panel TV in the room, a free internet connection, and a bed that it to diw for. I slept better there then I do at home. No kidding, the bed is like floating on a cloud. And the bathroom is magnificently appointed and beautifully maintained. I wish I had furnishing like that at home. The staff was warm, friendly and very responsive to all of my needs and requests, they helped me with direction to different places of interest, theater tickets and advice on the best places to eat in the area. An area that is centered in one of the best places to shop in the city. the hotel is billed as a bargen hotel, and price wise it is, but the condition of the rooms, the staff, the free internet, coffee and breakfast bar, and staff make it more like the resort hotels of days gone by. Will I be staying there again? and will I recommend it to my friends and co-workers? You bet I will. In my opinion The Herald Square Hotel is one of the best kept secrets in New York, and I'm spreading the news to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: mattyd007
Reviews.Content: The great location is only part of the reason I would recommend this budget-price, but semi-luxury hotel. We have just returned from 5 nights there and we booked the refurbished rooms specifically (to avoid the room 'lottery' that other reviewers spoke about). We were both astonished to see the luxurious modern style of the room when we opened the door. Everything was brand new and the furnishings and fittings throughout were more reminiscent of a 4-star hotel (not quite sure how they get 1 star?). The shower pressure was quite low and took a while to heat up - but we were on the 9th (top) flr. The cable TV (HBO), quiet air conditioning and the wonderfully comfortable bed made for a welcome oasis after being on your feet for 12-hours in 90 degree heat! To finish things off in style - they even provided us a stretch limo for the same price as a cab, when we had to leave to go back to Newark Airport at 4am! Can't speak more highly of this place - loved it!

Reviews.Title: “price of a hotel, service of a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: jessie41
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for a short period of time and I was really disappionted by their service. They charged you by hotel's standard but the service is rather appalling, I would say, worse than some friendly and nice youth hostels. When I checked in, the reception was rude and impatient. If you arrive early, you have to put your luggage in the locker room. But be warned. No one would come to help you. You have to sort out everything on your own. The single room is tiny (the photo shown on their website looks deceptively larger). I understand the location is their plus but with such bad service, I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Little”
Reviews.Author: SaffronFlorida
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel. Room quite small, barely larger than the queen size bed. Long counter in room with upright chairs, but no comfy chairs to read or watch tv. Wi-Fi seemed to work well. No window in room -- apparently all rooms except the few in the front have no windows. Wall a/c unit, roars loudly enough to keep you awake even on lowest setting; when a/c off, room gets stuffy quickly. Hotel in midst of very slow renovations, so there is pervasive, sharp odor of paint and carpet adhesive everywhere.Best features: maid service and bathroom -- but bring your own shampoo. Lobby features include indifferent clerks behind bullet-proof glass walls and nice self-service coffee bar. Hotel appears to target European tour groups. Very convenient to Herald Square subway station, but it is a long slog on foot to Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but a bit of a lotto on rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travellerBelper
Reviews.Content: We entered this hotel with some reservations having read poor reviews. Although the reception is behind glass I didn't find this a problem. They were currently painting/decorating so there was scaffolding outside and wet paint inside. We were initially put in room 604. On entering the room it was disappointing. VERY small, old and tired looking bed sheets, no wardrobe, a light that didn't work, incredibly dark and the toilet and sink drained very slowly. We had no point of reference so spent the first night in this room. It was clean. In the morning we asked if there was a bigger room and the lady in reception seemed to know of how bad 604 was. We had to check back into the hotel at 2pm (a little inconvienent) and she said she had a much better room. We then got room 614. It was bigger, had a wardrobe, had excellent bedding and had a much better bathroom. However, the phone did not work (which when someone is banging the door next to yours for a long time at 5am, it is a little worrying that you can't contact reception!) Do not expect a view from any window here!! Also be aware there was no hair dryer in the rooms. Friends of ours checked in 24hours after us, they had room 10. They had booked on-line at the same time as us and were paying the same rates. However they were upgraded due to lack of rooms to room 10. This was a very nice room. Recently decorated, big bathroom, flat screen TV, hair dryer and much more spacious. This room is only approx $30 a night more and well worth the extra money! Location was good and I am sure that for the price in NYC it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean7
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad, but could be better. From our perspective, we would have preferred to be closer to Times Square or the 42nd Street area. The street that the hotel is on (31st Street) is a bit dark and run-down and several buildings were undergoing renovations, including the hotel itself, making it a somewhat depressing street. The lobby was being painted while we were there by an extremely slow painter, who seemed to be painting just one wall every other day, and so the lobby had an unfinished appearance throughout our one-week stay. The lobby itself is small and cramped and the persons at the front desk are insulated from the hotel guests by what appears to be reinforced glass, which was a bit off-putting and impersonal (this is the first time we had ever seen a hotel lobby of this type in all our travels, and it was more suited to a bureau de change in a dangerous area). Some of the staff were a bit rude and unhelpful, while others were helpful. There is a laundry area on the ground floor with fairly new washing machines, but you have to purchase tokens to operate the machines. The sign in the laundry says that detergent is included in the price of the tokens, but when we enquired about this, the person on duty said that the machines dispensed detergent automatically, and so we did not need to bother with this. Unfortunately, this was just not true, and so our clothes went through the wash cycle without detergent, which was a bit infuriating. The toilet clogged up on the first night, but an attendant came within 5 minutes and fixed it immediately. The hot water came and went and it was difficult to maintain a constant temperature. To our amazement, around the 3rd day of our stay, the housekeeper/maid left a message on our room telephone complaining that we were not keeping the bathroom clean, which we found objectionable, not only because it was an exaggeration (all that happened is that we left a few towels on the floor and personal effects on the vanity counter), but also because we did not appreciate paying for a hotel room with a daily cleaning service and then being told to clean up the bathroom in order to help out the maid. This is the first time we have ever experienced this type of complaint in any hotel anywhere in the world in the last 20 years and we found the message to be unpleasant and impolite. The room was relatively small (we were in one of the deluxe double-bed rooms), but it was clean, and the beds were comfortable. The room was bit dark because the window was small, and the room lighting was inadequate. The air-conditioner worked reasonably well. The bathroom was small and it was difficult to use the sink because of the cramped layout. The elevators were old and slow, and only one went to the top floor. There was no breakfast service. We would not stay at this hotel again because its bad points outweighed its good points. We stayed at the Metro on 35th Street in 2005, and we had a much better experience for more or less the same price. In fact, the price of a double room at the Metro in 2005 was lower than the price of a double room at the Herald Square Hotel in 2007, and the Metro is a better hotel and you get a daily continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “my trip in nyc”
Reviews.Author: elevenseptember
Reviews.Content: very good hotel in the full center of manhattan and midtown. central. just a regret = personnal is not sympatical.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DianneMB
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights and 4 days at the hotel and it was clean and comfortable..the location was great as it was on 7th Avenue which is near to Penn Station & Madison Square Garden...it was also close to the Empire State Building on 5th Avenue.. Times Sq is on 7th Ave too and is abt 10 blocks away and i enjoyed taking the walks as the weather was lovely when i was there so that i could take in the sights and scenery... The price was reasonable and not too expensive so that the rest of the budget could go into my shopping sprees, food and souvenirs... -Dianne from Bermuda-

Reviews.Title: “Best Value!”
Reviews.Author: SydneySnark
Reviews.Content: I booked a small single room and they upgraded me to the Queensize room for no extra charge. The staff were so friendly and nice! I had to leave my bag and luggage in a locker room because check in wasn't until the afternoon, but the guys at the front took the time to go through maps and tell me what sites I should go visit while I wait. I was travelling alone and I felt very safe at this hotel, its walking distance to so many great places. It might not be ideal for everyone, but as a traveller on a budget I can't think of anywhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with our Stay”
Reviews.Author: JulieFA
Reviews.Content: I was really unsure where to stay in NYC, I didnt want to spend a ton of money but didnt want to stay in a dump either. A friend told me about the Herald Square Hotel and I must say it lived up to my expectations. Our room was relatively spacious with 2 very comfortable double beds. The bathroom could have used a little renovation but not too bad. The room had a flat screen TV with a DVD player and plenty of closet room. My only complaint about the room is that there wasn't an over head light near the closet so it was hard to see inside your suitcase at night time. The lobby had free 24 hour coffee and hot chocolate and at various times cookies or candy. Also, the parking garage nearby gave what I considered a great rate - $21/day! I will definately stay here again when returning to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elle51
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the Herald Square hotel in NY. Choose it because of the location in the centre of the city close to a.o. Empire State Building, very good price, and experiences from other travellers on this website. It is a simple, small hotel, but everything you need is there. Room and the rest of the hotel are lovely decorated by pictures from Life magazine. Had a very comfortable bed and very clean room. The view from the room was a wall, but you're only there to sleep. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cslotboom
Reviews.Content: The HSH was great! Is was one of the cheapest hotels I could find in NYC and I was so glad when I got to my room. I didn't have much sunlight but that wasn't so bad. I had a bathtub, free cabel-tv and a great bed and great pillows, what more could you wish for? The facilities in the hotel were great also, an ATM, laundry-room, internet-computer, free coffee (great coffee too!) 2 phonebooths and a soda-machine. No breakfast or dining but the Dunkin' Donuts is just around the corner. I'm not used to staying in hotels but for this money, I would stay in this hotel again if I even go to NYC again...and I will.

Reviews.Title: “Good NY hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ezza_83
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and was quite pleased with what we got. Hotels in NY are generally horrendously expensive for not very much, so we were quite happy with the price and location. It was only a couple of blocks from the Empire State and a short walk from Macy's. We generally didn't spend very much time in the room (we were in New York, after all) but it had A/C and cable TV (although the channels tended to drop in, drop out a little bit...) The room was very clean, although a little small - but after travelling in Europe a pleasant surprise. Also, they gave us a 10% student discount, which I thought was great - you have to book through their website though. Overall, I would recommend it to others :)

Reviews.Title: “single room”
Reviews.Author: wlbox
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room with bath at the cost of $99 a night. This is a great price for NYC. When I booked this room I was told it was a very small room, so I was prepared. The room itself was in the back of the hotel on the 5th floor. It was about 8 X 10 feet in size plus a private bathroom with a tub. The room was very basic, it did have a window that opened on to a air shaft. It allowed light to enter, the view was to a solid wall of a building. My bed was very comfortable and had only one pillow. The room was very clean. I did have one instance of a bug, when I called downstairs they offered to change my room and spray. The staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful. I did enjoy the tea and candies in the entrance area. The hotel had two elevators. A great location, very close to Penn Station. I do recommend this hotel. Be prepared for a very tiny room if you choose a single. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: linheiner54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Herald Square Hotel for 3 nights in May and I can't recommend it highly enough. Having booked it as a budget hotel for a price much lower than I'd found anywhere else I was a bit worried about what we'd find when we got there. However the room, which had been recently refurbished I think, was a decent size,spotless and newly carpeted. The bed and bedding were really comfortable and clean. The private bathroom also spotless with bath and shower and clean white fluffy towels provided every day (bath was slightly short but not really a problem!). We had a room-safe, wardrobe with sliding mirrored doors and a little dressing table with large mirror and chair. Also bedside cabinets and cabinet with TV and storage underneath (old TV but we hadn't gone to NY to watch telly!). Nice little lounge downstairs in the foyer and area with tables and chairs in case you wanted to pop out to nearby bagel place and bring back breakfast, and a free hot drinks dispenser with coffees, hot chocolate, teas etc , tea bags of every variety and even a bag of Hersheys Chocolate Kisses or Mints to help yourself from! We found staff to be friendly and helpful, one arranged for the shuttle service to collect and take us to the airport when we left. The hotel is 5 minutes from the Empire State Building (go when it opens at 8am and you will be first in there and no queues) and within easy walking distance of lots of places you want to see, subway also. Maceys is round the corner and leave the hotel, turn right and walk down the street and you will find a friendly Irish pub (O'Reillys) serving nice food at reasonable prices. I would definately stay there again. Actual location of hotel is down a slightly dark and dingey looking side-street but we felt safe enough in the area walking back at night.

Reviews.Title: “great memories”
Reviews.Author: crazyindian
Reviews.Content: This hotel, for my husband and I, was what we wanted! A place to go in, dropp our gear go out and paint the town red and then finally sleep. Its hotel was great for people who are likley to be staying out in the city mainly. The bed was fantastic. It was clean and so comfortable I miss it. Its not a lap of luxury but you do find it a nice surprise as it has what you need from a standard hotel in it. The staff were all honest and helpful I would return back to it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTraveler1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Herald Square Hotel (May 18 - 20) and it was a wonderful experience!! We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms and were very pleased with our experience. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30pm and were able to check in even though check-in was not until 3:00pm. Our room was spotless! It was smaller than we expected, but very, very clean. I have stayed at many hotels, including the Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons, and this hotel room could compete with those in terms of cleanliness. When it was time for us to leave, the hotel called us a car service, which arrived on time to the minute! The hotel location was also great!! It is near a shopping mall and many restuarants and subway stations. For New York City at this price, I think this is the best you are going to find. My husband and I will not hesitate to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Medium opinion”
Reviews.Author: nanou1hs
Reviews.Content: Good location. Average (but clean) room. The staff is not very friendly. It is strange to find the reception behind a glass wall (as in an adminstration). Breakfast is not included and there is no breakfast on site. (The only service provided is a free coffee/tea/chocolate machine). We decided to buy our breakfast in a very good bagel's shop on 5th avenue, to bring it back to the hotel and eat it in the lounge using the free coeffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for first time to New York!”
Reviews.Author: Kjigstarr
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel last August. It was my first time to New York and I am poorer than dirt, but also like my privacy so didn't want to stay in a hostel. I had a very small room with an ensuite bathroom, TV, free wi-fi, and safe. It was everything a young single girl traveler would want. Located in Mid-town Manhattan so I was able to walk everywhere and there was also several subway stations nearby. I felt completely safe in my room and the surrounding area. They have free coffee in the morning, soda vending machines, lockers, and you can even book tours right there with them. The staff at the front were very courteous, but also very efficient and didn't make me stand around waiting for very long. Also when I arrived there was a nice, little old man walking around the lobby telling the story about when the building used to be the newspaper headquarters and handing out keychains as a gift to the new guests. This is a budget hotel, but I feel like you really get a good deal here and I would certainly stay here again! Just don't go here expecting room service and all those extra amenities and you'll be completely satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler526
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald Square Hotel from May 8-May 10 and I was very impressed by my hotel room, and by the service at this hotel. Though the Herald Square is a one star budget hotel, and the decor of the hotel itself isn't that great, the new queen rooms are very nice and extremely clean. There was a small blood stain on the bathroom wall when I arrived, but I reported this to the front desk and it was taken care of immediately. I also tried to take a shower one afternoon and noticed there was no hot water, so I called down to the front desk and hot water came through immediately afterwards. This is the best valued hotel in NYC, and as long as they don't raise their prices, I will continue to stay here (in their new queen rooms only) everytime I'm in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and superbly located”
Reviews.Author: Critix
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by this hotel. I would echo the observation that if you come to NYC for the hotel experience, you should go elsewhere, but if you're looking for a convenient base offering value for money then you probably won't find much better than this. I was upgraded on arrival to a 'refurbished' room, whatever that means. The room was small and on the ground floor at the back of the hotel, but it was tastefully furnished. Amenities included a large flat-screen TV, a safe and a clock radio. The bathroom had a bath/shower. The room was clean when I arrived and kept clean during my stay. The Herald Square is only three blocks from the Empire State Building and well positioned for other attractions. For an energetic walker it's well within striking distance of Central Park in the north, Ground Zero and Battery Park in the south, Broadway to the northwest and the UN to the east. Nothing spoiled my experience of the Herald Square. A broken lamp was soon fixed. The air conditioning from a next-door building outside my window was loud but I used earplugs and was not bothered. All in all, I would go back in a flash, and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Herald Square”
Reviews.Author: Dixeychick
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic week in New York and a great stay at the Herald Square Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room (which was just a standard) was very clean and looked like it had recently been decorated. We had plenty of room to store our cases and shopping bags and the bed was very comfy. On the downside the air con was quite noisy as was the street outside - but we didn't go to New York for a peaceful holiday! Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing amazing, comfy bed, good value!!!”
Reviews.Author: lottie101
Reviews.Content: I found the Herald Square to be realy good value. Its nothing amazing but the bed was really comfy, our room was very clean and the staff were very nice. Its in quite a good location, close to some of the best attractions so good if you are short one time! Good for the price especially for new york!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: JLCKnoxville
Reviews.Content: We stayed here around Christmas time. The location is excellent,with easy access to the subway. The rooms are OK for a budget hotel,but our hall was being worked on during our stay {noise and paint fumes}.No breakfast,but there are many great places around. Centrally located,and historically significant {the old Life Magazine building}. MUCH cheaper than most Manhattan hotels. Friendly staff. All in all,not bad {especially for the price}.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased overall”
Reviews.Author: CdnVisitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Herald Square, starting Mar 17 (St Patrick's Day, right after a blizzard). We chose it because of the price, location and reviews, and we were not disappointed. The room seemed smallish at first, but was very comfortable and clean, and the bed was great. It looked attractive and had lots of good lighting. The steam heat made some noise, but didn't spoil our sleep. The first one awake can use a small cozy lounge beside the lobby to avoid disturbing their roommate. Bathroom was clean & functional too, with fresh towels every day. Lots of places to eat nearby, either down Broadway or towards Lexington, including a trattoria at 31 & Lex that was reasonable and very good. Subway stops are very convenient in both directions, as are busses. We felt very safe in the neighbourhood, didn't see anything to alarm us any worse than at home. The street was quiet at night, but only half a block from Broadway. Only complaint about the hotel - there were construction noises from the renovations starting at 7AM. Overall, we were very pleased and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Right place, right price and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Onvasurlemonde
Reviews.Content: Here's the question: Have you come to New York to stay in an hotel or to see and experience the city? If you plan to hang out in the room, you'll probably feel a little disspointed in this hotel. But frankly, if you're the kind of person who stays in the hotel room, you aren't coming to New York for the right reasons, are you? This hotel ticks all the important boxes (clean, safe and central)and -what's more- is highly affordable. That's rare. Which makes this hotel rather wonderful. The only "complaint" (it's not even that..just a gripe) is that staff behind the counter seemed a tad stressed out by life. Ok, I guess that's a fact of life when you're checking in 30 to 40 people every day. If you can handle yourself socially and you stay polite, the staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First class accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Buster7456
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York stayed in the Hearld Square. Good central location just around corner from Macys/Empire State Building. Within easy walking distance from Time Square. 34th Street Subway a block away Accomodation first class got upgraded to Queens Room. The room was large and very well finished. The bed was particulary comfortable it was hard to leave in the morning. Flat screen TV with film channels,hairdryer and large safe. The rooms were cleaned daily to a very high standard. Excellent coffee facilities with biscuits in lobby. This is all you need as area is well served by cafes/resturants and delis. Staff were all very helpful and when i go back to New York i will not be staying any where else given the reasonable price. Look forward to returning to the Hearld.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: paulella
Reviews.Content: this hotel came highly recommended by my tenants. i was looking for a place that was central to everything. and affordable. this place was right on the money the rooms have a cozy feel. the renovated rooms are lovely. but because they are more expensive than the rooms that have not been renovated there only worth shelling out the money if youre going to be spending more time in your room than outside. or if youre looking for a marriot hotel feel on a budget. the staff is super friendly and helpful. the hotel gives you an overall feeling of home. nothing here is too comercial.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed and what a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: NalaBala
Reviews.Content: Small but perfectly formed and what a bargain! With hotels in New York generally expensive we were a little apprehensive about our $99 a night double room in the Herald Square Hotel but were pleasantly surprised, the room was clean, bed comfortable, private bathroom always hot water (although sometimes a litte too hot!) and cable TV. The room was fairly small but perfectly adequate for our 4 night stay and the free coffee machine in the lobby was great for warming up after the sightseeing. The hotel's located in midtown and convenient for the subway and sights, and although we preferred some of the areas downtown for nightlife it was only a cheap cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly, clean. Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: CSharp1492
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here in Sept. '06, both of us from UK. We'd both separately been to NYC before, staying at expensive hotels - shame we hadn't seen this place. Rooms clean and tidy - fresh towels, bathroom cleaned and room tidied daily. Fresh soap even after just one use! Room a little compact, but for $99 per night in the middle of Herald Square district who cares? Shower and water always hot. TV with all major news channels. Air conditioning. Staff friendly and helpful and were happy to order taxis and answer questions. Handy locker room to stash your suitcases in on your last day. Great location - 10 min walk from Times Square. 5 min walk from Penn Station. Subway close by. Oh, and some big department store nearby. ;) Will definitely come back to this hotel next time I go NYC.... C. Sharp.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: BRZILIAN
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay at the Herald Square again! Great location, great value. I had a shared-bathroom but it was not a problem since it was never occupied when I needed it and always spotless clean! Room was extremely small but the bed was comfortable. I chose this hotel for its location and I stayed there for 5 days during a work assignment trip. You can't beat it for NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Berfloodz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend in Feb 07 and it was perfect for what we required. The price is very good for Manhattan. It is midtown and is only 2 mins from the Empire State building and 5 mins from Macys. There are loads of subway stops within 5 mins walk. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was basic, clean and the shower was good so no complaints. The staff were friendly and there was absolutely no wait for checking in or out. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value For Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: pileup
Reviews.Content: The Herald Square Hotel is a great find. I just moved away from Manhattan late last year and thought I wouldn't be able to afford any decent hotels for return visits. I'm so happy! Now whenever I get homesick I can jump on the train and be here in a few hours. Now, the hotel isn't luxurious, but it is nice. It provides an excellent value for the price. It's very clean and the staff couldn't be more helpful. Apparently, I was put in the old unrenovated part (no flatscreen tv for me ! Next time I'll know to request a new room), but the towels were soft and fluffly and the bed was to die for. The only bad thing I can say is that it's location is in tourist hell, midtown Manhattan. Most New Yorkers avoid midtown liker the plague so it's very good that the subway stop about one block away from the hotel provides a quick and easy fast escape from that blighted, expensive part of town. This hotel will become my new "home sweet home" in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of false reservations and charges”
Reviews.Author: lostlocke
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for 2 nights to stay at this hotel, however I had to cancel the reservation, which I did 2 weeks in advance. The day that I was supposed to stay there I was charged for 2 rooms ( I only had one) plus when I called up, the man read me reservation numbers that I never heard of before. I am very precise when it comes to writing down this kind of information. I had the confirmation and cancellation numbers and the ones read to me were soooo far from what I had. I made the reservations right from the hotel website and cancelled them the same way. Why do people work in customer service and in hotels when they have no idea what they are doing? This was a very stressful situation especially for someone who lives on a budget like me. So beware unless you have money to throw away. I have to call my bank and the hotel again to get it all straightened out. I will NEVER EVER try this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “appreciation of the herald square”
Reviews.Author: donangel
Reviews.Content: each visit to the herald square increases my appreciation for it. i travel alot and whenever i go to ny, i get to stay in another newly remodel room at the herald square. these new rooms compare with most 4 and 5 star hotels in manhatten for 1/3 of the price. i love thehotel's central location and appreciate the free wifi. the staff is very nice and the beds are first class. the flat sreen tvs are a welcome bonus and the decor and history of the hotel, make my stay there a wonderful treat. i highly recommend the herald square, if you want great quality at very affordable prices. don from newort beach ca

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: StickyToffee
Reviews.Content: Influenced by the glowing reviews we booked on-line at the hotel web site, at a very good rate, for Christmas night. The hotel is located on a little-used side street that after 5 had a dark and lonely feel. 32nd St, the next street over, is bustling with lots of Korean restaurants, a nice Ramada hotel, a car park with polite uniformed attendants, etc. The car park has an arrangement with the Herald Square for parking, our tab for one night for an SUV was $21. Can't beat that in New York. Without our asking, our room was upgraded to one of the renovated rooms, which was very hospitable of Reception. The room was indeed very nice, beautifully done, high ceilings. The bathroom was one of the largest I've ever seen in a NYC hotel and very clean and bright. Warning: there are no toiletries or even a shower cap so bring your own. Brilliant LCD tv mounted on the wall with easy viewing from the bed, a small sitting area with two chairs and a marble-topped table in one corner. Heating was fine--a steam radiator with decorative cover, cooling was fine--a window unit, not too loud. No coffee/tea-making supplies in the room. Also had some hot water issues, but the hotel guests were probably all taking showers at once. The hallways are utilitarian to the point of being reminiscent of the old Soviet-style drabness, but they did look freshly painted. The refreshment room off the Lobby is very nice with a comfortable sitting area, decorated for Christmas, and a picture window facing the street. Coffee good, hot chocolate offered as well as good biscotti--all complimentary. Is this the lap of luxury? No. Would we stay here again? Most definitely, it's clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dfenz
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews for this hotel on Tripadvisor my wife and I took the plunge and booked it for a week in December 2006. We were not disappointed and earlier reviews have proved to be reasonably accurate. As my wife and I were basically on a shopping trip we did not plan to spend much time in the room - the priority for us was security and cleaniness at an affordble price. In this regard the room had a safe and access to the building was via a security door manned by 24 hr reception. The linen was changed every day and the water was normally perfectly hot (it ran cold one evening out of 6). The location on 31st street is very convenient to Macys and the Empire State Building. All of this in Manhattan for just over $100! On the downside the room (esp the bathroom) was tiny but apparently this is the norm in NYC. We were advised that we had been upgraded to a room with an extra bed - if this was an upgrade we suspect the other rooms must be quite small. The room decor was pretty grim and dark although there was nothing to suggest that it was unclean. The hallways were in the process of some badly needed redecoration although the new colours won't inspire anyone. The coffee area and restroom off the foyer were spotless and very comfortable. All in all ecellent value for money and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “look out for the mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: amitabhthegreatest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and wished we had booked else where, Our room number 804 was next to the air conditioning unit, which was extremely noisy throughout. I was also bitten several time by mosquitos and when I complained about the bites. I was told I would have to pay extra to be moved to a differen room. I even had to buy spray to keep the pests away.The receptionists were unhelpful and more concerned with filling the rooms than dealing with the issues. Best avoiding this one if you want a good time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lobright
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay here by some American friends of mine, so we checked on the hotel website and found it looked good. We arrived at Penn NY Stn and it was only two blocks down 31st street to it, so was definately walking distance. The lobby isn't the greatest-looking and the lift/stairs and corridors aren't the smartest, but there were plenty of signs apologising for their appearance - they were in the process of re-decorating. The staff were friendly enough. The room (120) on the first floor was very good - a New Queen Room. The window over-looked the fire-escapes of the ajoining buildings so not great. We had the plasma screen as decribed and it was beautifully decorated. It was small but not claustrophobic. The safe worked, which was good. The bathroom was spacious with a good shower, however the towel rail was prone to failing apart and dropping towels and face cloths into the toilet below... In conclusion, we'd recommend the hotel to others. It's in a very good location, just a few blocks from the Empire State Bld and is 100yrds from 5th Ave. Just be aware that it's being redecorated.

Reviews.Title: “When they say small, they mean SMALL!”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: I had all but given up hope of being able to afford a fall weekend in New York when I checked out this hotel's website (---) and learned that they had "small single" rooms at under $100. Experience has taught me that most Manhattan hotel rooms are small, so I figured that these must really be tiny. But the price was there, and the hotel was reasonably well rated, so I booked it. And tiny it is: a bed (big enough for me, and I'm 6'2"), a shelf unit that holds up the TV and doubles as a rude desk, the little safe on which the phone and phone book sit, a bathroom with a sink, a stall and a seat, and that's it. This is not only for one person, but for one night as well, since there's no place to hang anything up, not even a hook on the wall, and scarcely any room for baggage beyond an overnight bag. As for the hotel itself: There's a comfortable sitting area in the lobby. (The coffee machine wasn't working while I was there.) There's a laundry room and an internet kiosk that actually works. The place overall seemed a bit on the shabby side - which, however, not to be confused with seedy. Location is convenient to the Empire State Building, Macy's and the Morgan Library. But this is New York, and public transit will get you almost anywhere. And at this price, I could have paid for a taxi had I needed one. Will I do this again? Maybe - but I'm likely to pay more for a real room.

Reviews.Title: “5th year and still love it !!!”
Reviews.Author: DubsOnTour
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 8 day stay in this fab hotel in the Heart of New York City. For location, this hotel couldn't be better, around the corner from Macys , Empire State Building and 5th Avenue. For value, you will not find a better hotel for the price. For service, well, the staff couldn't be nicer or more helpful if they tried, Monica on the front desk , a diamond. The rooms are very comfortable and always kept clean, the updated ones are the best and the beds are soooooo comfortable it's hard to get out of them and as others have said, the double and queen rooms are by far the best for size. The tea and coffee in reception is great, especially for those on shopping trips and have no time to waste over breakfast, grap a cuppa and run. We have gone there for the last 5 yrs, we found it by mistake and it was the best mistake we ever made. It's a great hotel for your stay in NYC and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: oryonus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the on-line reviews and pictures. Plasma TV? Where the hell was that? Mine was average and everything on it was red. The pictures on the web site showed a beautiful room, spacious, touting amenities. Mine was small, no closet, step up to the bathroom (causing many stumblings), no clock., Asked about that. Told that "some" rooms have clocks, and some have dressers/drawers." Extra $40 + tax /night more for that. I declined. Couldn't open the window, constant noise from some AC outside anyway. Hair dryer had to be checked out at desk with deposit. Thankfully I brought my own. Don't worry about having to tip a doorman. There isn't one. Hotel staff is behind glass. Bullet proof I'm guessing. They did have nice towels and good pillows. Coffee, tea, etc. in the lobby. That's pretty much it. If you can afford a few bucks more, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beware room 108!”
Reviews.Author: 5startraveller-Iwish
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms in March for our stay in November this year. After reading the reviews in this site I rang them in September and made sure we had 2 of the upgraded rooms. When we checked in we were given 108 and 118, one at least 40% bigger than the other. 108 is a pleasant room but in no way should be charged the same rate at 118. I spoke to various people culminating in the manager, and there was nothing they were prepared to do. We were told 'it is an old building blah blah', maybe in New York it is, but we come from York in England and some of ours date back to the 1200s, so weren't impressed by that excuse. I was mostly annoyed that we had booked so far in advance that you would think they would put us in comparable rooms. Overall we had a good stay - very clean and comfortable beds. After all you don't go to New York to stay in the room. Just be aware that room 108 is tiny, with a single wardrobe, so if it is offered to you just check it out first.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Placed”
Reviews.Author: antoob
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night trip to New York staying in the Herald Square hotel. We booked this hotel after reading all of the good reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel was exactly as described. Location is excellent, which is all important in NY. We had booked a large room with two double beds and this is what we got. The beds were extremely comfortable and blissful to sink into after a full day of shopping and sightseeing. The room was thoroughly cleaned each day with fresh towels also supplied daily. I definitely recommend this hotel and will be returning. Having stayed in an 'upmarket' hotel last year, the Herald Square beat it hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but great location”
Reviews.Author: ericrabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Herald Square Hotel in November 2006 and generally found the experience to be a positive one. The hotel is most definitely not the Ritz - but the value of the accommodation cannot be questioned. We struggled to find any hotel room in New York for the night we wanted to stay and were happy to pay $169 + tax for this hotel when we discovered it was available. The hotel looks far more luxurious from the outside and the grandeur of the building is evident, but walk inside and the illusion is lost and you cannot fail to be disappointed to see bullet proof glass surrounding reception and the slightly dated and unattractive decor in the foyer area. We were not lucky enough to to be given a refurbished room, so our's was fairly small and basic. However, it was clean and had a very comfortable bed. The air conditioning was incredibly noisy and the walls so thin that you could quite easily hear people in the adjoining room. It was nice, however, to be given complimentary coffee in the foyer and we even managed to connect our laptop to the wireless network which was free of charge. The location of the hotel in our opinion is the hotel's greatest asset. It was literally a stone's throw away from the Empire State Building and Macy's. Overall the Herald Square is a great option if you are looking for a well priced, clean hotel with no frills in a fabulous location. If you manage to get a refurbished room, then you will have hit the jackpot!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: GIJAYNE
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel was fantastic, rooms are basic but very clean. Bed was good and bathroom is a good size. TV with loads of channels and also aircon unit (even if its a bit noisy.) Area hotel is located is quiet. Great tea and coffee facilities in reception and staff very helpful. Location of hotel is fantastic 2 min walk from empire state building, metro and Penn station and 15 min walk from Tiime square. Nice Irish Pub 100 yds away and plenty of places to get breakfast. make sure you book through hotel website to benefit from best price and best rooms. I will use this hotel the next time I visit New York and would also recomend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Life in the big city”
Reviews.Author: AJDADIVA
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here two nights but of the four hotels I tried while in New York this was my favorite. The fact that this was once the office building for Life magazine still is apparent in the hallways but the seasonal displays of Life covers was a nice touch. They are in the midst of renovations so be warned that the hallways still look a bit rough but the rooms and the common areas are comfortable. The staff is above and beyond what I expected of this budget hotel. I stayed in a single room [comfy twin bed] that had not been renovated and although the room was small it was clean and certainly a deal at $89 a night! My bathroom was very clean and the tub meant I got to soak after walking my self around the city. The location is great for exploring midtown and the onsite laundry and internet terminals a real plus. Iâ€™d return and not just because of the price, the staff made me feel very welcome and the gift of a key chain [of one of the cherubs on the facade] was just the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location, safe area, near Korean restaurants, Macy's, Herald Square, subway, etc. I had a small single room, with the bathroom down the hall. The room was so small, you couldn't even open the door all the way to get in... and it was still over $100 per night. It was clean and quiet, no real waiting to use the bathroom down the hall, which was also clean. Absolutely no room to open your suitcase on the floor or anywhere else, except on the bed. Staff was reasonably friendly and polite and helpful in arranging airport transportation. Free coffee/tea in the lobby was nice. Some renovations going on in the hotel, try to get a renovated room on a renovated floor. New York hotels are expensive, but I just thought the room was too small for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Herald Square Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LoriGeorge
Reviews.Content: I have traveled around the world and I must say this was not only a very reasonable rate but was also one of the nicest rooms I have seen in a long time! The beds were incredibly comfortable with the whitest, softest sheets and blankets including a comforter which all felt like the beds of some of the finest European hotels. The bath room had a deep luxurious marble bath with double sinks and great lighting, hair dryer and plenty of room to get ready for night out. We watched movies and listened to music on the large flat screen television and sat together at the lovely private cafe style table in the room to share a bottle of wine at night and our coffee in the morning beneath a large arched window. The long dressing table with a lighted magnified mirror made getting ready simple. Every person from the front desk to the maid that cleaned the room- were polite, helpful and always smiling. We splurged on the best room as it was our anniversary and with these rates actually had plenty left over to go out and eat at some of the finest restaurants in the city! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Herald Square Hotel - one of the best deals in town”
Reviews.Author: Cindysinger
Reviews.Content: Last month (8-15 October), my cousin and I stayed at the Herald Square Hotel, and we were extremely happy with our overall experience there. We shared a large double/double room (two double beds) facing W31st Street, which was more than adequate for our needs. Everything was immaculately clean, including the bathroom, which was admittedly small, but this was compensated by the fact that there was a full tub as well as a shower, and the water was hot, with wonderful pressure. The towels were beautifully large and fluffy, and replaced every day. The beds were amazingly comfortable, and the TV had more than enough channels to keep us happy on the nights we didn't go out. One thing that particularly impressed me was the staff at reception. They were unfailingly friendly and helpful, something I have not always encountered at previous visits to other hotels in NY. Two futher pluses were the limitless tea/coffee/hot chocolate available 24/7 in the lobby, and the laundry available for use by guests, with state-of-the-art washers and dryers. The location was also great, with many great eateries in the vicinity, and of course Macy's a short two blocks away (we made good use of the sales that were on!). We paid $189 per night for the first five nights, and $199 for the last two, booked through the hotel's website. Right up till the time I left on my trip, I kept checking various other hotels to see if I could get a better deal, but everything else was far more expensive - apart from the Radio City Apartments, which always seems to be booked out months and months in advance! I can heartily recommend this hotel for excellent value for a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “A Labor Day Weekend Treat”
Reviews.Author: MendelC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel over Labor Day Weekend. It rained all day Saturday, but the hotel was dry and cheerful. It raised our spirits just to be there. What a treat! I am an Historian and a teacher and I was doubly thrilled to spend time in this historic building with all of the magnificent art work, covers from Life Magazine, displayed all over the hotel. The room we stayed in was just magnificent. An extra comfortable queen size bed, down comforters and pillows, a flat panel TV, and a bathroom that was so beautiful that my wife wants to re-decorate ours at home on a similar theme. And the bed, the bed was like sleeping on a cloud; soft, clean, and inviting. I have a bad back and often have trouble sleeping in beds other then my bed at home, not so at the Herald Square Hotel, I fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillows. It was one of the most restful sleeps I have ever had away from home. I also have to say something about the staff; they were attentive, helpful, courteous, and in every way helped to make our stay terrific. We will definitely be staying at the Helald Square hotel on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay.”
Reviews.Author: sbull9
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and a great position in the city. The HSH was perfect for our short stay in NY. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: navman
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt the room we had was on the small size... but we had a large suitcase and large rucksack full and managed OK. This is a great hotel in a fantastic location just a couple of blocks away from the Empire State Building. There is really good free coffee downstairs in the lounge and it looked like they were re decorating it while we were there (not that caused us any problems at all) I will have no reservations (excuse the pun) in using this again

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: dashy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Herald Square hotel from October 16-20. We lucked out and got an amazing room on the 9th floor or so we thought. The first morning that we were there my girlfriend woke up with bites on her hand and arm. We thought maybe there might be bugs but we couldn't see any in the bed and the room was so nice we thought, how could it be? Our second night there she woke up in the middle of the night to something biting her again. In the morning we called front desk and told them what was happening. They wanted to come up to the room and see the bites and she said she would get changed and come down but before she had time, 2 minutes later, someone from housekeeping was at our door ready to inspect the bed. We were really annoyed that this guy came up and was going through the bed while we were still in our pajamas! When he couldn't find anything he said it must be an allergy to the down pillows. My girlfriend is a doctor and she informed him that allergy does not present like that, he wouldn't believe her. So they changed our room to a much smaller one on another floor and that room seemed fine. Aside from irritating us by not believing that there could be bugs, the hotel staff is friendly and our only other complaint is the water pressure and the lack of hot water. The only reason we are writing this is because we know Herald Square is a budget hotel and with that comes a certain level of expectation but we paid for one of the "new queen rooms" and although they looked nice they aren't worth it. This was our second time staying there and the first time was a better experience....before the renovations. It looks nice and it should be good but it was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Excellent Location - Overall great value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Maniemoo
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the Herald Square for eight nights recently and I can confirm that most of the reviews on here are pretty accurate. - The hotel is in a fantastic location (very short walk to Macy's, ESB and Madison Sq. Gardens). - It's clean and the beds are super comfortable - The rooms do need to be renovated but they are currently in the process of doing this (if possible, pay the extra for one of the newly renovated rooms which are really nice). - The staff are very nice and helpful, they upgraded four of us to better rooms than we had booked (e.g. my fiancÃ© and I had booked a standard room and they upgraded us to a queen. Our friends had booked a queen and they were upgraded to a new room). Having been there now I would recommend if you're a couple that you go for at least the queen room option. That way you might get upgraded to a new room if you're lucky, and if not, the queen rooms are fine (although they need updating they are a decent size and have really comfie beds with duvets instead of horrible scratchy blankets!!) Basically - don't expect luxury and you won't be disappointed! Oh one final word of warning - the single rooms are absolutely TINY!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice, ask for the refurnished rooms”
Reviews.Author: clafromitaly
Reviews.Content: I just came back after 5 nights at the Herald Square Hotel with friends and I agree with the other reviews: it's clean, the location is simply perfect, the area is safe and full of restaurants (I prefer the ones around Madison Avenue, but it's plenty of choice everywhere at walking distance), and the price is more than ok. I've also found the staff quite friendly and helpful: our impression was that they try really hard to give their guest what they need, and the free coffee is a nice thing to get when you're back after a busy day. In general, the hotel is pretty basic and the rooms are on the small side. BUT... surprise surpise. They are renewing all the hotel, bit by bit, and as we had the "old" rooms, just before we were leaving, a guy at the desk (maybe the manager?) insisted to show us one of the refurnished rooms . And the new rooms are *gorgeous*! Still small but very well furnished, with a sparkling bathroom and a plasma tv: definitively 3 stars level for a 1 star price! So, try to get one of the new rooms, and your stay will change from all right to heavenly! They told us the best way is to book online and then call them and ask for it. (as I'll definitively do next time!) Claudia

Reviews.Title: “First time guest and was very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: lbecenti
Reviews.Content: It was my boyfriend and I first trip to NYC. Knowing that the hotels were expensive and there are alot of bad places in NY, I decided to do some research. Based on my research, I found Herald Square to be the best deal and reviews. In addition to the great reviews, the other hotel guest left some great tips in which we used during our stay. (i.e. where to eat-Speedys, and hotel only takes money for the lockers and for the super shuttle. There is also a real good restaurant northeast of Speedys. I forget the name of the restaurant, but we went there for drinks one night and had breakfast there the next morning.) So, if you have time to read through all of the reviews, do so, to get more tips. It was VERY helpful. Although the hotel received good reviews, I was still a little hesistant. But I was VERY HAPPPY with our stay at Herald Square. It was safe, clean and the staff was very friendly. I would stay here again. Room: we received an upgrade to our room. It was expecting something small, but it was nice to have something just a bit bigger. Bathrooms: small, but clean Safe: good and safe. Shopping: there is so much shopping in the area, maybe about 2 blocks north of the hotel. i.e. Macys, H&M, Footlocker, Ninewest, etc etc etc. Food: Speedys, the place I mentioned above and there is also a good restaurant right next to the Empire State Building. Subways: there are so many near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Herald Square is the Place to Stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Dandelion1906
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Herald Square in November 2005 and in November 2004. The room I stayed in each time although small, was adequate for me as a single traveller, I was offered an upgrade but declined it as I was happy with the room. There was a shower and toilet in my room and fresh towels were provided every day along with soap and shampoo if I needed them. The bedding was very clean and the room itself was cleaned daily. The location is great and the price for me as a budget traveller was great. I have stayed in more expensive hotels in Manhattan, but as far as I am concerned all I want is somewhere nice and clean to sleep. I will be staying again this November and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from rude guy at front of desk”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Herald Square for seven nights till last week. The room, while small, was clean and the bed was comfy with nice bed linen. The room was serviced each day which was good. It's not a luxurious hotel by any means but suited us fine as we were out sightseeing most of the time. The only bad part of our trip was on the day we had checked out. We left our bags in the lockers after checking out and went to buy tickets for the Airport Shuttle. We were staying with friends that night but were coming back to the area the next day so it was convenenient for us to leave from the hotel or nearby. We were just about to purchase the tickets when the clerk advised that it was cash only and we did not have enough. No matter, he said we could get them later when we came to collect our luggage. We returned at 4pm to collect our bags and once again went to the front desk to purchase tickets for the shuttle bus for the next day. There was a different guy on the front desk this time. He seemed very harassed and was extremely rude. He informed my husband that he was too busy to sell us tickets right now and we'd have to come back in an hour. We explained that we were leaving and he basically shrugged. When we asked again he simply ignored us. It was the only flaw in an otherwise smooth stay but his rudeness left us with a bad impression of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a Little More”
Reviews.Author: novice_explorer
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to NYC and I only had 24 hours there. We arrived by train and walked to the hotel. It wasn't too bad of a walk, depending on how much luggage you had. The best thing about this hotel was the comfortable linens on the beds. The room was very plain with simple furnishings. It seemed a bit small, but I have no others to compare it to in the city. Most of the guests in the building seemed to be tourists from other countries trying to visit the city "on the cheap", too. The hallways are narrow and are not carpeted to help cut down on some of the noise, which we found a bit distracting. You could hear people in nearby rooms and it echoed in the halls. The only real problems we encountered while there were a running toilet (which I regret fixing myself after seeing the inside of the toilet tank) and one of the two elevators appeared to be out of order twice in a 24 hour period. It's not a very large place so there isn't much in the way of amenities. It was nice to find local delivery menus in the room and there was an area off the lobby to do your own laundry. The best thing about the hotel was it's proximity to the Empire State Building. You just round the corner and walk about 1 1/2 blocks. They also had a later checkout time, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with minor niggles”
Reviews.Author: Ads1969
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Herald Square Hotel. Checkin was quick and efficient, but I found I was in one of the older non-renovated rooms which was small but clean with a single bed, clean bathroom with shower and bath. There were a few small problems and that was the hot water was not the most reliable, having to run the water at least a minute to get any, and then when it was running, it would start to run cold (sometimes). The only other thing I thought was an issue was that the lifts (elevators) were very very slow! Most annoying if you were in a hurry! Still, after my stay here, I would stay here again. By this time next year, all rooms should have been upgraded. Management does need to look at the hot water issue though.

Reviews.Title: “what a treasure”
Reviews.Author: rubesco
Reviews.Content: Herald Square Hotel NYC I just loved this hotel. It was clean,quiet,had wonderfully comfortable beds and the staff was always cheerful and really helpful,and to top it all off the rates were very reasonable.You just couldn't find anything else like it in such a great location. Thanks HSH for such a great stay and see you next year. J.Rosewilde

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the city”
Reviews.Author: hm102
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the best value in NYC. . . Great Building Great Location Great Rooms Nice Staff 200 bucks a night got me a twin double room on the top floor (9th) with view over downtown, 34 inch wall mounted plasma TV with DVD, big white bouncy, comfy beds, nice bathroom, loads of fluffy towels, prompt, friendly and efficient maid service - what more could you want? A little hidden roof terrace with a direct view of the Empire State? Oh - there was one of those as well! I have stayed in hotel rooms costing 3 or 4 times as much that are not as good - the Herald Square should be your first stop if you want a good value hotel in NYC. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “A great week in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Bedford Rob
Reviews.Content: We spend a great week in NYC 11-18 Sep. The Herald Square Hotel is centrally located in Mid-Town Manhattan near 31st and Broadway and the price was reasonable for NYC (about $150 per night). We were 2 mins walk to the subway and the hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly. The room was small but comfortable with a nicely appointed bathroom, AC, TV with HBO and Wi-Fi and a safe to keep you valuables locked up when you're see the sights. While no breakfast was avail in the hotel, there were tons of reasonably priced restaurants (mainly Korean) within 5 -10 mins walk. They did have a coffee machine that kicked butt. 100% Columbian, decaf, hot chocolate or, my favorite, cafe mocha. There was also a nice sitting room and a dining area if you found a take-out meal. As for the tourist thing, we bought a 7 day Metro Card at LaGuardia Airport and a New York Pass at the Planet Hollywood at Times Square. There are tons of attractions and we did some we might not have done normally but they were free (well the tour was part of the cost of the pass). A couple of things we did that stood out were: MOMA 4th & 5th floor (Pollack, Monet, Van Gogh, etc...), The Met, Daily Show with Jon Stewart, The Colbert Report and a Yankees-Red Sox game. Overall this was a great hotel and we plan to stay there again when we vist NYC next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for those looking for accommodation only hotel”
Reviews.Author: mccrudden
Reviews.Content: I would consider this hotel excellent for somebody who is visiting NYC to see the city as opposed to lounging around a hotel. It serves its purpose as a safe, clean, comfortable and well located hotel to sleep and shower in. The newly renovated rooms are very nicely decorated. My room on the ground floor had plasma tv, phone and extremely comfortable bed & bedding. The room had black out blinds which was very relaxing. The room was also extremely quiet. The bathroom was new and very clean. The room size was very small and I think two adults would find it tight. I was staying with a group and from what I heard the room quality varied drastically with some of the older rooms not yet renovated. From my previous trip, I remember the rooms on upper floors being more spacioius but a lot more basic. The staff were very helpful. There is no restaurant or breakfast bar (coffe is available in reception) however, Starbucks and some great take out breakfast places are nearby. The location was excellent. You could easily walk to Times Square and the subway is around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Broadwaygirl85
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on trip advisor, I booked this hotel for my mother and I for a trip to NYC over Labor Day weekend. We both were EXTREMELY pleased. The room was very nice; it wasnt as small as I thought it would be. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and the hotel staff was as welcoming as any. The location was perfect, within walking distance of everything worth seeing on a trip to NYC. There were complementary warm beverages and lockers for use to store luggage. Be mindful however that the staff is adamant about their renting policies (i.e. lockers, irons etc), when they say you must have cash, they mean it. Renting an iron requires a $20 cash refundable deposit, and I believe the same thing goes for hair driers and other appliances. They could be a little nicer about explaing their policy without sounding like wardens, but I guess law is law. But dont let that discourage you, overall this was a great place to be. I highly recommend it and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: JennyRomine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Herald square after reading reviews on this site and I must say it was exactly like they said, very clean and the bed was very comfy. that's about all the place has, but for $99 a night in midtown manhattan that's all you need. The Air conditioner could have been a little cooler being that it was 92 degrees those days, but i would have to say that was my only complaint. It was very safe also with a "buzz in " system at the front door. Would definately reccommend because you need all your extra cash for the $5 beers!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: fruchick
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect from the Herald Square Hotel, and to be honest I was expecting the worst. I booked the cheapest room possible, with the shared bathroom, sight unseen (every photo on their website showed off their "newly renovated" rooms, not what I would be getting). My room ended up being the cheap hotel room of my dreams: everything I needed, and nothing more. Bed. Table. Tv. Safe. Clotheshangers. Air Conditioning. Enough floor space for my suitcase. And CLEAN. I'm at that point of being too old for a hostel, but too poor for a "real" hotel. Everywhere I go, I wonder why I can't just find a clean, safe, cheap room. Well, score one for me! The hallways and shared bathroom aren't air conditioned, which was a challenge in the heat wave while I was there. I didn't want to spend any time in that bathroom, and ended up buying a mirror so I could do my hair and makeup in my room. While the shared bathroom was the only one on the floor, I never even ran into anyone else coming in or out of it. It's relatively clean (needs remodelling), and the shower stall is big enough that you never have to experience that horrible moment of accidently brushing up against the wall. Location-wise, I couldn't imagine a better place to be. I was able to walk to most of the places I needed to go throughout my stay. The Empire State Building really is right around the corner. I easily grabbed a bus to get uptown or down to the village. And as a single woman walking alone at night, I felt completely safe around the hotel. Financially, I had already hit my breaking point by paying the $80 per night. I'm not a rich girl. But I would recommend splurging the extra few bucks to upgrade if you plan on spending any time in your room. I was able to peek into a few other rooms, and they were beautiful. The pub across the street has amazing food for reasonable prices. Breakfast is easy to grab closeby too, and there's a drugstore around the corner. The staff was always friendly and keen to chat in the elevator. The maid service is great, and very on top of things (I'd switch my sign over to "please make up room", leave and come back within an hour, and it would be done). The laundry area is very clean, and I was impressed with the free detergent provided. Little touches like that -- and the 24 hour free coffee in the lobby -- make a huge difference to me. The clientele was surprisingly classy. Lots of young couples, families with teenagers, and a number of guests from overseas. No questionable characters. Yes, there were quirks. I jumped a foot the first time I heard my neighbour's door close, but thankfully we kept similar (yet inconsistant) schedules. I slept soundly through the night with earplugs. The layout of the floor is confusing, and frustrating when you first get off the elevator with an armload of baggage. The workers sometimes kept the elevator door open for a length of time, so you either had to wait or climb stairs. All of this was minor, though, and no more annoying than things I've experienced at major chain hotels. I look forward to staying at the Herald Square again on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in N.Y.C”
Reviews.Author: koalay
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Herald Square hotel for 2nights and highly enjoyed our experience. This is a a budget hotel that is possibly as clean/ comfortable as many of the over priced 4*-5* hotels in the big apple. The location is great with loads of restaurants/pubs and shoppping areas to choose from. Don't forget to check out the Empire State Building just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A comfy stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: TomBuffalo
Reviews.Content: It was easy to fall for the Herald Squareâ€™s charm during our recent visit. My wife and I splurged on one of the $179 rooms for three nights in late June and we werenâ€™t disappointed. Our extra-clean room was very recently updated including a cushy queen bed with comforter, a bright bathroom, and flat screen TV. Our ground floor room was in a small, private niche adjacent to the lobby and guest laundry area. We were concerned about noise, but our stay was amazingly quiet (I donâ€™t think we had neighbors).
