Except for a few of the usual hotel â€˜bumps-in-the-nightâ€™ and a sometimes noisy air conditioner, we slept peacefully. At check in, the desk staff (who were always friendly â€“ ie, they booked our ride back to JFK) were honest, saying â€˜youâ€™ll have one of our newest rooms, but it really doesnâ€™t have a viewâ€™. They werenâ€™t kidding â€“ our window faced another building. But we didnâ€™t care â€“ no street noise = great sleep. If we wanted a view, we strolled out the front door to 5th Ave. The hotel building itself is tucked away (if thatâ€™s possible in Manhattan) between 5th Ave and Broadway on 31st. We walked to the hotel after midnight on a couple nights and felt safe (the Hotel Wolcott is across the narrow street). 31st has a fraction of the 5th Ave crowd after dark, but the stroll to the hotel front door is so short youâ€™re practically there once you turn the corner. Several subway stops nearby â€“ since we like to walk, we enjoyed the central location - great for a quick shower and change of clothes between events in the City. We liked Speedyâ€™s just up the street on Broadway for quick breakfasts. If Iâ€™m forced to list some very picky negatives â€“ no tissues in room; could have used a snack vending machine; and heavy rain pounded the outside of the AC unit one night giving us a private â€˜Lord of the Danceâ€™ 2:00 am performance (a small plastic hood above the unit would solve this â€“ hint, hint Herald Square). But overall, our experience was excellent. Iâ€™m not sure about the other rooms (some of the reviewers had different experiences), but we enjoyed the unique, non McHotel feel. Weâ€™ll stay here again, and may even request the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. In the summer, they turn off the AC while you are gone from the room, and it can take a long time for the room to cool off again, but otherwise the rooms are very good for the price. Bear in mind that ALL New York hotel rooms are smaller than in other cities. Our room was very, very clean, and large enough. The staff was very friendly, but they did make one small mistake with my reservation. So I would triple check the status of your reservation. I tried to double-check the status of my reservation and was told that all was well... that I didn't need to check on it again. But they wrote down the wrong start date of my reservation anyway. No problems resulted from this error on their part, but I WOULD triple-check your reservation dates. 31st Street is a fairly grungy side street, but it is safe and right in the heart of the city. It is close to subway stations that will take you anyplace in town, and there are some very cheap places to eat breakfast, lunch or dinner nearby. I loved Speedy's on Herald Square, just a block away, but the American Burger shop and O'Reilly's Irish Pub around Herald Square were also good for cheap, tasty meals. If you are going to New York for the gay pride parade, this is an ideal place to stay. You can just walk 1/2 block down to Fifth Avenue to watch the parade, and then when you get tired or hot, you can just pop back into the hotel to rest & cool off a while. The parade crowds are smaller around 31st Street, too, so you can see the parade better. There are nice little sitting and eating areas off the entry lobby of the hotel, which is nice to have, and they actually have a laundry room in the hotel which you can use! This is great! There are some places you can stay which are cheaper, but you might have to share a bathroom with the entire floor, or have a far less comfortable room, so if you can afford the Herald Square Hotel, it is your best buy in New York for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great as long as your neighbors aren't loud”
Reviews.Author: bad_driver
Reviews.Content: I booked a room online for this hotel after reading many online reviews of it. The hotel web site said that only singles were available with shared baths, but because I had a 6am flight out of JFK, I thought I would be fine for that brief time. When I checked in, they gave me a room with a private bath for the same price, which was nice. The room safe is great, especially for a budget hotel. Since I was travelling with a laptop, the safe was important for me since I didn't want to lug it around with me. The room was very clean, including the bathroom. It was very small, but I imagine most people aren't hanging out in their hotels in NYC much until they want to sleep. Ah, sleep...what I didn't get when I stayed at Herald Square. I didn't plan on getting much because of my early flight, but I didn't get any at all, thanks to a guest in a nearby room who was apparently using his room for some ...this review has to be family friendly, so let's call it audible alternative adult entertainment. Very unpleasant for me. I knew I wouldn't get much sleep, but I did want to get some shuteye and wasn't able to. Without the noise from the neighbors, this hotel would've been great. However, I'm hesitant to wholeheartedly recommend it because I'm not sure if the hotel, being so affordable, is more susceptible to being used for such rendezvous. If you must stay in this price range, it's probably great since it was so clean. But I don't wish my experience on anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great !!! Very good condtions!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel1
Reviews.Content: Very good location , the room are very correct for this category.. Don't hesiate to stay here, it's enough confortable for a trip in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience...”
Reviews.Author: prosek
Reviews.Content: Let's start from the good sides: it was fairly clean... Even though I must say in my room there was always a BAD BAD SMELL of... I don't know what!... all the time... The other outstanding positive side is the location. I mean, the area is not one of the best in Manhattan but at least it's close to the Empire, to the 5th Avenue and to the subway. The rest of the review is completely NEGATIVE! The staff wasn't friendly at all but instead definitely unpleasant. The room was one of the worst I stayed in and had such a small window (not on the street but overlooking a kind of ... "well" inside the building) we could never understand if it was good or bad weather! With the only exception of the entrance (very deceiving!!!) and the hall, the hotel as a whole looked more like a jail or a hospital than a decent place to stay... Sincerely... I wouldn't advise it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience at the Herald Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a three day trip to New York, and we stayed at the Herald Square Hotel for three nights. For anyone who's tried to customize a trip to New York City, you'd know how nerve wrecking it is to find a decent, relatively inexpensive hotel to stay in. We searched one hotel after another, only to read reviews about rats, cockroaches, and muddy water. I had almost given up when i came upon someone's recommendation for the Herald Square Hotel on tripadvisor. We were dubious at first, considering the room we booked only costed $99 for a double bed. We were pleasantly surprised. The bathroom was immaculate with all the necessary fixtures for a comfortable stay. The toilet looked especially hygenic with the blue antibacterial solution. And the bed. They definitely weren't lying when they said their bed was four star hotel quality. It was so comfortable, i fell asleep within minutes every night. Granted, the room was a little bit small at first sight, but what's the need of big rooms when you're out and about New York city all day long? The hotel was also conveniently located minutes to the 34th Street station and the Empire State Building, which allowed us to get around Manhattan in the shortest time possible. All in all, i can't wait to stay there again when i visit New York City.

Reviews.Title: “a breathe of fressh air. no smoking and refreshing at the herald square hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my stay at the herald square was very refreshing . the room were excellent. from the quality of decor, to the fresh air, and comfortable amenities. it was better then most higher price hotels. i am a very healthy vegitarian and appreciate how serious they are about no smoking and thier triple filtered water. as a healthly person, it is hard to find a place that considers fresh air and clean water. The quality of the beds and mattress are super comfortable. i saved enough money their to see 2 extra broadway shows.everything about the herald square is of high quality except the price of a room. it is truly a new york gift..i highly recommend it for your stay in ny.. don

Reviews.Title: “Best buy!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tente66
Reviews.Content: The Herald Square Hotel Trip advisor member, London UK. We have just returned from a week at the Herald Square Hotel. The hotel is excellent compared to the rates, the bed was absolutely comfortable after all the bustling about in New York. The sheets were changed every day as were the towels, the bathroom small but clean as well. The ice and coffee machine down in the lobby were also very wonderful gestures from the hotel. Its also located in clean street compared to some of the neighbouring budget hotels. The Dunkin Doughnut cafe at the top of the road is a great spot for breakfast less than $5 for a ham and cheese begal with coffee.Miss that, thinking of it now!!!!! Would stay here again when ever I go back to New York. Highly Recommend this Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Herald Square Hotel All this and Free coffee”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Herald Square Hotel twice before over the last four years. Every time is different experience . . . newer, better, more value and now Free Coffee. The room we had was wonderful, great comfortable bed, 4 fluffy pillows and a comforter, an amazing bathroom, Flat screen TV, a CD player AM/FM clock radio and free wi-fi, for the price, I don't know how they do it. The new guest laundry really came in handy; we packed less so we had more room to bring home NEW stuff. They have a bigger Lobby this time and it is bright and very comfy with those big chairs, plus their pride and joy is there, the Bronze statue of "Winged Life", the Hotelâ€™s mascot. The staff seems to be happy working there, with all the Cherubs around, and we always feel as if they're really glad to see us. They were helpful with "what to see and do". We met and spoke with Mr. Puchall and he really loves the Herald Square Hotel with its history of "Life Magazine" and all and we now have our very own "Winged Life" key chain. This latest experience was the best, and it always seems to get better every time ...can't wait to come back and see what they do next time!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations of budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: CulturalTravelGuide
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Herald Square Hotel last week. This is our review: Duration of stay:7 nights. Acommodation:Double bed, private bathroom. Price:US$99 + tax per night, per room. When youâ€™re travelling on a budget, there are really three concerns: One, cleanliness: Bed: Great fluffy bed (Just like 5 star hotels), always smelled like fresh laundry. Carpet: Really clean, was vacuumed every day. Bathroom: Cleaned every day, nice blue stuff in the toilet made it look hygenic. Furniture: Found a bit of dust in the upper part of closet, no biggie. Two, safety: Hotel: Yes, people are buzzed in, so that provides a sense of security. Room: Has indoor locking thingie. Thereâ€™s an in-room safe, electronic and big. This was a huge plus, since we were worried about the purchases we were going to make, and my laptop, not to mention our limited money. Three, location: Exellent, two blocks away from the Empire State Building, four blocks from Madison Square Garden, one block from Macyâ€™s, walkable distance to Times Square, two subway stations nearby, you can get anywhere from here. Great stores on 34th street. So, in conclusion, this hotel complied with everything we needed for our stay. Now, weâ€™d like to mention a few other things to consider: View: None. There was a tiny window that overlooked a dark alley. Closet: Enough space to fit clothes and stuff for two people. Furniture: Ugly, but what difference does it make, right? TV: Just 14 channels, but who stays and watches TV in NYC? Appearance: Overall, ugly. Itâ€™s kind of an industrial building, and they would benefit from a decorator. Staff: Not friendly and just limited themselves to do their job. Heating: They turned it on in the evening, and when the pipes started to get warm, they produced a horrible clanking noise which kept us up a couple of nights. Take advantage of: The tons of brochures in the lobby, they have some good disccounts and promotions! New York Pass, buy it online, it saves time and money and you get entrance everywhere. Metro Card, $24 for unlimited rides for seven days. Itâ€™s worth it. Speedyâ€™s, great diner, good prices, great food. As you walk out of the hotel, turn right, and then turn right again. In the following corner, cross the street, there it is. As another review says: â€œIf youâ€™re thinking about it, do itâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Greeat Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELAINECP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ina great location and fab for the price. the rooms are smallish but have everything you need, big bed, shower, tv and air cond. lovely staff and you even get a free herald square keyring when you check out. great touch. THE ROOMS WERE CLEAN AND YOU ARE ONLY 5-10 MINS TO EMPIRE STATE BUILDIN. WOULD DEF STAY AGAIN ESPECAILLY FOR THE PRICE

Reviews.Title: “What a location, staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Babyjan
Reviews.Content: I can say nothing but positive things about this hotel. Was over in New York for my brothers wedding in September 2005, and enjoyed my time up in Westchester. I needed somewhere close to everywhere in Manhattan after the wedding for my family and I ( including 3 children). Saw this hotel on the Lonely Planet guide for New York as a good budget hotel. Checked it out again on Trip Advisor, and decided I had seen enough to go ahead and book. The only negative I had about the whole experience was the fact that I couldn't book for 5 on the internet website. I sent a quick mail to them, and they said, don't worry about it, book for 4 and send us a note. Therefore negative becomes positive as staff were helpful and my worries were dealt with. We then arrived at the hotel on the Sunday evening, Sept 25th. The staff welcomed us. The glass panels at reception look daunting, but at least they are safety conscious. The rooms are fairly basic, but had everything we needed. TV for the kids in the evening time when we were exhausted after lots of shopping and sightseeing, bathroom, beds were fine and AC. The pictures on the website do not give this hotel's location enough credit. You are about 1 minutes walk from the Empire State Building. Macy's, Madisson Square Garden etc are right beside you. Brilliant. I just want to finish up by complementing the staff, even though it will not be enough of a complement. On our last day, I think check out time is 12 noon. My shopaholic other half decided she wanted one last look and spend in Macys before we headed home. All went well except she had to go back to another department to get a tag to scan an item she was buying. Whislt heading to the department, she started looking at more items, got lost, and I couldn't find her and my daughter and son. My daughter and I walked around and couldn't find them. I couldn't believe there was no PA system, so I didn't find them until 1pm. I went back to the hotel, apologised for the late check out. They could not have been kinder as they realised I had got a shock. "Take your time" was the answer I was give. Wonderful, at a brilliant price for Manhattan. Stay there if you are on a budget, want to be treated with respect, and are looking for prime location. A+

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mannyd
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel not expecting much given the price for this central location. We were pleasantly suprised with our Queen room. We originally only booked 3 nights (just in case it was awful), but immediately extended it to 6 after our first night. Yes the room is very small and the hotel doesn't offer much service (ie Porters & Concierge). However, at around $100 per night it represents good value for those seeking a central base to explore Manhattan as you are very close to the subway and the Empire State Building. Our room had a very comfortable bed and it was kept very clean. A word of warning though. I made the mistake of using the room phone to ring a friend on a cell phone in New York. This 4 minute call cost me $38. So take my advice make sure you use a calling card!!

Reviews.Title: “our NYC home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Laramer
Reviews.Content: We found the Herald Square Hotel on tripadvisor(-) while looking for budget hotels in NYC. We were really nervous about any hotel that only charges $99 per night, but we figured if it was awful we could always check out and go to one of the more expensive familiar hotels we always stay at. We were thrilled to find that Herald Square Hotel is the real deal -- our rooms were immaculately clean, smelled fresh (it's a no smoking hotel!), and the beds were as comfortable as the heavenly beds so widely touted by the Westin chain. We had beautiful clean white sheets and overstuffed down comforters in our rooms and had the best nights' sleep I've ever gotten in NYC. The location is great, we felt safe and comfortable, and it was just like having our own little haven in the middle of the city. It's not luxurious or decadent, but I've paid three times that much for a room not much better. I can't recommend it highly enough, what a great find! Thank you tripadvisor.com and thank you Herald Square Hotel. We'll never stay anywhere else in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “If you are thinking about it, do it!!”
Reviews.Author: americanblue
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a budget vacation over Thanksgiving. I was nervous as heck, not sure what we were getting into. My advice: Read all the reviews on here carefully and they will tell you pretty much everything you need to know about it. If you are considering a budget hotel, then this is an excellent choice for you. As mentioned in many reviews, the location is perfect for first time visitors who want to see it all in a few days. Main subway line is very close. (ps: I found a site online where you can enter your starting point and destination, and it will tell you exactly what subway line to take, and where to get off. It saved us tons of time. I highly recommend you do it before you go if it is your first time. We would have been a mess without it. I just printed them out and carried them with us.) Anyway, we were there to see the parade, etc over Thanksgiving, so with Macy's being so close it was perfect. There is adequate food close by, but no exceptional restaurants. But that's what cabs are for! There is a d. donuts right down the street, and a great 24 hr. bodega with groceries and hot breakfast/lunch/dinner right across 5th. ave. The staff is courteous, not overly friendly but never rude. I checked on our reservations twice before arriving and we checked-in in a very short time with no problems. We had a room with private bathroom. The rooms are very small but well cleaned every night. The bed is adequately comfortable. Bathroom is tiny but clean. I also used one of the common bathroom/showers down the hall a couple of times, and they were clean. They are bigger and have more shower space than the in-room bathrooms. I never saw anyone else use them over the 5 days we were there. Do not stay here if you want a classic NYC skyline view out the window, as there really isn't any. But again, it's a budget hotel, and great if you are just needing a place to shower/sleep. Internet access in the lobby is handy (cost a few $$) There is a very authentic Irish pub on 31st right across Broadway--great food, cold beer, and very friendly wait staff. We walked to Times Square a couple of times (with a 5 yr old child.) The neighborhood just south on Broadway is a little rough, but there's no reason to walk that way anyway. Overall, I highly recommend and would stay again if on a budget. Thanks NYC for a great trip. I was pleasantly surprised at the friendliness of the city. The MTA staff were especially helpful and friendly and we appreciate it. (sorry so long!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DaLumZ
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were in New York for our first time back in September. We stayed 7 nights at the Herald Square. After reading several reviews, we were expecting an extremely tiny room. Although there was no dresser for your clothes & the closet was tiny, the room size was decent. The king size bed was so comfortable! The view from our room was nothing - we opened the shades to a brick wall, but we weren't in our room much. This hotel is in walking distance to a lot of attractions - 10 mins to Empire State Building, 20 mins to Times Square. We even walked to the United Nations & Ground Zero. On our arrival day, we were expecting to store our bags because we knew we were early, but luckily they had a room for us to check in. There was no laundry room in this hotel, but there's a hotel 2 mins from here that does have one - we 'borrowed' it one morning. The front desk gave us directions to one that was about 6 mins away, but when we got there - it was closed, even though they should have been open for 2 hours already. So we just walked into the other hotel & used their laundry facility. We were there during their high season, so no discount on hotel rates. Even though we paid rack for 7 nights, it was definitely worth it. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: shcol
Reviews.Content: location is the best thing here. The hotel is perfectly adequate for a few days and was quite busy with a varied crowd from business types to students. Clean enough place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Herald Square Hotel for a week in November 2005. We did not have high expectations before we arrived as we knew the hotel was at the budget end of spectrum. We were given a recently renovated room. When we saw the room we were pleasantly suprised. It was well fitted out, the bed was excellent, the bathroom was small but clean and nice. The room also had good heating, air conditioning and a flat screen T.V. The hotel does not have any bells and whistles, but the staff are polite and the location is excellent in Mid-Town. The room exceeded our expectations, especially for the price. We spent one night at the nearby Gershwin Hotel and thought that the Herald Square was better value (it was cheaper when we stayed) and the room much nicer. I would be more than happy to stay at the Herald Square again.

Reviews.Title: “great value, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value, right in the heart of New York, 5 mins from Madison Sq Garden, Empire State,and subway station. Its clean, safe and the price is the best in the city, particularly for such a central location. The room we had wasn't as small as we were led to expect from some of the reviews - plenty of room for 2 people and bags with a very comfortable bed and large bathroom. Dont expect a luxury stayi.e. no free coffee, showercaps or shampoo - but do expect a hotel with value and comfort. I highly recommend and would definitely stay here again even in preference to a more swish hotel, due to its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Herald Sq. Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: weedmnreap
Reviews.Content: On a budget? Stay here! Extreemly clean, very helpful staff, very safe location, and right off Broadway! The budget price allowed us to enjoy so many more sights in NYC! The beds were SO comfy! We weren't looking for high class, just a clean safe place to rest our weary bodies, and this was it! Close quarters, but plenty big enough. Bring your own shampoo, and if you're a tourist, we highly recommend the New York Pass, get it at Planet Hollywood. This hotel has character! Not much street noise either.

Reviews.Title: “We Love NYC and the Herald Square Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bluenoser333
Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends stayed at the Herald Square Hotel for three nights the first of December and we have only great things to say about it! It was the first time any of us had visited New York City so we wanted to see and do as much as possible in our four days, so we were not in our room very much but the time spent there was perfect for four women on a shopping/site seeing excursion. Actually this was not our first choice for a hotel (it wasn't even suggested by the travel agent or in any travel info we had received), but since almost everything else was booked for this time of year we booked it as soon as we located it on the internet. We were afraid that only paying $189.00/night we would end up being in a less than desirable hotel, but this was not the case at all. Our room was a perfect size for the four of us and all our luggage and shopping bags. The bathroom was just a good size but it was without a vanity so there was no place to keep our toiletries. This will definitely be the place to stay for us when we are lucky enough to return to NYC. Very friendly staff (so friendly we treated them with candy from home each day), awesome beds - so comfy we didn't want to get up mornings, lots of clean towels and hot water too. Our window opened for fresh air at night and we had no problem with noise - we actually couldn't believe we were in New York City! We didn't get to watch much TV but loved being able to check the weather station each morning when getting ready. There was even a safe available in each room. The elevators were a tad slow but we spent our time browsing the huge assortment of tourist brochures they had available. We also appreciated the small lounge area with telephones and internet hook up. We took advantage of the lockers for our luggage since we arrived at 7am on a Sunday morning. The staff helped us lock up our luggage until later in the day when our room was available. We loved being around the corner from Macy's and the Manhattan Mall. We walked almost everywhere we wanted to go (Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue, etc.) but after leaving the Broadway shows at night we easily caught a cab for only $2 each (including the tip). We were even around the corner from one of the designated stops for the Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour. We certainly recommend the Herald Square Hotel to anyone looking for a very reasonably priced, clean and friendly hotel right in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since moving to Washington, DC over 10 years ago (and being a native New Yorker for most of my life); I look forward (with great anticipation) to my annual Christmas trip to The Big Apple. My girlfriend and I do the entire tourist thing; reliving old days. Rockerfeller Center; the Christmas Tree; Times Square (boy have they cleaned that up), The Palm, Santa at Macyâ€™s and the list goes on. Two years ago we discovered The Herald Squareâ€”and after 3 or 4 stays itâ€™s become home for both of us during the holidays. This year a few extra surprises awaited; we were used to the comfortable beds and the finely appointed bathrooms; but a widescreen TV and DVD player in the room were absolute bonuses. We walked everywhere; nothing was too far away. The Herald Square is a great choice, when you want to save your money for the other things that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Halfway House or Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a "small single with bathroom," and thought I was prepared for a minimal room. But it was a cell, really. The tiny window looked out on an air shaft. The room was unbearably hot and the air quality was terrible. Thankfully there was an air conditioner; otherwise, I simply could not have survived in there. I should say that I paid $90 the week before Christmas -- a time when rooms in other hotels are either unavailable or inflated in price. And I would imagine that the double rooms are more bearable. But the hotel felt more like a half-way house than a hotel, and it's not an experience I would wish to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price and ubication”
Reviews.Author: Ohhyeah
Reviews.Content: IÂ´m glad I read some reviews before and took the decission to stay at Herald Square. We rented a room for 4 and it was just perfect. ItÂ´s not a 5 star, but itÂ´s very clean, quiet and safe. ItÂ´s perfectly well ubicated (3 blocks from empire state and 11 to times square). I recommend it to everyone who wants to save some $$ and do more things in NY. STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over the last 15 years we've stayed in many Theater District hotels, and we've seen it all. We've stayed in 1) just-the-basics hotels with surly staff and tiny rooms, 2) overpriced boutique hotels with surly staff, tiny rooms and designer knobs on the faucets, 3) amenity-laden hotels with nice rooms and friendly staff, but as soon as the owners figure out how treasured the place is, the rates go up, and 4) dives. That brings us to the doorstep of Harold Square Hotel. Thanks to the positive reviews at TripAdvisor, we decided to give Herald Square a try. We were not disappointed. Yes, a glass wall greets you and you have to be to buzzed into the bare-bones lobby. Yes, you may share a midday elevator with a 50-something businessman and his young bubble-gum-snapping escort. (Why are stereotypes always true?) Yes, you have to walk a ways to get to Broadway shows. However, the staff is responsive. The hotel is clean. Our bed was comfortable. The bathroom is gigantic by NYC standards. We enjoyed our visit, and you can't beat the price. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “How many times in one night can your sleep be ruined????”
Reviews.Author: danadoxie
Reviews.Content: Got back to the hotel around midnight. Just wanted to get some sleep before a day of shopping. I turn in but my boyfriend wanted to read and had the overhead lights on above the bed. However, these lights buzzed so loud, and the lights were only about 4 inches above the pillow on the wall which also served as the headboard, that I couldnt stand the noise and he turned them off. As I tried to sleep again I noticed an even louder buzzing, like I had my head on top of a Boeing 747. I wondered if maybe I was sleeping on top of some kind of generator room. It turned out that the street light of the hotel was attached to the wall right outside our front window. The humming and buzzing were so loud, I swear I could feel the walls vibrate. Of course the light was shining in our room from the sign. All it needed was to be blinking to give us that seedy hotel room from a 50's B movie affect. Managed to fall asleep after I untangled myself from the non fitted bed sheet only to be awakened around 2:30 by a bunch of girls coming in the room across ours, followed by a party. Why the guests had to bang on the door I'll never know. A knock would have sufficed - it's not like no one in the room would hear since it's about the size of a closet. But bang away they did, each guest as they showed up through the hour. Clanging beer bottled and loud talking about who threw up in the limo and who was gonna punch who out....it was at this point I plugged my ears with tissue. What I couldnt figure out is why the person at the front desk would let all these people in at 2:30 in the AM. Mercifully the party left but returned an hour later with more people than before. After the party wound down, I FINALLY fell asleep again only to be woken up at around 5AM by the sound of the heat being turned on for some inexplicable reason. I could hear all the radiators throught the building clanging and banging as they were turned on, which made no sense since it was about 65 degrees outside. At this point I threw in the towel and just stayed awake. I was beat tired the rest of the day and my Sunday in NYC was ruined. How do you operate a hotel like this? The bed sheets weren't fitted and entwined your legs the minute you moved around, the window was unable to be opened or closed, the bathroom had a small ledge under the door that I must have bumped into ten times, the walls were paper thin....people always say on the forum "what's the big deal if it's a cheap hotel, who stays in their room anyway?" but I'm so sorry I didnt spend the extra money for a nicer hotel, because I only had one weekend in NYC, and with no sleep, I wasnt able to do what I wanted to do that Sunday. Thanks for nothing Herald Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Nice Staff.”
Reviews.Author: OggyDoggy
Reviews.Content: Considering New york city hotel prices, the Herald Square hotel can't be beat. I was a little shocked at the half painted hallways and just how bare the rooms were, but I really dont think there is any grounds for complaint given the price. The furnishings are shabby but adequate. The room was quite bare, but clean. I did not suspect bugs or rodents (and I'm a total nutter about those things, If theres a bug in the room, I can feel it in me bones, aaarr). As a clean freak, I had no complaints. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the sidewalk, which was very noisy and had no view, plus we were under the awnings and had no natural light. But then again we did not come to New York to spend time in a hotel room, so who cares? When checking out, the very nice man at the front desk acknowledged that we got one of the poorer rooms in the hotel and promised to take care of us the next time we stay. It was nice of him to say that, he didnt have to, as we did not complain. I would stay here again. Just dont expect anything over basic and you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The great thing is that once you have read that the rooms are really small, you are prepared. And the rooms were really small. But at USD 100 per night, I got a nice clean room, with AC and an attached bath. For a single guy, who is not going to practice salsa in his room, this is an excellent value. A block from MACY's, it is conveniently located to some of the best restaurants. Subway is a minute's walk. Laundry is a block away. A must stay for the budget minded, who would rather spend on the attractions outside !!

Reviews.Title: “very nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: masqueofreason
Reviews.Content: Great price, excellent value! Great Location-2 blocks from the empire state building, a short walk to Penn station and Madison Square Garden. staff was very friendly, room was very clean and neat. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Manchester_UK
Reviews.Content: We knew we were taking a risk, booking a budget hotel in Central Manhattan, but we were pleasantly surprised. The room is cosy without being pokey - adequate room for a couple and two suitcases. The room came with Sky, so I could watch both Premiership Football and Baseball. The bathroom was tiny, but private, clean and with fresh towels daily. The air con was slightly noisy, but the room was sheltered from the noises of the street and dark enough to sleep plenty. Of my three trips to NYC this was the best value hotel accomodation I've had. Next time we come back I think we'll probably go back; it's 3 blocks from Macys, Empire State Building and Penn Station, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - no complaints at all!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tobe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and have absolutely no complaints at all. The staff on the front desk were helpful, friendly and efficient. Security is fantastic, guests are buzzed in at the front door to the lobby. Internet kiosk and vending machines in lobby along with tons of tourist information - very convenient. Our room was well lit, fairly spacious, modern and came with the comfiest of beds and a flat screen TV (a lot nicer than the Beacon Hotel where we have previously stayed in NY). The location of the hotel was excellent, 3-4 minutes from Penn Station and Madisson Square Gardens, 5 minutes from Herald Square shopping centre and 3-4 minutes to Subway Stations and Postal Office. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those of us who really don't want to spend $2000 a night. A hotel is where you sleep, not where you live, so the darkeness was fine. The window had a nice view of some old buildings that I managed to get a good sketch of. I'd stay here again. It was in the center of Manhatten and ideal for walking and seeing the sights. The staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1954DC0209
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at this hotel from Sept 13-15th on vacation in N.Y. I found my room to be good size for N.Y. It was very clean and everything worked. My only complaint was when I made my reservation I asked for a smoking room when I arrived I found out they had gone smoke-free as of Aug. 1st. I would of liked to have been notified of this so I could have made other arrangements. But it was fine since I was out most of the time anyway. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for affordable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend in NYCity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to everything but our mothers were wary of the city. My mom heard about the hotel from a friend and insisted that we book there. It was a good choice for us. We were able to walk everywhere without getting on public transportation..the room was very clean and bright. We felt comfortable and safe. The staff answered all our questions and helped us with directions. I would recommend it to people in their twenties who are looking for a decent, safe, and very reasonably priced room in expensive NYC. I even got a care package (what my mom calls it) from the front desk since I'd forgotten my toothbrush. Definitely would return....

Reviews.Title: “location is everything”
Reviews.Author: susiewonder
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from staying in this little gem of a hotel in new york. we were there for 4 nights and i have to say that if you want a central hotel near to time square, macys and the 34th shopping area then this is the one for you. the rooms are very clean and yes they are not huge, but for all the time you spend in them, they are perfect for what we needed. the hotel was safe and very quiet at night which was also an advantage. the central location is a real plus and the staff where very helpful when we arrived, theuy even gave my husband the choice of two rooms. overall herald square is great and a budget place to stay so if you want to stay in a cheaper hotel in a great area...stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “I suspected rodents!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didnâ€™t cost a lot so didnâ€™t expect a lot. I draw the line at rodents in the rooms. Had some chocolate in a bag and it was fairly well nibbled by the time I left. Also the view from my room was just plain hideous (although Im sure those at the front of the hotel experience better). The bed-cover way pretty shabby too and also looked like it had been â€˜attackedâ€™ by some small mammal. I am pretty well conditioned to living in squalor so I didnâ€™t complain but would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here 3 times, looking foward to the 4th.”
Reviews.Author: DrGonzoNOLA
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews from other users on this site, I decided to give this hotel a try. I arrived expecting to find a small but comfortable and clean room. This is exactly what I found, and then some. The room was extremely clean, had a safe in the room, and was very quiet. The staff at the front desk is very nice, and helpfull, and even allowed me check in at 10am, 5 hours before regular check in, at no additional charge( I wouldn't expect this all the time, but I guess I got lucky and they had my room ready early). The location of the hotel is great, and close to everything you need. Several subway stations are within walking distance, as is the HUGE Macy's. One of the highlights to any of my trips to New York is a venture to the top of the Empire State Building, and you guessed it, it's only a stones throw away!. Literally about a 3-4 minute walk. Lot's of pizza joints all over, as well as some decent Bars/Pubs. Several deli type stores dot the corners and are along the streets, with a great selection of drinks, and things to snack on. There is also a Dwayne Reed Pharmacy about a block and a half away. You are also right in the heart of what i am now calling "Little Korea", so if you enjoy Korean food, you're in big time luck. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant on site, which many people might find a bad thing, but really people, YOU'RE in NYC!! get out and find some of the great food they have there. The bottom line is this. If you are someone that needs to be pampered, and waited on hand and foot, then this hotel *might not* be for you. If you are looking for a cheap, and clean room in the middle of everything, this hotel is definatly for you. This hotel doesn't offer all the amenities that other ones do, like shampoo and a toothbrush, but honestly, who doesn't travel with these things? I will definitely be staying here again and again. Who could pass up a sweet room in Downtown Manhattan for $90 a night?

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & Helpful People”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed here for the week of the fourth. The room was small, but comfortably accommodated four women & all of our belongings. There was a lot of construction going on outside, but the hotel itself was clean. The room was clean and was kept clean every day. The location was convenient for our daily outings. The staff was friendly and very helpful with giving directions. The beds and pillows were comfortable. It was very quiet at night. We did have to leave a deposit for the iron, but it was returned at the end of our stay. We plan to stay here on our return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying again.”
Reviews.Author: BostonAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Herald Square for the first time in March. Was somewhat concerned about the appearance of the lobby and reservation desk being behind glass. I had not been to NY in years, thought this might be something new regarding safety. My daughter and I were in NYC to explore the NYU option on her prospective college list. After a long day of non-stop walking around Washington Square, it was a pleasure to rest on such comfortable beds! Our room was small, but very clean, and we felt safe. I'll stay at the Herald again in the future to visit my daughter at NYU, especially now that our family is on an extemely tight budget!

Reviews.Title: “On an island”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the rest of the hotel is like, but I got to stay in one of the newly refurbished first floor rooms(a manager recommended it). The decor was "island like" enhanced by a shuttered window that gave the impression of being far away from the hustle and bustle of the city outside. I returned from shopping and sank into a feather covered bed that made it possible for me to nap so long that I almost missed dinner with my friends whom I hadn't seen in years. And this from someone who has trouble sleeping! The bathroom had all the necessary amenities and the LCD screen in the room just put the crowning touch on the reasonably priced accomodations. I don't think you can find better value in the city. I certainly plan to return on my next visit from Arizona. Thank you Heral Square

Reviews.Title: “Best value in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I came back from a four night stay at the Herald Square a couple of weeks ago and I wasn't disappointed in the slightest. During a slight mix up with payment procedures the staff were lovely and couldn't have been more helpful during the holiday. Although the hotel is basic, it's incredibly clean - the towels and bedding are changed every day - and things that you'd often pay extra for (safe, air con etc.) are free. The location couldn't be better - smack bang between Broadway and 5th Ave and about 5 mins from Times Square. I felt safe and looked after the whole time and wouldn't hesitate to book the Herald Square for future trips to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Best Cheap Place to Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: tibetanpeachpie
Reviews.Content: Herald Sq. Hotel is my favourite place to stay when I travel to NYC. I've been there at least a dozen times and it can't be beat. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, and the location is fantastic. I have never encountered a rodent (as stated in the previous review), and doubt that there are any... the place is way too clean and the staff is way too diligent.

Reviews.Title: “Remembering the Herald Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think we've finally found a hotel that meets all our needs for NYC. It was close enough to the city that we could walk to most of our destinations, the room wasn't overly large, but fit our criteria. The bathroom was a little cramped, but enough to shower and everything. The staff was friendly and accomidating. All and all a great stay and will definatly be staying there again. Nice clean affordable rooms, you can't go wrong at the Herald Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Bargain Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought that overall this was a perfectly fine stay for the resonable rate of $134 a night. The queen bed was wonderful, with a big fluffy white comforter and springy new pillows. The bathroom was clean and stocked with enough towels and washcloths. When we first checked into our room, we discovered that the in-room safe was broken (we needed it for my travel partner's laptop). The staff at the front desk gave us a new room, which I thought was very nice since they weren't obligated to do so. The new room was identical but in mirror image, and the safe functioned as it should. There was a hissy radiator that worried my partner, but all radiators hiss, and I slept on that side since it's not an issue for me. It didn't keep him awake. We'd been warned of possible construction noise outside on Saturday morning, but when we came rolling in at 3:00 AM, we fell fully asleep that we must have missed any particularly severe noise. The late-night desk clerk gets extra points -- we were starving after a night out and I vexed him for any names of all-night food places that deliver. He tried very hard to find the list that the day clerks keep, couldn't find it but looked up an all night pizza place for me in the phone book. (OK, Pizza Hut, but he tried). In the lobby they have an internet pod, $1 for 5 minutes if I remember correctly. This was very helpful to me. The lobby itself is roomy and has tables and chairs for guests on their way in or out. I saw a large family with a ton of luggage making good use of them. This hotel is not ritzy by any measure, but is very much like the small family owned hotels I stay at in Europe. All in all, a great value for your travel dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Considering the price--”
Reviews.Author: h8sbush
Reviews.Content: For $159.00 (including taxes!) we got a clean, quiet room with a confortable bed and a spotless bathroom. The staff was very helpful and the location (within an easy walk, with bags, from Penn Station). However, if one is looking for any more than a place to leave your bags and spend the night, you will be disappointed as there are no "amenities". Frankly I'd much rather spend the money I'm saving on amenities of my own choosing!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a tiny single room. It was clean, well serviced and all the staff were helpful and efficient. Location is convenient, although immediate surrounds are not very attractive. The main thing is that it was very cheap. I have stayed at some terrible cheap places in New York over the years, but this place was okay and, at least for a single, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: febuary 7 2005 we spent a girls weekend in new york,first time in new york. we really ejoyed our room, it was very nice, staff were really nice. I will stay again when i visit ny again. It is close to alot things. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Herold Square Hotel, As good as it can be...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: And getting better all the time! This is a place that is worth staying at, if only for the historical context and archieve it contains. Life magazine historical covers all over the place. I'm enervated by the continual effort being made to upgrade and modernize the facility. The staff is first rate, and frankly, I've stayed in hotels all over the U.S., Canada, and Europe, and find the staff here to be as friendly and attentive as any, any where else. Additionally, the central NYC location is a big plus. Combined with the reasonable cost of a night's stay, its an unbeatable experience. The room was immaculate, the bathroom spotless, the bed comfortable, and the flat panel TV a real plus. I can't think of a single reason to not stay there, and I will every time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “good price, great location and that's all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: when my friend and i arrived at the hotel i almost fainted! the lobby is a total disaster but i guess this is because of refurbishment works. once we got to the room we felt much better (despite the orrible curtains, carpet and decoration!). the room was clean, confortable bed and powerful shower. Regarding the staff, i am afraid they are very rude and not always helpful. this hotel is perfect if you are really tight and on a budget. personally i will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean cheap excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the herald in August 04 staying in room 10, the room was small but clean with on suite and air con. Because the hotel is located pretty much in the centre of Manhatten, it's ideal for anything an everything you want to do(eating out/Theatre/sightseeing). Staff are very poilte and helpfull, and I think it's one of the few hotels where you can smoke in your room.

Reviews.Title: “LIKED IT.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I normall stay at The Wolcott across the street,had seen Herald Square on my previous visits so decided to give it a go. The staff are really nice and helpful,the hotel is very clean.The rooms reflect the price you pay,you have heat (I VISIT IN WINTER), a bathroom and a bed,what more do you want? I take a travel kettle to have a cuppa when I wake up, but plenty of nearby places to get food and drink, a stones throw from Empire State Building. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “worst room ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room was small and faced an enclosed air shaft...when I asked for another room the service given had to be the worst I have ever experienced in any hotel or city I visited..I would advise to stay clear of this hotel...It made my NYC experience less than enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Quality budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC just last weekend with my 2 friends and stayed at the Herald Square. The location isn't as good as it was said to be, nothing much around the block and it takes around 25 - 35 minutes to walk to Times Square. The subway stations are at least 4 blocks away, which is quite a walk considering the size of Manhattan. But the hotel itself was quite something. It's clean, spacious, well-equipped and comfortable. If you expect a nice view then that's one of the few things they don't have. Otherwise, you can expect to find all necessities there, a tv, a comfy bed, a very clean bathroom w/ bathtub, an in-room safe, a large closet and lots of lights. of course, this is a budget hotel, the staff can't be as polite as the ones in the Plaza, but their advices are useful and they are very efficient in helping guests. i would have given this hotel a 4.5 if i could, but a 4 is more like it considering the location isn't as good as ppl say

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Herald THIS Square!!”
Reviews.Author: PMattLA
Reviews.Content: Horrible from start to finish. Just horrible. If Elvis were alive today, he would perform "In The Ghetto" live via satellite from this locale. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Like the Herald Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Family memeber and myself have stayed at the Herald Square a number of times (but not in the past two years). I have to say that the place was very good value for money, clean, secure, well located...what more do you want. I'd also recommend the Portland Square Hotel (it's been a while since I stayed there, but on last inspection on the outside it looked ok). Please don't stay in these places if your expectations are 4 star.

HotelInfo.Name: Herald Square Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 19 West 31st Street, New York City, NY 10001
